title: Data Migration Engineer
description: AHEAD builds platforms for digital business. By weaving together advances in cloud infrastructure, automation and analytics, and software delivery, we help enterprises deliver on the promise of digital transformation.<br><br>At AHEAD, we prioritize creating a culture of belonging, where all perspectives and voices are represented, valued, respected, and heard. We create spaces to empower everyone to speak up, make change, and drive the culture at AHEAD.<br><br>We are an equal opportunity employer, and do not discriminate based on an individual's race, national origin, color, gender, gender identity, gender expression, sexual orientation, religion, age, disability, marital status, or any other protected characteristic under applicable law, whether actual or perceived.<br><br><em><strong>We embrace all candidates that will contribute to the diversification and enrichment of ideas and perspectives at AHEAD. <br><br></strong></em>AHEAD is looking for Data Migration Engineer to work closely with our dynamic project teams (both on-site and remotely). This Data Migration Engineer will be responsible for providing technical expertise to help organizations design, architect, and implement large database migrations, generally from on-premises systems to cloud-based solutions.<br><br>The consultant will have to have previous experience guiding migrations from technical perspective. Examples would be migrating existing MSSQL server environment with 20 to 200 servers to Azure. They should have the experience recommend tools to assist the migration, and the technical skills to operate them.<br><br>This consultant will architect, design, build, and support modern data environments that reside in the public cloud or multi-cloud enterprise architectures. They will be expected to be hands-on, but also be client-facing and present to leadership.<br><br><strong><u>Responsibilities<br></u></strong><ul><li>Assess existing database environments migration planning</li><li>Design appropriate target architectures in the Cloud platform</li><li>Document design and key technical issues for communication with client engineers</li><li>Integrate solution with data governance monitoring tools</li><li>Knowledgeable about the various platforms used for ingesting, cleansing and transformation of data, both legacy and cloud solutions.</li><li>Engineers and supports data structures including but not limited to SQL and NoSQL databases</li><li>Leverages the right tools for the right job to deliver testable, maintainable, and modern data solutions</li><li>Respond to customer/team inquiries and assist in troubleshooting and resolving challenges</li><li>Works with and guides other scrum team members to estimate and deliver work inside of a sprint</li><li>Research data questions identify root causes and interact closely with business users and technical resources<br></li></ul><strong><u>Qualifications<br></u></strong><ul><li>3+ years of professional technical experience with real world experience migrating existing data environments to the cloud</li><li>Deep understanding of SQL and related technologies</li><li>Experience with building highly scalable Big Data solutions using Hadoop, Spark, stream processing, and Lambda architecture</li><li>Experience in an IT strategy &amp; enterprise architecture / consulting role in an organization that has executed large scale migrations to cloud.</li><li>Proven experience with Cloud infrastructure and security</li><li>Experience implementing complex solutions in large enterprise companies</li><li>Cloud Certification (AWS, Azure, GCP) would be advantageous</li><li>Strong client-facing communication and facilitation skills<br></li></ul><strong><u>Key Skills<br></u></strong><ul><li>Organizing and running complex data migrations to the cloud (AWS, Azure, GCP)</li><li>Data Migration tools (Striim, iSpirer, DVT)</li><li>Migvisor</li><li>Traditional data environment (OLAP/OLTP servers, ETL platforms)</li><li>Cloud Data Services</li><li>Oracle or MSSQL, NoSQL, ETL/ELT, Spark, Data Warehouse, Data Lake, Snowflake<br></li></ul><strong><u>Why AHEAD<br><br></u></strong>Through our daily work and internal groups like Moving Women AHEAD and RISE AHEAD, we value and benefit from diversity of people, ideas, experience, and everything in between.<br><br>We fuel growth by stacking our office with top-notch technologies in a multi-million-dollar lab, by encouraging cross department training and development, sponsoring certifications and credentials for continued learning.<br><br>We understand that you have a life outside of work. That’s why we offer flexible paid time off, paid company holidays, and the ability for you to manage your work schedule as needed.

That’s why we offer flexible paid time off, paid company holidays, and the ability for you to manage your work schedule as needed.

serve as the focal point for infrastructure-related issue / crisis resolutionSee opportunities to save costs and more effectively handle assetsEnsure communication of process and procedure changes to key stakeholdersDesign an effective test plan for any new / changed infrastructure technology and work with Project Managers, QA / TestingManagers and Release Managers to ensure its implementation before the client takes possession of the systemSupport identification and collection of metrics and performance reporting processesMonitors delivery against SLAs and reports exceptions to managementParticipate in process improvement initiatives, when applicableBusiness PartnershipMaintain contact with the business users to proactively identify needed changesEstablish working relationships with technical, business and sourcing counterpartsParticipate in process improvement initiativesPeople ManagementHandle individual workload and deliver to agreed upon milestonesProactively promote consistent project-based performance measurement and skill development of junior staffActively participate in HR performance measurement processesDemonstrate ability to work in team environment and help resolve issuesProvide input to staffing plans at the project-level to identify key / required skillsQualificationsCollege degree in related technical / business areas or equivalent work experienceUnderstanding of the technology organization and / or business and technologyRe-engineering / process improvement experience, leading and coaching quality improvement projectsStrong change management skills; title: Infrastructure Engineer
description: Salary: $130k-$145k + bonus<p><br></p>Location: Hybrid role in either location<p><br></p>Chicago, IL/Dallas, TX<p><br></p><strong><u>Qualifications</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Bachelor's or Master's Degrees in Computer Science, Information Systems or other related field. Or equivalent work experience.</li><li>Minimum of 5-8 years of experience in Site Reliability Engineering/DevOps</li><li>Experience managing infrastructure in public cloud environments like AWS (preferred), Azure or GCP.</li><li>Experience providing visibility using monitoring and alerting tools like Splunk, SignalFx, AppDynamics, Datadog, ELK, Prometheus or Grafana.</li><li>Experience with container orchestration systems like Kubernetes, Mesos, Docker Swarm or Rancher.</li><li>Experience with infrastructure as code and configuration management tools like Terraform, Ansible, Puppet or Chef.</li><li>Programming/Scripting experience in languages like Java, Bash, Python or Go.</li><li>Experience with distributed messaging systems like Kafka, RabbitMQ, or ActiveMQ.</li><li>Experience with using Continuous Integration and Continuous Delivery (CI/CD) tools like Jenkins, Travis, Harness, Spinnaker, Appveyor, CodeBuild or CodePipeline.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Responsibilities</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Collaborate with development, operations and infrastructure teams to ensure availability of services, and to work through implementation issues.</li><li>Develop automation for incident response and to prevent problem recurrence</li><li>Create and enhance runbooks to respond to service outages or degradations</li><li>Assess the production readiness of services</li><li>Define and track operational metrics for production performance, reliability, scalability and availability</li><li>Architect, develop and maintain shared services and tools to improve reliability and reduce toil across the organization</li><li>Contribute to the team's continuous improvement through research, retrospectives, discussion groups and code reviews</li><li>Provide leadership within the team by guiding and mentoring junior members, and preparing stories for the sprint backlog</li></ul>

title: Site Reliability Engineer
description: <p><span><strong>MOTIVATED…..make IT happen!<br><br></strong></span></p><p><br><br></p><p><span><strong><em><span>Sentinel Technologies, Inc. has been rated a top workplace every year since 2012!<br><br></span></em></strong></span></p><p> <br><br></p><p><span><strong><span>About Us:       <br><br></span></strong></span></p><p><span><strong>Sentinel</strong> delivers solutions that can efficiently address a range of IT needs - from security, to communications, to systems &amp; networks, to software applications, to cloud and managed services; all of which include our staffing solutions for our clients. Since 1982, Sentinel has grown from providing technology maintenance services to our current standing as one of the leading IT services and solutions provider in the US. We have aligned with many of today’s global technology leaders including Cisco, Dell, VMware and Microsoft. Sentinel services customers both nationally and internationally with primary support operating centers in Downers Grove (HQ), Chicago, and Springfield, IL; Phoenix, AZ.; Detroit, Lansing, and Grand Rapids, MI; Milwaukee, WI; Denver, CO; and Fort Lauderdale, FL. <br><br></span></p><p><span> <br><br></span></p><p><span>If you are MOTIVATED… you can make IT happen at Sentinel. Our commitment to our employees is to create a work environment that encourages creativity, an entrepreneurial spirit, fosters growth through certification and hands-on training, and values a team-oriented culture with rewards based on impact! <br><br></span></p><p><span> <br><br></span></p><p><span>If you share our passion about what technology can do and want to be part of a top workplace environment - we’d like to have you join our team.  Learn more at <span>www.sentinel.com/careers</span>. <br><br></span></p><p><span> <br><br></span></p><p><span>As part of Sentinel's employment process, candidates will be required to complete a background check. Only those who meet the minimum requirements will be contacted. No phone calls please.<br><br></span></p><p><span> <br><br></span></p><p><span>Sentinel is proud to be an equal opportunity/affirmative action employer committed to a diverse and inclusive work environment. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, national origin, age, marital status, genetics, disability, pregnancy, veteran status or any other basis protected by law.<br><br></span></p><p><span> <br><br></span></p><p><span>If you are an individual with a disability and need assistance in applying for a position, please contact SentinelHR1@sentinel.com.<br><br></span></p><p> <br><br></p><p><span>JFNDNP<br><br></span></p><p> <br><br></p><p><span><span>Sentinel is looking for an Information Technology Engineer to join our client. The ideal candidate should be a self starter that can jump into troubleshooting issues and provide feedback if devices need to be replaced. This candidate should have experience with networking and server application support.  </span><strong><span>This is a 12 month contract opportunity providing onsite support at our client site in Woodridge, IL. <br><br></span></strong></span></p><p> <br><br></p><ul><li><span>Experience with routers and switches is required</span></li><li><span>Experience with server application support is required</span></li><li><span>Experience with desktop support is required</span></li><li><span>Experience with Cloud, Azure and O365 is required</span></li><li><span>Experience with wireless cameras is a plus</span></li><li><span>The candidate must have a car, as this position requires travel between location and the transportation of equipment </span></li><li><span>A valid driver’s license and proof of vehicle insurance will be required</span></li><li><span>Legally authorized to work in the US without sponsorship</span></li><li><span>Must demonstrate a “can-do” attitude</span></li></ul><p><span> <br><br></span></p><p><span>We focus on candidates that display our “ACE” factor - Attitude, Compassion, and Enthusiasm to deliver quality solutions with exceptional customer service.<br><br></span></p><p><span> <br><br></span></p><p><span><strong>What you get:<br><br></strong></span></p><p><span>We offer weekly competitive pay, medical, dental, vision, 401K and more.<br><br></span></p>

title: Information Technology Engineer
description: At Northrop Grumman, our employees have incredible opportunities to work on revolutionary systems that impact people's lives around the world today, and for generations to come. Our pioneering and inventive spirit has enabled us to be at the forefront of many technological advancements in our nation's history - from the first flight across the Atlantic Ocean, to stealth bombers, to landing on the moon. We look for people who have bold new ideas, courage and a pioneering spirit to join forces to invent the future, and have fun along the way. Our culture thrives on intellectual curiosity, cognitive diversity and bringing your whole self to work - and we have an insatiable drive to do what others think is impossible. Our employees are not only part of history, they're making history. Northrop Grumman Mission Systems (NGMS) is seeking Systems Engineering, Integration and Test (SEIT) engineers and principal engineers for Modeling &amp; Simulation at our Rolling Meadows / Arlington Heights, IL location. The selected candidates will report to the SEIT Department in the Multi-Spectral Solutions Department. In Modeling &amp; Simulation, you will develop, integrate, test and analyze complex virtual representations of systems and environments. Responsibilities for a Modeling &amp; Simulation Engineer may include development of simulation code and scripts, design of system models, documentation of model assumptions and performance, test automation, test reports, and execution of integration test activities in virtual environments and/or System Integration Labs (SILs) or offsite locations. As a part of the Systems Engineering Integration &amp; Test (SEIT) team, a modeling &amp; simulation engineer gains an understanding of the Systems Engineering process across a product's lifecycle and gains a full appreciation for how the systems are designed and operate virtually and physically. Your key responsibilities will be to ensure that the models and simulations we make are representative of their physical counterparts and work. Y ou'll be able to apply your knowledge and experience in EOIR systems, optics, RF systems, algorithms, detection and tracking. Basic Qualifications for Systems Engineer: * BS degree in Electrical Engineering, Systems Engineering, or related technical degree with 0-2 years of related experience.<br><ul><li> Demonstrated proficiency in analytical thinking, problem solving skills and Systems Thinking mindset</li><li> Working knowledge of model based systems engineering concepts and practices * Knowledge of MATLAB, C, C++, Java, Python, or other scripting languages * Strong work ethic and the ability to work in an integrated product team (IPT) environment</li><li> Must have ability to obtain Interim Secret clearance prior to start date. Once started, must have the ability to obtain full secret clearance and SAP clearance.Preferred Qualifications:</li><li> Working knowledge of one of more of the following specialty areas for design, integration and test related to EOIR systems, optics, RF systems, algorithms, detection and tracking</li><li> Experience in an abstract modeling environment (Rhapsody, Cameo, UML etc) for complex electronic systems evaluation</li><li> Experience with virtual environments or mission modeling (AFSIM, ATCOM, ONESAF)</li><li> Working knowledge of DOORS and ClearCase/ClearQuest</li><li> Experience performing system verification and validation</li><li> Electronic Warfare experience</li><li> Experience in development and earned value management of cost accounts and schedules as related to Systems Engineering tasks</li><li> Agile development experience a plus</li><li> Ability and willingness to travel 25%</li><li> Active Secret or Top Secret clearance and the ability to obtain a SAP (Special Access Program) clearanceBasic Qualifications for Principal Systems Engineer :</li><li> BS degree in STEM field with 5+ years related experience or MS degree in STEM field with 3+ years of related experience</li><li> Demonstrated proficiency in analytical thinking and problem-solving skills and Systems Thinking mindset</li><li> Knowledge of model based systems engineering concepts and practices</li><li> Knowledge of MATLAB, C, C++, Java, Python, or other scripting languages</li><li> Strong work ethic and the ability to work in an integrated product team (IPT) environment</li><li> Experience in an integration and test environment for complex electronic systems</li><li> Active Secret Clearance Preferred Qualifications for Principal Systems Engineer :</li><li> Experience with real-time signal processing in both firmware and software. Agile experience a plus.</li><li> Knowledge of MATLAB, C, C++, CUDA, VHDL, OpenCL, SysML, Python, or other scripting languages</li><li> Experience with Model Based Engineering (MBE) concepts and tools (Cameo and Rhapsody)</li><li> Working knowledge of DOORS and ClearCase/ClearQuest</li><li> Recent experience creating integration and test, design verification test and flight test plans and procedures</li><li> Experience in an integration and test environment for complex electronic systems evaluation</li><li> Experience in development and earned value management of cost accounts and schedules as related to Systems Engineering tasks</li><li> Working knowledge of one of more of the following specialty areas for integration and test related to Targeting, EOIR/RF systems: sensors/antennas, transmitters/receivers, optics, detection and tracking</li><li> Ability and willingness to travel</li><li> Active Top Secret Clearance is preferred. Salary Range: $81,000 USD - $121,600 USD Salary Range 2: $99,800 USD - $124,800 USD Employees may be eligible for a discretionary bonus in addition to base pay. Annual bonuses are designed to reward individual contributions as well as allow employees to share in company results. Employees in Vice President or Director positions may be eligible for Long Term Incentives. In addition, Northrop Grumman provides a variety of benefits including health insurance coverage, life and disability insurance, savings plan, Company paid holidays and paid time off (PTO) for vacation and/or personal business. The health and safety of our employees and their families is a top priority. The company encourages employees to remain up-to-date on their COVID-19 vaccinations. U.S. Northrop Grumman employees may be required, in the future, to be vaccinated or have an approved disability/medical or religious accommodation, pursuant to future court decisions and/or government action on the currently stayed federal contractor vaccine mandate under Executive Order 14042 https://www.saferfederalworkforce.gov/contractors/ . Northrop Grumman is committed to hiring and retaining a diverse workforce. We are proud to be an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer, making decisions without regard to race, color, religion, creed, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, marital status, national origin, age, veteran status, disability, or any other protected class. For our complete EEO/AA and Pay Transparency statement, please visit http://www.northropgrumman.com/EEO . U.S. Citizenship is required for most positions.</li></ul>
description_json: At Northrop Grumman, our employees have incredible opportunities to work on revolutionary systems that impact people's lives around the world today, and for generations to come. Our pioneering and inventive spirit has enabled us to be at the forefront of many technological advancements in our nation's history - from the first flight across the Atlantic Ocean, to stealth bombers, to landing on the moon. We look for people who have bold new ideas, courage and a pioneering spirit to join forces to invent the future, and have fun along the way. Our culture thrives on intellectual curiosity, cognitive diversity and bringing your whole self to work - and we have an insatiable drive to do what others think is impossible. Our employees are not only part of history, they're making history. Northrop Grumman Mission Systems (NGMS) is seeking Systems Engineering, Integration and Test (SEIT) engineers and principal engineers for Modeling &amp; Simulation at our Rolling Meadows / Arlington Heights, IL location. The selected candidates will report to the SEIT Department in the Multi-Spectral Solutions Department. In Modeling &amp; Simulation, you will develop, integrate, test and analyze complex virtual representations of systems and environments. Responsibilities for a Modeling &amp; Simulation Engineer may include development of simulation code and scripts, design of system models, documentation of model assumptions and performance, test automation, test reports, and execution of integration test activities in virtual environments and/or System Integration Labs (SILs) or offsite locations. As a part of the Systems Engineering Integration &amp; Test (SEIT) team, a modeling &amp; simulation engineer gains an understanding of the Systems Engineering process across a product's lifecycle and gains a full appreciation for how the systems are designed and operate virtually and physically. Your key responsibilities will be to ensure that the models and simulations we make are representative of their physical counterparts and work. Y ou'll be able to apply your knowledge and experience in EOIR systems, optics, RF systems, algorithms, detection and tracking. title: Junior Data Scientist (Remote)
description: <strong>Come join our team for an excellent role! We are looking for a Lead Java Developer<br><br></strong>Cognizant is looking for a<strong> Lead Java Developer </strong>in developing customized product for our clients. The role is expected to drive technology discussions and analyze the current landscape for gaps in addressing business needs. Cognizant needs a motivated individual to challenge the status quo and provide thought leadership/best practices to enhance our current services and technologies.<br><br>An ideal candidate is someone who enjoys working in a fast paced, collaborative environment. Someone that values the “team” and leverages the opinions and expertise of their teammates to deliver quality<br><br><strong>Summary:</strong> The main function of a developer is to develop create and modify general computer applications utilizing <strong>Lead Java Developer. <br><br></strong><strong><u>Responsibilities<br></u></strong><ul><li> Work with the Architect to define Application Integration and Security Design for various components involved.</li><li> Design, development and build of java solution components/modules and integrations</li><li> Hands-on knowledge in technology areas like Core Java, Java8, MicroServices, Web services(SOAP and REST), Spring boot, Spring Frameworks, Spring Data JPA, REST/SOAP services, Spring cloud, Spring MVC, JSON &amp; XML based processing.</li><li> Strong command on Java/J2EE &amp; OOPs concepts and current industry trends. Working knowledge of Java 8/11 new features.</li><li> Working knowledge of cloud-based server less application development on any of cloud platforms like AWS/Azure/GCP.</li><li> Candidates with experience in Cloud native application development experience will be preferred.</li><li> Working knowledge in any of the databases like MongoDB/Oracle/MySQL/SQL Server.</li><li> Working knowledge in any messaging platforms like Apache Kafka/Rabbit MQ/JMS/AWS SQS/Azure Event Hub/Service Bus.</li><li> Production implementation experience for large enterprise applications using Java/J2EE Web services/micro services will be preferred.</li><li> Experience in implementing Web services Security using WS-Security SAML OAUTH2 Kerberos and integrating with Identity providers LDAP and ADFS.</li><li> Experience working with credential vaults will be an add-on.</li><li> Strong knowledge on design and integration patterns especially in applications involving Portals/SSO legacy applications B2B Applications external partners using enterprise service bus.</li><li> Well versed with ensuring coding standards DevOps CI/CD implementations version management branching strategy security principles.</li><li> Ensure code quality and standards are followed. title: IT System Engineer (Windows) – MSP
description: The team is responsible for the process, controls, and tools that support API development, security, publishing, consumption, and monitoring.<p><br></p><ul><li>Competent to perform all programming, project management, and development assignments without close supervision; normally assigned the more complex aspects of systems work.</li><li>Works directly on complex application/technical problem identification and resolution, including responding to off-shift and weekend support calls.</li><li>Works independently on complex systems or infrastructure components that may be used by one or more applications or systems.</li><li>Drives application development focused around delivering business valuable features</li><li>Maintains high standards of software quality within the team by establishing good practices and habits</li><li>Identifies and encourage areas for growth and improvement within the team</li><li>Guide the team to develop a structured application/interface code, new program documentation, operations documentation, and user guides in a casual, flexible environment. Communicate with end-users and internal customers to help direct the development, debugging, and testing of application software for accuracy, integrity, interoperability, and completeness.</li><li>Performs integrated testing and customer acceptance testing of components that requires careful planning and execution to ensure timely, quality results Typical task breakdown:-</li></ul><p><br></p>Work within API Management team, hands-on APIGEE Edge, OAS Spec review, Proxy development-<p><br></p>Reviewing OAS /Swaggers<p><br></p>- Operational-<p><br></p>Developing Proxies on APIGEE-<p><br></p>Developing Automations -<p><br></p>Rotational weekly On Call Support /Incident Management using Service Now.<p><br></p>API Developer

title: Test Engineer
description: <ul><li>This is a hybrid position that will allow qualified candidates to work remotely 2 days per week. **Job SummaryThis position is responsible for creating and supporting useful, well-designed, user-friendly applications, websites workflows, and databases to automate and improve business processes for the departments we serve, utilizing Microsoft Power Automate, Power Apps, SharePoint, Power BI, and other tools in the Microsoft ecosystem. Applications include databases, forms, workflows, and associated metrics and reporting. Departments served by these applications include Enterprise Architecture, Infrastructure, Product Engineering, and other areas under the Client’s Chief Technology Officer.</li></ul><p><br></p>Responsibilities will also include working closely with department leads to understand current business processes and re-engineer them for improved efficiency, defining governance for these processes, defining Key Performance Indicators (KPIs) and other metrics for these processes, generating metrics using application data, and producing metrics dashboards from that data. The individual fulfilling this role must be capable of working closely with customers to build relationships, and continuously gaining a deeper understanding of their needs, opportunities, and pain points; most importantly, this individual must be able to turn those needs into applications that enhance our customers’ everyday work experience.Required Job Qualifications: Bachelor’s Degree and 4 years experience in defining and managing technical processes OR technical degree and 6 years experience defining and managing technical processes OR 8 years experience in defining and managing technical processes.3 years experience creating websites using Microsoft SharePoint.3 years experience creating custom Microsoft SharePoint Lists.1 year experience creating workflows using Microsoft Power Automate or similar workflow tool. **This is a Must Have**1 year experience creating applications using Microsoft Power Apps.**This is a Must Have**Proficiency in process engineering and re-design.Demonstrated experience with customer relationship management.Ability to influence and execute effectively across multiple departments in a matrixed environment.Ability to manage time effectively, prioritize, and make trade-off decisions.Commitment to teamwork and collaboration.Ability to simplify and standardize complex concepts/processes and tie together solutions across systems.Analytical thinking and consultative problem solving/consulting. Microsoft Power Platform Developer

title: API Developer
description: Sargent &amp; Lundy is one of the most experienced full-service architect-engineering firms in the world. Founded in 1891, the firm is a global leader in power and energy with expertise in grid modernization, renewable energy, energy storage, nuclear power, and fossil fuels. Sargent &amp; Lundy delivers comprehensive project services—from consulting, design and implementation to construction management, commissioning and operations/maintenance—with an emphasis on quality and safety. The firm serves public and private sector clients in the power and energy, gas distribution, industrial, and government sectors.<br><br><strong> Our Core Values <br><br></strong>Every decision we make is guided by our core values. By upholding these six principles, we support our clients, employees, and community. They are the compass we follow as we continue to grow our business and lead the industry.<br><br><strong>Quality </strong><strong>– </strong>We provide high-quality deliverables and services through an uncompromising focus on peer review, safety, and continuous improvement.<br><br><strong>Accountability </strong><strong>–</strong> Our actions demonstrate the highest levels of professionalism, integrity, and respect.<br><br><strong>Our People </strong><strong>– </strong>We value diverse perspectives, encourage professional growth, and are committed to providing a work community where people thrive. Our work is challenging but rewarding.<br><br><strong>Our Clients</strong><strong> – </strong>We deliver value and exceed our clients’ expectations through outstanding customer service, personal accessibility, and clear communication.<br><br><strong>Innovation </strong><strong>–</strong> Since 1891, we have invested in the people, training, tools, and technology needed to quickly adapt in a constantly changing world.<br><br><strong>Meaningful Impact </strong><strong>– </strong>We make a positive impact in the communities where we work and live.<br><br><strong><u>Responsibilities<br><br></u></strong>Sargent &amp; Lundy is seeking a highly motivated and collaborative individual like you to join our team! We currently have an opening for an experienced Microsoft Developer to utilize and expand your web-based development skills .<br><br><strong><u>Responsibilities<br></u></strong><ul><li> Collaborate with team other IT professionals and end users in developing code to build and integrate home grown and commercial applications </li><li> Coordinate internal customer requirements, build a programmatic solution, test the deliverable, and document what was done </li><li> Continuously learn and present new techniques learned at Communities of Practice to other development staff </li><li> Evaluate and recommend open source and other add-ins that will shorten development times <br></li></ul><strong><u>Qualifications<br></u></strong><ul><li> Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Computer Information Systems, or related field </li><li> Strong problem solving and excellent verbal/written communication skills to effectively to collaborate with others </li><li> C# and Visual Studio </li><li> HTML, JavaScript, JSON </li><li> Microsoft Azure (Portal and DevOps) </li><li> SOAP and Rest APIs </li><li> SQL Server <br></li></ul><strong><u>Knowledge Of The Following Would Be a Plus<br></u></strong><ul><li> Active Directory </li><li> Power Automate </li><li> Power Apps </li><li> ASP.NET Core Web APIs </li><li> REACT </li><li> Azure functions and APIM </li><li> JAVA using Eclipse <br></li></ul><strong> We do not sponsor employees for work authorization in the U.S. for this position. <br><br></strong>Sargent &amp; Lundy is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability status, protected veteran status, or any protected status as defined by law.

title: Microsoft Power Platform Developer
description: <strong>Discover. A brighter future.</strong><p><br></p>With us, you’ll do meaningful work from Day 1. Our collaborative culture is built on three core behaviors: We Play to Win, We Get Better Every Day &amp; We Succeed Together. And we mean it — we want you to grow and make a difference at one of the world's leading digital banking and payments companies. We value what makes you unique so that you have an opportunity to shine.<p><br></p>Come build your future, while being the reason millions of people find a brighter financial future with Discover.<p><br></p><strong>Job Description:</strong><p><br></p><strong>Employer: </strong>DFS Corporate Services LLC<p><br></p><strong>Job Title</strong>: Infrastructure Engineer (multiple openings)<p><br></p><strong>Job Location:</strong> Riverwoods, Illinois<p><br></p><strong>Job Type:</strong> Full Time<p><br></p><strong>Duties: </strong>Work on holistic engineering deliverables across different stages of the product lifecycle and determine technology patterns for the overall solution. Achieve product commitments (and influence others to do the same) by using informal leadership and highly developed communication skills and contribute to or lead technology communities. Telecommuting and/or working from home may be permissible pursuant to company policies.<p><br></p><strong>Requirements: </strong>Employer will accept a Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, or a related field and 3 years of experience in Database Administrator or related occupation.<p><br></p><strong>Position required skills: </strong>Three (3) years of experience in the job offered or related occupation: working with database performance tuning to improve query performance; performing database upgrades, migration, and patching; utilizing scripting and automation; Working with database high availability and DR replication; working with database security; working with application developers to troubleshoot database issues; and utilizing Oracle Exadata Platform.<p><br></p>Position eligible for incentives under Employee Referral Program<p><br></p><strong>Rate of Pay: </strong><em>The base pay for this position generally ranges between $94,016.00 to $142,500.00. Additional incentives may be provided as part of a market competitive total compensation package. Factors, such as but not limited to, geographical location, relevant experience, education, and skill level may impact the pay for this position. We also offer a range of benefits and programs based on eligibility. Learn more at MyDiscoverBenefits.com.</em><p><br></p><em>QUALIFIED APPLICANTS: Please apply directly through our website by clicking on “Apply Now.” No calls. Equal Opportunity Employer/disability/vet</em>.<p><br></p><strong>Compensation:</strong><p><br></p>The base pay for this position generally ranges between to . Additional incentives may be provided as part of a market competitive total compensation package. Factors, such as but not limited to, geographical location, relevant experience, education, and skill level may impact the pay for this position.<p><br></p><strong><strong><strong>Benefits:</strong></strong></strong><p><br></p>We also offer a range of benefits and programs based on eligibility. These benefits include:<p><br></p><ul><li>Paid Parental Leave</li><li>Paid Time Off</li><li>401(k) Plan</li><li>Medical, Dental, Vision, &amp; Health Savings Account</li><li>STD, Life, LTD and AD&amp;D</li><li>Recognition Program</li><li>Education Assistance</li><li>Commuter Benefits</li><li>Family Support Programs</li><li>Employee Stock Purchase Plan</li></ul><p><br></p>Learn more at MyDiscoverBenefits.com.<p><br></p>What are you waiting for? Apply today!<p><br></p>All Discover employees place our customers at the very center of our work. To deliver on our promises to our customers, each of us contribute every day to a culture that values compliance and risk management.<p><br></p>Discover is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Discover is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, protected veteran status, or other legally protected status. (Know Your Rights)

description: <strong>Description<br><br></strong>STV has provided rail engineering services to Class 1 railroads, short line, commuter, light rail, rapid transit, and industrial railroad clients for more than 40 years. Services include design of track, facilities, railroad structures; track and bridge inspection; environmental permitting; third-party public project management; construction management; emergency engineering response; design-build design and program management; and other services.<br><br>Our team is made up of highly skilled rail professionals, many of whom are former employees of operating railroads. This firsthand experience working to design and maintain active rail systems uniquely equips our team to develop innovative solutions to a wide variety of rail projects.<br><br>We are seeking a Project Manager to join our robust Rail team in Chicago. Our ideal candidate will be an experienced rail professional with strong technical design background and a desire to lead design teams and interact with clients. This position would have the opportunity to lead freight and passenger rail projects both locally in the Chicago region and across the country.<br><br>This Project Manager will be a seller/doer position with duties consisting of managing all parts of phase 1 and phase 2 design projects, resource planning, assisting in business development, client engagement and proposal preparation. We are looking for a project manager who is experienced in the Chicago market and is looking to join a team with a deep local bench of technical design staff and bolster a national practice of talented rail professionals.<br><br><strong>Responsibilities<br></strong><ul><li>Lead and manage rail projects from planning through design into construction</li><li> Develop project scope, budget, schedule, and lead client contract negotiations</li><li> Work with and provide guidance to technical engineering staff ranging from junior to senior level</li><li> Ability to assist and execute technical tasks including developing technical reports, designs, specifications, and project related presentations</li><li> Work closely with other project managers and group leads within the Rail Division to plan resources and manage internal workshare</li><li> Assist and lead in developing client capture plans and pursuit win plans, proposals, and other business development and client engagement activities</li><li> Ability to meet with client and public stakeholders and perform site visits in field as necessary<br><br></li></ul><strong>Qualifications<br></strong><ul><li>Professional Engineering (P.E.) license preferred</li><li> Bachelor’s Degree in Civil Engineering</li><li> Minimum 10 years of experience in design and/or planning rail projects</li><li> Prior experience managing projects</li><li> Strong background in rail projects and working knowledge of rail power, communications, signaling, and structural systems</li><li> Excellent interpersonal and communication skills with desire to work closely with clients and other stakeholders outside of technical engineering teams</li><li> Desire to work on large multi-disciplinary rail projects with fast paced schedules which require creative thinking and innovative problem-solving skills<br><br></li></ul>Don’t meet every single requirement? Studies have shown that women and people of color are less likely to apply to jobs unless they meet every single qualification. At STV, we are fully committed to expanding our culture of diversity and inclusion, one that will reflect the clients we serve and the communities we work in, so if you’re excited about this role but your past experience doesn’t align perfectly with every qualification in the job description we encourage you to apply anyways. You may be just the right candidate for this or other roles.<br><br>STV offers the following benefits<br><ul><li> Health insurance, including an option with a Health Savings Account</li><li> Dental insurance</li><li> Vision insurance</li><li> Flexible Spending Accounts (Healthcare, Dependent Care and Transit and Parking where applicable)</li><li> Disability insurance</li><li> Life Insurance and Accidental Death &amp; Dismemberment</li><li> 401(k) Plan</li><li> Retirement Counseling</li><li> Employee Assistance Program</li><li> Paid Time Off (16 days)</li><li> Paid Holidays (8 days)</li><li> Back-Up Dependent Care (up to 10 days per year)</li><li> Parental Leave (up to 80 hours)</li><li> Continuing Education Program</li><li> Professional Licensure and Society Memberships<br><br></li></ul>STV aims to pay fairly and equitable commensurate with experience and capabilities across all of our positions. These pay ranges represent a good faith effort to provide a fair and reasonable expected salary, however, please note that the salary offered for any position may be outside of this range based on selected candidate’s location, experience and capabilities.<br><br>STV is committed to paying all its employees in a fair, equitable, and transparent manner. The following pay ranges are STV’s good-faith salary estimates for every presently available position. Please note that the final salary offered for any position may be outside of this published range based on many factors, including but not limited to geography, education, experience, and/or certifications.<br><br>This list represents all of the currently listed positions as of November 1, 2022.<br><br>Position Title, Good Faith Salary Minimum, Good Faith Salary Maximum<br><br>Accounting title: Infrastructure Engineer (multiple openings) - IHM
description: <strong><u>Description<br><br></u></strong><em>Position at Wind River<br><br></em><strong><u>About Wing River<br><br></u></strong>Wind River is a global leader in delivering software for mission-critical intelligent systems. For more than four decades, the company has been an innovator and pioneer, powering billions of systems that require the highest levels of security, safety, and reliability.<br><br>Wind River helps customers across automotive, aerospace, defense, industrial, medical, and telecommunications industries solve complex technology challenges on their journey toward the new intelligent machine economy.<br><br>The company’s software powers generation after generation of the safest, most secure systems in the world. Examples include playing a key role in NASA space missions — such as Artemis I, the James Webb Space Telescope, and multiple Mars rovers — and in recent 5G milestones — including the world’s first successful 5G data session with Verizon and in building one of the largest Open RAN networks in the world with Vodafone.<br><br>The company has received industry recognition for its technology innovation and leadership, and for its workplace culture, including global Great Place to Work certification and being named a “Top Workplace” for ten consecutive years. If you want to be part of a unique culture where the lived experience is based on our cultural attributes of growth mindset, customer-focus, and diversity, equity, inclusion &amp; belonging, come join us and help advance the future software defined world.<br><br><strong>Why Choose Wind River? <br><br></strong>For almost 40 years, Wind River has been the leading provider of embedded operating systems to the world’s leading developers of mission-critical infrastructure. Our customers include top Global 1000 companies across industries: Aerospace and Defense, Telecommunications, Industrial Controls and Robotics, Automotive, and Medical. Our VxWorks RTOS, Linux, and Helix Virtualization Platform power 2 billion-plus devices worldwide.<br><br>Within WindRiver, we have an opportunity to work with large-scale cloud native projects like Kubernetes, Docker and fast-paced open-source technologies. Wind River has adopted these technologies into the core of our product, which is driving us to find experienced and high-performing individuals that can learn and contribute towards secure development practices and securing these container and virtualization solutions.<br><br><strong><u>What You’ll Do<br><br></u></strong>WindRiver Systems is seeking an experienced high-performing professional, developing Site Reliability Engineering Function and offer shared services that spans across all products.<br><br>As the industry is moving intelligence to the Edge, this introduces challenges to ensure systems are highly available, reliable, free from threats and vulnerabilities. The successful candidate will join a highly skilled SRE and shared services team focused on implementing modern monitoring and observable platforms, enable systems for early detections, programmatically control the infrastructure, work on DevSecOps technologies, pioneer new tools, processes and capabilities for cloud-native solutions.<br><br>The candidate must have experience in cloud-native development environments and be a highly adaptable team player who can quickly ramp up on new technologies and accomplish goals in a fast-paced agile environment. A combination of strong technical and communication skills is a must, along with an unbounded desire to learn new technologies and their application.<br><br><strong><u>Who You Will Work With<br><br></u></strong>In SRE and Shared Services org, with primary focus on Site Reliability Engineering, Cloud Infrastructure Orchestration, Engineering Operations, Security implementation and you will work with Production Engineering, Software Development, QA and our Customer-facing teams to ensure requisite levels of infrastructure, application and software security/quality.<br><br><strong><u>Responsibilities<br></u></strong><ul><li> Drive the architectural efforts to improve resiliency, efficiency, performance, and costs.</li><li> Ensure the systems are highly reliable, available, free from threats &amp; vulnerabilities in cloud, internal environments, and applications for engineering stakeholders.</li><li> Write programs or scripts to replace manual tasks and automate the services to make it stable and operable.</li><li> Develop systems in place for the three pillars of observability- Logs, metrics, and traces. </li><li> Integrate various systems for better monitoring mechanisms in place by writing code, integrating APIs and plugins and prepare dashboards for better visibility.</li><li> Enabling systems for early problem detections with effective alerts &amp; monitors for cloud and on-prem infrastructure.</li><li> Be responsible to remediate tickets in Issue Tracking systems.</li><li> Be responsible to identify risks, defects, bottlenecks, and anything that can impair quality, availability, performance of deployed workloads/applications.</li><li> Secure OnPrem and Public Cloud environments leveraging IAC<br></li></ul><strong><u>Minimum Qualifications<br></u></strong><ul><li> 8+ relevant experience in cloud, DevOps, operations, security principles and trends with 2+ years of experience in software engineering.</li><li> Strong problem-solving, analytical skills, willing to take up complex challenges and triage environmental issues.</li><li> Strong programming &amp; scripting experience using Python, Shell, Java, C#, Yaml, Json, Restful API services etc.</li><li> Extensive experience in public cloud service like AWS, Azure, GCP and on-prem servers.</li><li> Extensive experience in Linux/Unix systems and networking fundamentals. </li><li> Extensive experience in monitoring &amp; logging tools such as Grafana, CheckMK, Prometheus, Loki, Elastic search, Kibana etc.</li><li> Extensive experience in DevOps tools such as Jenkins, Bitbucket, Gitlab etc.</li><li> Extensive experience with container ecosystems such as Docker, Kubernetes, Kubeflow etc.</li><li> Excellent knowledge in microservices, VMs deployments, Windows &amp; Linux servers.</li><li> Good knowledge in maintaining Kubernetes clusters, ensuring security, compliance and 24/7 availability of deployed workloads.</li><li> Good knowledge in AWS Cloud formation, Infra automation using Terraform, chef, ansible or puppet.</li><li> Understanding of relevant database technologies (MySQL, PostgreSQL, MongoDB, etc.)</li><li> Thorough understanding of Agile, Scrum and SaFe Agile principles. </li><li> Self-managed, fast learner, and aptitude to learn quickly.</li><li> Excellent verbal and written communication skills and a good listener.</li><li> Exceptional team player who works well in collaborative situations.</li><li> Ability to brainstorm and represent competing ideas simultaneously.</li><li> Growth mindset who is passionate about learning and applying new technologies.</li><li> BS / MS degree (Computer Science, Electronics Engineering, or equivalent technical degree)<br></li></ul><strong><u>Benefits<br></u></strong><ul><li> Flexible home office! We offer the flexibility of a hybrid work schedule or 100% remote</li><li> Named Top Workplace for the 8th year in a row</li><li> Wind River’s commitment to DEIB</li><li> 100% Employee covered Medical, Dental, and Vision insurance*</li><li> Flexible Time Off policy* + 12 observed Holidays</li><li> 401K with company match</li><li> Health Savings Account (HSA) and Flexible Spending Account (FSA)</li><li> Wellness Benefits through Unmind</li><li>varies by region and country<br></li></ul><strong><u>Compensation<br><br></u></strong>The annual base salary range for this role’s listed grade level is currently $122,100-$165,780 plus bonus for Colorado residents, New York and New Jersey residents, and $135,100-$182,420 plus bonus for California and Washington residents. Employees in this role are also eligible for the following benefits in accordance with the terms of the Company's plans: health, dental, vision insurance, life insurance, flex time off, eligibility to enroll in 401k, 12 paid holidays.
description_json: <strong><u>Description<br><br></u></strong><em>Position at Wind River<br><br></em><strong><u>About Wing River<br><br></u></strong>Wind River is a global leader in delivering software for mission-critical intelligent systems. For more than four decades, the company has been an innovator and pioneer, powering billions of systems that require the highest levels of security, safety, and reliability.<br><br>Wind River helps customers across automotive, aerospace, defense, industrial, medical, and telecommunications industries solve complex technology challenges on their journey toward the new intelligent machine economy.<br><br>The company’s software powers generation after generation of the safest, most secure systems in the world. Examples include playing a key role in NASA space missions — such as Artemis I, the James Webb Space Telescope, and multiple Mars rovers — and in recent 5G milestones — including the world’s first successful 5G data session with Verizon and in building one of the largest Open RAN networks in the world with Vodafone.<br><br>The company has received industry recognition for its technology innovation and leadership, and for its workplace culture, including global Great Place to Work certification and being named a “Top Workplace” for ten consecutive years. If you want to be part of a unique culture where the lived experience is based on our cultural attributes of growth mindset, customer-focus, and diversity, equity, inclusion &amp; belonging, come join us and help advance the future software defined world.<br><br><strong>Why Choose Wind River? <br><br></strong>For almost 40 years, Wind River has been the leading provider of embedded operating systems to the world’s leading developers of mission-critical infrastructure. Our customers include top Global 1000 companies across industries: Aerospace and Defense, Telecommunications, Industrial Controls and Robotics, Automotive, and Medical. Our VxWorks RTOS, Linux, and Helix Virtualization Platform power 2 billion-plus devices worldwide.<br><br>Within WindRiver, we have an opportunity to work with large-scale cloud native projects like Kubernetes, Docker and fast-paced open-source technologies. Wind River has adopted these technologies into the core of our product, which is driving us to find experienced and high-performing individuals that can learn and contribute towards secure development practices and securing these container and virtualization solutions.<br><br><strong><u>What You’ll Do<br><br></u></strong>WindRiver Systems is seeking an experienced high-performing professional, developing Site Reliability Engineering Function and offer shared services that spans across all products.<br><br>As the industry is moving intelligence to the Edge, this introduces challenges to ensure systems are highly available, reliable, free from threats and vulnerabilities. The successful candidate will join a highly skilled SRE and shared services team focused on implementing modern monitoring and observable platforms, enable systems for early detections, programmatically control the infrastructure, work on DevSecOps technologies, pioneer new tools, processes and capabilities for cloud-native solutions.<br><br>The candidate must have experience in cloud-native development environments and be a highly adaptable team player who can quickly ramp up on new technologies and accomplish goals in a fast-paced agile environment. A combination of strong technical and communication skills is a must, along with an unbounded desire to learn new technologies and their application.<br><br><strong><u>Who You Will Work With<br><br></u></strong>In SRE and Shared Services org, with primary focus on Site Reliability Engineering, Cloud Infrastructure Orchestration, Engineering Operations, Security implementation and you will work with Production Engineering, Software Development, QA and our Customer-facing teams to ensure requisite levels of infrastructure, application and software security/quality.<br><br><strong><u>Responsibilities<br></u></strong><ul><li> Drive the architectural efforts to improve resiliency, efficiency, performance, and costs.</li><li> Ensure the systems are highly reliable, available, free from threats &amp; vulnerabilities in cloud, internal environments, and applications for engineering stakeholders.</li><li> Write programs or scripts to replace manual tasks and automate the services to make it stable and operable.</li><li> Develop systems in place for the three pillars of observability- Logs, metrics, and traces. </li><li> Integrate various systems for better monitoring mechanisms in place by writing code, integrating APIs and plugins and prepare dashboards for better visibility.</li><li> Enabling systems for early problem detections with effective alerts &amp; monitors for cloud and on-prem infrastructure.</li><li> Be responsible to remediate tickets in Issue Tracking systems.</li><li> Be responsible to identify risks, defects, bottlenecks, and anything that can impair quality, availability, performance of deployed workloads/applications.</li><li> Secure OnPrem and Public Cloud environments leveraging IAC<br></li></ul><strong><u>Minimum Qualifications<br></u></strong><ul><li> 8+ relevant experience in cloud, DevOps, operations, security principles and trends with 2+ years of experience in software engineering.</li><li> Strong problem-solving, analytical skills, willing to take up complex challenges and triage environmental issues.</li><li> Strong programming &amp; scripting experience using Python, Shell, Java, C#, Yaml, Json, Restful API services etc.</li><li> Extensive experience in public cloud service like AWS, Azure, GCP and on-prem servers.</li><li> Extensive experience in Linux/Unix systems and networking fundamentals. </li><li> Extensive experience in monitoring &amp; logging tools such as Grafana, CheckMK, Prometheus, Loki, Elastic search, Kibana etc.</li><li> Extensive experience in DevOps tools such as Jenkins, Bitbucket, Gitlab etc.</li><li> Extensive experience with container ecosystems such as Docker, Kubernetes, Kubeflow etc.</li><li> Excellent knowledge in microservices, VMs deployments, Windows &amp; Linux servers.</li><li> Good knowledge in maintaining Kubernetes clusters, ensuring security, compliance and 24/7 availability of deployed workloads.</li><li> Good knowledge in AWS Cloud formation, Infra automation using Terraform, chef, ansible or puppet.</li><li> Understanding of relevant database technologies (MySQL, PostgreSQL, MongoDB, etc.)</li><li> Thorough understanding of Agile, Scrum and SaFe Agile principles. </li><li> Self-managed, fast learner, and aptitude to learn quickly.</li><li> Excellent verbal and written communication skills and a good listener.</li><li> Exceptional team player who works well in collaborative situations.</li><li> Ability to brainstorm and represent competing ideas simultaneously.</li><li> Growth mindset who is passionate about learning and applying new technologies.</li><li> BS / MS degree (Computer Science, Electronics Engineering, or equivalent technical degree)<br></li></ul><strong><u>Benefits<br></u></strong><ul><li> Flexible home office! We offer the flexibility of a hybrid work schedule or 100% remote</li><li> Named Top Workplace for the 8th year in a row</li><li> Wind River’s commitment to DEIB</li><li> 100% Employee covered Medical, Dental, and Vision insurance*</li><li> Flexible Time Off policy* + 12 observed Holidays</li><li> 401K with company match</li><li> Health Savings Account (HSA) and Flexible Spending Account (FSA)</li><li> Wellness Benefits through Unmind</li><li>varies by region and country<br></li></ul><strong><u>Compensation<br><br></u></strong>The annual base salary range for this role’s listed grade level is currently $122,100-$165,780 plus bonus for Colorado residents, New York and New Jersey residents, and $135,100-$182,420 plus bonus for California and Washington residents. Salary ranges are determined through interviews and a review of education, experience, knowledge, skills, location and abilities of the applicant, and equity with other team members. Employees in this role are also eligible for the following benefits in accordance with the terms of the Company's plans: health, dental, vision insurance, life insurance, flex time off, eligibility to enroll in 401k, 12 paid holidays.

title: GW CustomerEngage Developer
description: <ul><li>Be apart of sports and technology company expanding massively |Work on greenfield developments with a collaborative team<br><br><br></li></ul><strong>About Our Client<br><br></strong>The client focuses on Youth Sports and Development. The offer a robust platform that organizes national events, practice and game schedules as well as individual athletes data. Having experienced tremendous growth in recent years they are looking for a Senior Software Engineer to play a key role in continuing to grow their platform.<br><br>They're currently the leading provider of technology solutions for all of the youth sports team in the US, operating web and mobile platforms with over 1M on boarded users. They have a clear career path with a chance to grow within the company to a managerial or leader role. They develop greenfield projects designed to enhance the experience of youth athletes and simplify the process of scheduling and making payments for their parents.<br><br>This is a hybrid opportunity with commute to the office required once a week.<br><br><strong>Job Description<br><br></strong><ul><li>Write clean, scalable code using React Native</li><li>Utilize front-end web technologies to create interactive user experiences</li><li>Develop SQL Database-driven web interfaces</li><li>Create and test prototype when needed</li><li>Develop client displays and user interfaces in Fullstack capacity</li><li>Use, rework and adapt existing web application for mobile apps <br><br></li></ul><em>MPI does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, national origin, age, disability, veteran status, marital status, or based on an individual's status in any group or class protected by applicable federal, state or local law. MPI encourages applications from minorities, women, the disabled, protected veterans and all other qualified applicants.<br><br></em><strong>The Successful Applicant<br><br></strong><ul><li>4 + years of software development experience</li><li>Experience coding in React native</li><li>Experience working on Mobile applications</li><li>Strong attention to detail, looks to input creative solutions to help minimize excess redundancies </li><li>Experience with SQL databases - either relational and/or non-relational experience </li><li>Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science or related field</li><li>Experience working with REST APIs</li><li>Clear documentation <br><br></li></ul><strong>What's On Offer<br><br></strong><ul><li> Salary ranging from $125k-$165k</li><li> On-boarding period to help the transition run smoothly</li><li> 401k with 4% company match. No waiting period for matching</li><li> Strong health/dental/vision packages offered</li><li> Unlimited PTO with flex time</li><li> Collaborative team environment</li><li> Unlimited growth potential with career path laid out</li><li> Performance bonus and equity.<br><br></li></ul><strong>Contact: Connor Whitman<br><br></strong><strong>Quote job ref: JN-052023-6056948</strong>

title: Project Manager Rail - 3751
description: <strong><u>Description<br><br></u></strong><strong>Company: </strong>Oak Street Health<br><br><strong>Title: </strong>Engineer II, Data Engineering<br><br><strong>Location: </strong>Chicago or Remote<br><br><strong><u>Role Description<br><br></u></strong>The Engineer II, Data Engineering will be responsible for delivering high quality modern data solutions through collaboration with our engineering, analysts, and product teams in a fast-paced, agile environment leveraging cutting-edge technology to reimagine how Healthcare is provided. You will be instrumental in designing, integrating, and implementing solutions as well supporting migrations of existing workloads to Azure cloud. The Data Engineer is expected to have extensive knowledge of modern programming languages, designing and developing data solutions.<br><br><strong><u>Core Responsibilities<br></u></strong><ul><li>Design, develop and deliver customized ETL and Database solutions</li><li>Create Technical Documentation</li><li>Debug mappings and identify errors</li><li>Design and deploy enterprise-scale cloud infrastructure solutions</li><li>Research, analyze, recommend and select technical approaches for solving difficult and meaningful development and integration problems</li><li>Build data expertise and own data quality across organization</li><li>Design, build, and launch new data models</li><li>Triage mission-critical issues and drive to resolution</li><li>Other duties as assigned. <br></li></ul><strong>What are we looking for?<br></strong><ul><li>3+ years experience working in SQL and relational database management systems</li><li>3+ years experience with dimensional data modeling, schema design, and data warehousing</li><li>3+ years experience in ETL design, implementation, and maintenance</li><li>Experience with large-scale data and query optimization techniques</li><li>Familiarity with provisioning, configuring, and developing solutions in Azure Data Lake, Azure Data Factory, Azure SQL Data Warehouse, Azure Synapse and Azure Cosmos DB, DataBricks</li><li>Ability to write well-abstracted, reusable code</li><li>Ability to analyze data to identify deliverables, gaps, and inconsistencies</li><li>Ability to decompose and solve data problems and to find answers on own</li><li>Very strong communication skills and ability to work collaboratively with peers and stakeholders</li><li>Hands-on experience with cloud orchestration and automation tools, CI/CD pipeline creation</li><li>Hands-on experience with Python, Javascript or PySpark</li><li>US work authorization</li></ul>Someone who embodies being “Oaky”<br><br><strong>What does being “Oaky” look like?<br></strong><ul><li>Radiating positive energy</li><li>Assuming good intentions</li><li>Creating an unmatched patient experience</li><li>Driving clinical excellence</li><li>Taking ownership and delivering results</li><li>Being relentlessly determined<br></li></ul><strong>Why Oak Street Health?<br><br></strong>Oak Street Health is on a mission to “Rebuild healthcare as it should be'', providing personalized primary care for older adults on Medicare, with the goal of keeping patients healthy and living life to the fullest. Our innovative care model is centered right in our patient’s communities, and focused on the quality of care over volume of services. We’re an organization on the move! With over 150 locations and an ambitious growth trajectory, Oak Street Health is attracting and cultivating team members who embody “Oaky” values and passion for our mission.<br><br><strong><u>Oak Street Health Benefits<br></u></strong><ul><li>Mission-focused career impacting change and measurably improving health outcomes for medicare patients</li><li>Paid vacation, sick time, and investment/retirement 401K match options</li><li>Health insurance, vision, and dental benefits</li><li>Opportunities for leadership development and continuing education stipends</li><li>New centers and flexible work environments</li><li>Opportunities for high levels of responsibility and rapid advancement<br></li></ul><strong>Oak Street Health is an equal opportunity employer. We embrace diversity and encourage all interested readers to apply. <br><br></strong><strong>Learn more at</strong> www.oakstreethealth.com/diversity-equity-and-inclusion-at-oak-street-health

title: Shared Services / Site Reliability Engineer
description: We are looking for a VMware Engineer to join our multi-tenant, industry-leading, hosting team managing an environment of over 6000 hosts and over 65,000 virtual machines. You’ll apply your technical prowess and problem-solving skills to develop and maintain a robust, reliable, high-performance foundation for some of the largest healthcare organizations in the country to access our world-class software. Our multi-tenant, ever-growing environment scales through our code-first, DevOps focused culture. Spend more time automating and orchestrating and less time performing point-and-click tasks.<p><br></p>As part of Epic's hosting team, you'll enjoy opportunities to keep abreast of the latest technologies. You'll collaborate with infrastructure teams from traditional networking to storage administration to influence the design of our high-performance systems that ultimately allow healthcare providers to better do what they do best - take great care of patients. Shifted hours available. Learn more about the team at https //careers.epic.com/Jobs/Hosting.<p><br></p>As an Epic employee, you'll get to experience our state-of-the-art campus, eat delicious food, and improve healthcare for the world. We don't believe in cubicles here at Epic but instead believe that your best work is done in a spot that works for you. Whether it be working in your office, a conference room, or in our hosting facility, there are plenty of places to do important work that is helping healthcare organizations improve care for patients. Our award-winning culinary team will keep you well fed with meals prepared by top culinary talent and our sabbatical program will ensure you are able to travel to global destinations you've always wanted to visit.<p><br></p><strong>More than just important work</strong>.<p><br></p>Epic is located in Madison, Wisconsin, a city regularly ranked as one of America's best places to live. Epic's environment is one of continuous learning; you'll have access to opportunities to expand your skill set and share your knowledge with others. We offer comprehensive benefits to keep you healthy and happy as you grow in your life and career, and your merit-based compensation will reflect the impact your work has on the company and our customers. You'll also be eligible for annual raises and bonuses, as well as stock grants, which give you an even greater stake in the success of Epic and our customers. Epic is an Equal Opportunity employer. We seek diverse perspectives, backgrounds, and experiences in our mission to improve healthcare. Research has shown that job-seekers who are women, LGBTQ+, or members of the global majority are less likely to apply for roles they don't seem completely qualified for, so we encourage all who are interested to apply. Please see our full non-discrimination statement at https //careers.epic.com/EEO.<p><br></p>This position features two different starting points, based upon prior experience.<p><br></p><em>Junior VMware Engineer</em> requires 0-2 years of experience in the following<p><br></p><em>VMware Engineer</em> requires 2+ years of experience in the following<p><br></p><ul><li>Exposure to VMware vSphere</li><li>Experience or interest in scripting and automation with tools such as vSphere PowerCLI, GoLang, or Python</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Additional Requirements</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Strong individual and collaborative troubleshooting skills</li><li>Relocation to the Madison, WI area (reimbursed)</li><li>Eligibility to work in the US without visa sponsorship</li><li>COVID-19 vaccination</li></ul><p><br></p>As a member of the Hosting team at Epic you'll be responsible for the confidentiality, integrity, and availability of Epic Hosting. Those responsibilities include:<p><br></p><ul><li>Following policies and procedures and escalating when policies or procedures are not followed</li><li>Escalating potential security incidents and providing relevant information</li><li>Meeting all security responsibilities defined in policies and procedures</li></ul>

title: React Native Mobile Developer - Sporting Industry
description: Prestigious Financial Institution is currently seeking a DevOps Python Engineer. Candidate will provide services to DevOps team to complete buildout of CD automation for application release deployments based on a bill of material YAML file that has all necessary information the automation will need to deploy our applications to test and production environments.<p><br></p><strong><u>Responsibilities</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Provide services to DevOps team to develop python applications to automate checks for security and compliance controls before deploying release</li><li>Support and troubleshoot any issues in environments the deployment automation is tested and/or used in</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Qualifications</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Python programming experience required (application programming, NOT Scripting)</li><li>Hands on experience with DevOps tools</li><li>GitHub</li><li>Jenkins</li><li>Terraform (Enterprise preferred)/ansible</li><li>Artifactory</li><li>Experience in following technologies</li><li>Kubernetes &amp; Helm</li><li>Hashicorp Vault</li><li>Docker (containerize applications &amp; best practices)</li><li>Harness</li></ul>

title: Data Engineer II
description: <strong>Duration</strong>: 7+ months<p><br></p><strong><u>Job Description</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Work with Project team, business and product management to design, develop, review and execute test plan &amp; strategy.</li><li>Create and design reusable automation framework, identify the impact for various products (software applications) and communicate across the teams</li><li>Create, execute, maintain &amp; optimize automated test scripts.</li><li>Perform simple to complex test data conditioning, functional, Integration &amp; regression test validations &amp; defect management using various testing tools.</li><li>Collaborate with Agile team and provide input for product backlog, sprint planning, development, demo and retrospective governing agile principles.</li><li>Assign testing tasks, review and mentor less experienced QA Analysts.</li><li>Define strategies, processes, best practices &amp; methodologies using various testing techniques &amp; tools to bring efficiency in testing. </li><li>Provide regular reports on status, metrics &amp; ROI values to management.</li><li>Perform other duties as assigned.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Required Skills</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>5+ years of experience in Automation testing, with 2+ years of experience in Behavior driven Development(BDD)/ATDD using Cucumber/Specflow/SpecRun, and 2+ years of extensive experience in API/Web Services Testing</li><li>Strong hands-on experience in Java/C# and Object Oriented programming class structure, code re-use, abstract thinking/Page object model</li><li>Strong hands-on experience in creating reusable framework for ATDD/BDD Testing (Gherkin and Cucumber/Specflow) and creating step definitions.</li><li>Experience working in an Agile environment, Agile Tools and good exposure to Continuous Integration</li><li>Experience working with multiple software development methodologies and QA automation Tools</li><li>Technical expert and linear thinking to work at Business/Object layer and exposure to Angular &amp; Cloud </li><li>Experience in writing complex SQL queries and writing REST based API requests preferred</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Preferred Skills</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Development/Coding experience </li><li>Technical expert and good team player</li><li>Self-motivated and comfortable working with a team or independently</li><li>Demonstrated ability to effectively communicate through communication skills</li></ul><p><br></p>The Capgemini Freelancer Gateway is enabled by a cutting-edge software platform that leads the contingent labor world for technology innovation. The software platform leverages Machine Learning and Artificial Intelligence to make sure the right people end up in the right job.<p><br></p>A global leader in consulting, technology services and digital transformation, Capgemini is at the forefront of innovation to address the entire breadth of clients’ opportunities in the evolving world of cloud, digital and platforms. Building on its strong 50 year heritage and deep industry-specific expertise, Capgemini enables organizations to realize their business ambitions through an array of services from strategy to operations. Capgemini is driven by the conviction that the business value of technology comes from and through people. It is a multicultural company of over 200,000 team members in more than 40 countries. The Group reported 2018 global revenues of EUR 13.2 billion.<p><br></p>

title: Remote RedHat/Quay Cloud Engineer
description: As a UNIX/Linux systems engineer supporting our internal development and testing systems, you will flex your creativity and technical prowess to support the 9,000+ datacenter-housed systems that help Epic improve healthcare delivery for over 72% of patients in the United States, and around the world.<p><br></p>While working on our small, collaborative team of experienced engineers, you'll use analytical and problem-solving skills to take ownership of automation, complex systems architecture projects, and more. Using your creativity and the shared experience of others, you will continuously improve our internal operations and your own depth of technical knowledge.<p><br></p>You'll evaluate, develop, and deploy non-traditional solutions, create utility and automation scripts, create/maintain/support Epic's internal and internet-facing systems, and improve monitoring of Epic's internal server environments.<p><br></p>Enjoy the perks of being an Epic employee in Madison (check out life at Epic and our culinary team), while working with a broad range of technologies in your day-to-day.<p><br></p><strong>More than just important work</strong>.<p><br></p>Epic is located in Madison, Wisconsin, a city regularly ranked as one of America's best places to live. You'll earn competitive wages and receive benefits befitting a leading software company (401k match, great health insurance, life insurance, performance bonuses and stock grants). Epic's environment is one of continuous learning; you'll have access to opportunities to expand your skill set and share your knowledge with others. Epic is an Equal Opportunity employer. We seek diverse perspectives, backgrounds, and experiences in our mission to improve healthcare. Research has shown that job-seekers who are women, LGBTQ+, or members of the global majority are less likely to apply for roles they don't seem completely qualified for, so we encourage all who are interested to apply. Please see our full non-discrimination statement at https //careers.epic.com/EEO.<p><br></p><ul><li>2+ years' experience administering systems in an enterprise setting supporting production databases or applications.</li><li>Experience in deployment, monitoring, performance tuning, and troubleshooting in Linux.</li><li>Experience building tools or automation in languages such as Python or Perl and shell scripting (bash/ksh).</li><li>Comfort administering virtualized environments with VMware vSphere VMs, AIX LPARs, containers, or similar.</li><li>Experience with the following is a plus Backup/Restore, Disaster Recovery, DevOps, systems automation.</li><li>Relocation to the Madison, WI area (reimbursed).</li><li>Eligible to work in the U.S. without visa sponsorship.</li><li>COVID-19 vaccination</li></ul>
