title: Junior Virtualization Engineer
description: As a .Net Developer you will be primarily responsible for designing and developing solutions, serving as Technical Lead for projects to support Business needs.<br><br>The position will also focus on:<br><ul><li> Analysis and design of application modules </li><li> Development of application modules, as required </li><li> Oversee IT project execution as a Technical Lead </li><li> Execution of System Development Life Cycle (SDLC) for IT projects </li><li> Creation and/or review of SDLC artifacts </li><li> Provide technical consulting and mentoring for software developers </li><li> Maintenance of application modules, as required <br><br></li></ul>Position Requirements:<br><ul><li> Bachelor's degree in business or computer science </li><li> 3-6 years' experience demonstrating progressive levels in programming and systems analysis and design for frontend web development with the Microsoft .Net Framework </li><li>Proficient experience in development technologies: C#, ASP.NET MVC, Razor, .NET Core, LINQ, .NET Framework</li><li>Proficient experience building REST Api's and webservices in: Web API</li><li>Proficient experience in development SDLC methodologies: Agile, Waterfall</li><li>Proficient in OOP concepts, MVC, MVVM, and Microservice design patterns</li><li>Experience with Web frontend development: HTML, CSS, JQuery, Bootstrap, JavaScript</li><li>Experience with developing stored procedures and designing database solutions in MS SQL Server</li><li>Experience building N-tier applications</li><li>Experience with working with SOAP WCF services</li><li>Experience with async programming, AJAX calls</li><li>Code Source control in Github<br><br></li></ul>Nice to have: <ul><li>Development experience in ASP.NET Webforms &amp; Entity Framework</li><ul><li>Code Source Control in TFS</li><li>Azure Cloud development experience</li><li>Frontend Development in ReactJS, Typescript</li><li>Application security experience with JWT, Oauth, ADFS, WS Federation Claims, Forms, SSO</li></ul><li> Proven ability to successfully deliver technical solutions to business problems </li><li> Command of system development life cycle methodology development processes, practices and artifacts </li><li> Strong communication skills and ability to comprehend design specifications </li><li> Comprehension of SQL, with working knowledge of relational database concepts and data access techniques </li><li> Understanding of wholesale and retail business models </li><li> Proactive and resourceful in solving problems with the ability to resolve complex technical issues within area of responsibility </li><li> Embrace change and offers ideas to improve team processes or output </li><li> Ability to lead small to medium projects </li><li> Ability to collaborate with cross-functional teams for large projects <br><br></li></ul><strong><strong>Compensation Details:<br><br></strong></strong>$112400 - $130000 per year<br><br><strong><strong>Why should you join our team? <br><br></strong></strong>We live our values - W.E.L.I.G.H.T (Winning, Excellence, Love, Integrity, Gratitude, Humility, and Teamwork). Gratitude. Humility. Love. You don't often see values like these in most corporate statements, but Ace is different. These things are important to us. They represent our commitment to the company, our employees, to Ace retailers and to the Ace brand.<br><br>In addition to providing our employees a great culture, Ace also offers competitive benefits* that address life's necessities and perks, many of which expand and improve year after year, including:<br><ul><li>Incentive opportunities, based on role/grade level (rapid company growth over the past 5 years resulted in incentives being paid out at an average of 126% of your target opportunity!) </li><li>Generous 401(k) retirement savings plan with company contributions, averaging 9.6% per year of eligible earnings over the past 5 years</li><li>Comprehensive health coverage (medical, dental, vision and disability - up to 26 weeks short-term disability and long-term disability ) &amp; life insurance benefits for you and your dependents</li><li>21 days of vacation immediately available (prorated in the first year) and up to 6 paid holidays depending on the month of hire </li><li>Company Car, phone and fuel card are provided for field-based positions</li><li>Your career at Ace is more than just a job. It's a chance to be part of something meaningful. We help locally-owned businesses thrive and make an impact in their communities - and we support our employees in doing the same by offering an annual Ace Cares Week, 20 hours off work per year to volunteer at an organization of your choice, opportunities to help Children's Miracle Network Hospitals and the Ace Helpful Fund through the Ace Foundation</li><li>Ace invests in every employee we hire, with a key focus on development and coaching. We offer on-site classes, facilitator-led courses, and a generous tuition assistance program, plus a performance management approach that goes beyond the typical annual review</li><li>We know the work environment matters. That's why Ace holds frequent campus events like Employee Appreciation Week, vendor demos, cookouts, and merchandise sales</li><li>We bring them to you! Services such as mobile spas, auto maintenance, car wash and detailing, dry cleaning, dentists, eye doctors, flu shots, recycling and more!</li><li>Employee discounts on Ace merchandise (including top brands like Weber, Traeger, Yeti, Craftsman, DeWalt and more), travel, fitness, computers and thousands more</li><li>Birth/Adoption bonding paid time off</li><li>Adoption cost reimbursement</li><li>Employee Assistance Program (EAP) - access to free visits to therapists and lawyers, guidance on financial matters, elder and childcare, and assistance with tickets to entertainment events</li><li>Identity theft protection</li><li> Benefits are provided in compliance with applicable policies.<br><br></li></ul><strong>We want to hear from you!<br><br></strong>When most people think of career opportunities with Ace Hardware, they often think of the helpful cashiers and sales associates at their local store. However, have you also considered the people behind the scenes who select, promote, ship and process the invoices for more than 75,000 products? Maybe you haven't, but we'd like you to. Because together we help our customers take care of their homes. Come find out why a career with the Ace Hardware Corporation is one of America's best kept secrets.<br><br><strong>Equal Opportunity Employer<br><br></strong>Ace Hardware Corporation and its subsidiaries are committed to a policy of promoting equal employment opportunities. The company recognizes the importance of diversity and leveraging the skills and talents of all people to the mutual advantage of each individual and the organization. The company is committed to the prevention of employment discrimination related to race, religion, color, sex (including sexual harassment), gender identity, national origin, age, marital status, disability and military or veteran status, sexual orientation or any other action covered by federal or applicable state/local laws.<br><br><strong> <strong>Disclaimer</strong> <br><br></strong>The pay range for this position starts as listed in the job posting, but could be higher based on education and experience. Please note, compensation decisions are dependent on the facts and circumstances of each opening. We take into consideration the minimum requirements outlined in the job description, such as an individual's education, training and experience, the position's work location, required travel (if any), and external market conditions when determining the final salary for potential new hires.<br><br>Be aware that salary estimates published via alternate online job boards may not be a true representation of the actual pay range offered for this position. Please refer to the Ace position description for the accurate starting pay range information and feel free to discuss this with a Talent Acquisition professional if you are chosen to move forward with an interview.<br><br>This written "Position Description" is not intended to cover all aspects of the position listed. It is meant to cover the basic/general essential job functions of a particular position. Ace Hardware Corporation reserves the right to change job duties, including essential job functions, according to business necessity.<br><br>

title: DevOps Python Engineer
description: <ul><li>Need Local Candidates Chicago,IL Need candidate with minimum 5 years of exp. I am sharing a W2 contract role. Kindly please check and let us know if you are interested and please share your updated resume. Role: Mobile SDET with Java Location: Chicago, IL 5 days oniste Job Description: Java, Spring, Hibernate, Web Services, HTML, JSP, Java Script, Servlets, Web Services, XML, AJAX, Microservices, SOA, REST, JSON a MUST. Strong experience with Agile development incorporating Continuous Integration and Continuous Delivery, utilizing technologies such as GIT, Maven, Jenkins, Chef, Sonar, PowerMock. GoLang, Docker, Kubernetes experience is good to have. Knowledge of functional programming is a plus. 5-7 years overall SDET and/or development experience. Design and build scalable automated test frameworks and test suites working across technologies. API level testing. Perform manual testing, the scope of which will encompass all functionalities of services as a prequel to automation. Analyze test logs; create test reports, co-ordinate with stakeholders. Experience developing test automation tools and frameworks Strong, object-oriented design and coding skills. Strong exposure with Selenium and Appium framework. Working Experience in API testing and Automation of the services TestNG, JUnit &amp; Testng highly desirable. Experience in QA with exposure to white box testing. Experience with Open Source Performance Testing Tool Jmeter. Hands on in Web services automation using Rest assured. Experience in Object Oriented Analysis, Design(OOAD) and development of software using UML Methodology, good knowledge of J2EE design patterns and Core Java design patterns.</li></ul>

title: Behavioral Health Technician
description: <strong>Description<br><br></strong>STV has provided rail engineering services to Class 1 railroads, short line, commuter, light rail, rapid transit, and industrial railroad clients for more than 40 years. Services include design of track, facilities, railroad structures; track and bridge inspection; environmental permitting; third-party public project management; construction management; emergency engineering response; design-build design and program management; and other services.<br><br>Our team is made up of highly skilled rail professionals, many of whom are former employees of operating railroads. This firsthand experience working to design and maintain active rail systems uniquely equips our team to develop innovative solutions to a wide variety of rail projects.<br><br>We are seeking a Project Manager to join our robust Rail team in Chicago. Our ideal candidate will be an experienced rail professional with strong technical design background and a desire to lead design teams and interact with clients. This position would have the opportunity to lead freight and passenger rail projects both locally in the Chicago region and across the country.<br><br>This Project Manager will be a seller/doer position with duties consisting of managing all parts of phase 1 and phase 2 design projects, resource planning, assisting in business development, client engagement and proposal preparation. We are looking for a project manager who is experienced in the Chicago market and is looking to join a team with a deep local bench of technical design staff and bolster a national practice of talented rail professionals.<br><br><strong>Responsibilities<br></strong><ul><li>Lead and manage rail projects from planning through design into construction</li><li> Develop project scope, budget, schedule, and lead client contract negotiations</li><li> Work with and provide guidance to technical engineering staff ranging from junior to senior level</li><li> Ability to assist and execute technical tasks including developing technical reports, designs, specifications, and project related presentations</li><li> Work closely with other project managers and group leads within the Rail Division to plan resources and manage internal workshare</li><li> Assist and lead in developing client capture plans and pursuit win plans, proposals, and other business development and client engagement activities</li><li> Ability to meet with client and public stakeholders and perform site visits in field as necessary<br><br></li></ul><strong>Qualifications<br></strong><ul><li>Professional Engineering (P.E.) license preferred</li><li> Bachelor’s Degree in Civil Engineering</li><li> Minimum 10 years of experience in design and/or planning rail projects</li><li> Prior experience managing projects</li><li> Strong background in rail projects and working knowledge of rail power, communications, signaling, and structural systems</li><li> Excellent interpersonal and communication skills with desire to work closely with clients and other stakeholders outside of technical engineering teams</li><li> Desire to work on large multi-disciplinary rail projects with fast paced schedules which require creative thinking and innovative problem-solving skills<br><br></li></ul>Don’t meet every single requirement? Studies have shown that women and people of color are less likely to apply to jobs unless they meet every single qualification. At STV, we are fully committed to expanding our culture of diversity and inclusion, one that will reflect the clients we serve and the communities we work in, so if you’re excited about this role but your past experience doesn’t align perfectly with every qualification in the job description we encourage you to apply anyways. You may be just the right candidate for this or other roles.<br><br>STV offers the following benefits<br><ul><li> Health insurance, including an option with a Health Savings Account</li><li> Dental insurance</li><li> Vision insurance</li><li> Flexible Spending Accounts (Healthcare, Dependent Care and Transit and Parking where applicable)</li><li> Disability insurance</li><li> Life Insurance and Accidental Death &amp; Dismemberment</li><li> 401(k) Plan</li><li> Retirement Counseling</li><li> Employee Assistance Program</li><li> Paid Time Off (16 days)</li><li> Paid Holidays (8 days)</li><li> Back-Up Dependent Care (up to 10 days per year)</li><li> Parental Leave (up to 80 hours)</li><li> Continuing Education Program</li><li> Professional Licensure and Society Memberships<br><br></li></ul>STV aims to pay fairly and equitable commensurate with experience and capabilities across all of our positions. These pay ranges represent a good faith effort to provide a fair and reasonable expected salary, however, please note that the salary offered for any position may be outside of this range based on selected candidate’s location, experience and capabilities.<br><br>STV is committed to paying all its employees in a fair, equitable, and transparent manner. The following pay ranges are STV’s good-faith salary estimates for every presently available position. Please note that the final salary offered for any position may be outside of this published range based on many factors, including but not limited to geography, education, experience, and/or certifications.<br><br>This list represents all of the currently listed positions as of November 1, 2022.<br><br>Position Title, Good Faith Salary Minimum, Good Faith Salary Maximum<br><br>Accounting title: SOFTWARE DEVELOPER (contract)
description: <strong>Role</strong>: Axiom Developer / IT – Application Architect<br><br><strong>Start date</strong>: June<br><br>Contract through April with possibility of FTE conversion<br><br>100% remote or local to Chicago<br><br>Our client, a Chicago based global financial institution, is looking for an Axiom SL Developer to join their team. Exciting opportunity for a candidate who has a strong Axiom background and looking for their next career move.<br><br>The successful candidate will support various projects for the Cash business unit, specifically 2023 GRS NA &amp; GRS EMEA strategic projects. Will play a key role in some of the development &amp; support activities related to these projects. For example, configure objects and reports in Axiom.<br><br><u><strong>Skills – must haves:</strong></u> <ul><li>AXIOM SL – developer (not tester)</li><ul><li>3 years minimum of Axiom SL controller view development experience </li></ul><li>IT development experience (6-8 years minimum) </li><li>Axiom database maintenance </li><li>Code development – develop data models, data sources, objects </li><li>Change management – will support SAT &amp; UAT &amp; into production, post production support, batch processing, and upgrade patches </li><li>Collaboration skills – Work across different teams (QAs and Business teams) </li><li>Experience configuring regulatory reports </li><li>Communication skills </li><li>Strong references <br><br></li></ul><u><strong>Nice to have:<br></strong></u><ul><li>Work in teams internally and with vendors, in the US and India </li><li>Financial services </li><li>Regulatory Reporting &amp; Data Warehousing </li><li>US regulatory reports knowledge / experience – FFIEC031, FFIEC041, FFIEC009 etc. <br><br></li></ul><em>Heitmeyer Consulting is an equal opportunity employer and we encourage all qualified candidates to apply. Qualified applicants will be considered without regard to minority status, gender, disability, veteran status or any other characteristic protected by law.</em>

title: DevOps Linux Systems Engineer
description: Senior Engineer: This is a senior level position that is ideal for someone skilled, passionate about development, and eager to expand their influence in surrounding areas. This is an opportunity to practice mentorship skills with more-junior developers, often receiving guidance from more experienced mentors. Desired Experience: 4+ years of experience in a full-time development role. Previous experience as a tech lead or team lead, mentoring junior developers Candidate will be expected to contribute immediately building applications in React and Node JS. For visual problems, a combination of JavaScript and CSS, for backend services, mostly Node JS and some Java. Software Engineer

title: DevOps Python Engineer
description: <strong>What We're Building And Why We're Building It.<br><br></strong>There's a reason Fetch is ranked top 10 in Shopping in the App Store. Every day, millions of people earn Fetch Points buying brands they love. From the grocery aisle to the drive-through, Fetch makes saving money fun. We're more than just a build-first tech unicorn. We're a revolutionary shopping platform where brands and consumers come together for a loyalty-driving, points-exploding, money-saving party.<br><br>Join a fast-growing, founder-led technology company that's still only in its early innings. Ranked one of America's Best Startup Employers by Forbes two years in a row, Fetch is building a people-first culture rooted in trust and accountability. How do we do it? By empowering employees to think big, challenge ideas, and find new ways to bring the fun to Fetch. So what are you waiting for? Apply to join our rocketship today!<br><br><em>Fetch is an equal employment opportunity employer.<br><br></em><strong>The Role:<br><br></strong>We are looking for an <strong>Android Software Engineer</strong>. You will build and maintain a world class mobile application that works directly with our backend services and external partners. You'll be working on a small, multi-functional team that may include other engineers, a designer, product manager, data scientist and other roles. Success in this role requires the ability to take on challenging problems and design &amp; develop amazing solutions with a user-centric focus.<br><br><strong>In your tool-bag:<br></strong><ul><li>A deep understanding of functional and object-oriented programming</li><li>Ability to plan and implement complex data models</li><li>Ability to optimize poorly performing code, data queries, and network requests</li><li>Flexibility to implement a feature from either a highly specific design OR a bare bones idea that needs thought &amp; iteration</li><li>Understanding of the complexity and failure domains Android applications</li><li>Ability to troubleshoot Android fragmentation and explain both short and long-term solutions with trade-offs</li><li>Effective communication, including the ability to translate and explain technical issues to non-technical team members<br><br></li></ul><strong>You have experience with:<br></strong><ul><li>Android is written in Kotlin</li><li>Relational databases (Rooms, SQLite)</li><li>Version control system (Git)</li><li>Test writing and quality assurance</li><li>Event-driven or reactive programming</li><li>Core Libraries: GSON, Glide, Retrofit</li><li>Structure is: MVVM<br><br></li></ul><strong>Bonus points:<br></strong><ul><li>Full-stack development (Kotlin, Javascript, React, Swift)</li><li>Websocket communication</li><li>Undergraduate or graduate degree in computer science, engineering or mathematics<br><br></li></ul><strong>At Fetch, we'll give you the tools to feel healthy, happy and secure through:<br></strong><ul><li>Stock Options for everyone</li><li>401k Match: Dollar-for-dollar match up to 4%. </li><li>Benefits for humans and pets: We offer comprehensive medical, dental and vision plans for everyone including your pets. </li><li>Continuing Education: Fetch provides $10,000 per year in education reimbursement. </li><li>Employee Resource Groups: Take part in employee-led groups that are centered around fostering a diverse and inclusive workplace through events, dialogue and advocacy. The ERGs participate in our Inclusion Council with members of executive leadership. </li><li>Paid Time Off: On top of our flexible PTO, Fetch observes 9 paid holidays, including Juneteenth and Indigenous People's Day, as well as our year-end week-long break. </li><li>Robust Leave Policies: 18 weeks of paid parental leave for primary caregivers, 12 weeks for secondary caregivers, and a flexible return to work schedule. </li><li>Hybrid Work Environment: Collaborate with your team in one of our stunning offices in Madison, Birmingham, or Chicago. We'll ensure you are equally equipped with the hardware and software you need to get your job done in the comfort of your home.</li></ul>

Every day, millions of people earn Fetch Points buying brands they love. From the grocery aisle to the drive-through, Fetch makes saving money fun. We're more than just a build-first tech unicorn. We're a revolutionary shopping platform where brands and consumers come together for a loyalty-driving, points-exploding, money-saving party.<br><br>Join a fast-growing, founder-led technology company that's still only in its early innings. Ranked one of America's Best Startup Employers by Forbes two years in a row, Fetch is building a people-first culture rooted in trust and accountability. How do we do it? By empowering employees to think big, challenge ideas, and find new ways to bring the fun to Fetch. So what are you waiting for? title: .Net Developer (Hybrid)
description: <strong><u>Description</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li> Install and service company machinery at customer facilities.</li><li> In-house and field troubleshooting of company machinery.</li><li> Download software and updates to application software for machines.</li><li> Ability to wire up an electrical panel using schematics as well as troubleshoot.</li><li> Schedule/ coordinate trips for machine installation and service calls.</li><li> Strong knowledge of machine assembly tools, tap/die and electronic test equipment.</li><li> Working knowledge of VFDs, PLCs, servo drives, motors and electrical components.</li><li> Work efficiently with minimal supervision and complete tasks in a timely manner.</li><li> Ability to solve customer issues in the field.</li><li> Able to communicate effectively with co-workers, management and customers.</li><li> Other duties as assigned.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Skills</u></strong><p><br></p>Troubleshooting, Field service, Mechanical, hand tool, motor controls and sensors, Electrical, Preventive maintenance, Installation, plcs, Service<p><br></p><strong><u>Top Skills Details</u></strong><p><br></p>Troubleshooting,Field service,Mechanical,hand tool,motor controls and sensors<p><br></p><strong><u>Additional Skills &amp; Qualifications</u></strong><p><br></p>MUST: -mechanically inclined - have knowledge/ experience working with hand tools - an understanding of hydraulics - assembly of equipment NICE: - oil and machinery experience - motor change experience<p><br></p><strong><u>Experience Level</u></strong><p><br></p>Entry Level<p><br></p><strong><u>About Actalent</u></strong><p><br></p>Actalent connects passion with purpose. Our scalable talent solutions and services capabilities drive value and results and provide the expertise to help our customers achieve more. Every day, our experts around the globe are making an impact. We’re supporting critical initiatives in engineering and sciences that advance how companies serve the world. title: Mobile SDET
description: IT System Engineer (Windows) – MSP<br><br>We are seeking a IT System Engineer (Windows) – MSP with an IT Services background for one of our MSP clients. This company is seeking a tenacious and honest IT System Engineer (Windows) – MSP that will handle escalated support, project-based work, and an onsite consultation. The IT System Engineer (Windows) – MSP will provide user support at remote locations on assigned open tickets and collaborate with the Service Desk.<br><br>The IT System Engineer (Windows) – MSP will install, troubleshoot, and maintain a variety of products and equipment and make recommendations on which product best fit the customers’ needs. The IT System Engineer (Windows) – MSP, should also desire to receive certifications, on-the-job training, and quick career advancement.<br><br><strong><u>IT System Engineer (Windows) – MSP Duties<br></u></strong><ul><li>Experience in computer hardware troubleshooting, new setups, and installations</li><li>Experience in troubleshooting and supporting Microsoft Windows desktop operating systems, Microsoft Office suites, and Office 365</li><li>Experience with self-managing small projects</li><li>Install and optimizes hardware/software/network products and configurations at customer sites</li><li>Diagnoses and resolves product performance problems</li><li>Performs maintenance and repairs</li><li>Troubleshoot and repair devices including network switches, routers, servers, remote access, and cloud services</li><li>Experience with computer compliance requirements as it relates to software patching, disk encryption, and endpoint security</li><li>Experience and understanding of migrations from on-prem to cloud solutions (O365, Azure/AWS, etc.)</li><li>Experience working with VMware and Microsoft Systems<br></li></ul><strong><u>IT System Engineer (Windows) – MSP Salary &amp; Benefits<br></u></strong><ul><li>Salary: $85k – $95k</li><li>Medical, Dental, and Vision insurance</li><li>401 (k)</li><li>Generous PTO</li><li>Annual Bonus<br></li></ul><strong> Opportunity Location <br><br></strong>Arlington Heights, IL<br><br><strong> Proposed Salary <br><br></strong>$85,000 - $95,000<br><br>Bowman Williams is a national specialized staffing firm for Cloud Service Providers and Managed Service Providers. Ranked by Forbes as one of America's top 200 Best Staffing Firms in America, we are a good resource for candidates looking to advance their careers in the Cloud Solutions and Services industry.<br><br>Tagged: #CCfresh999<br><br><strong> Apply For This Opening <br><br></strong>Apply To Bowman Williams

title: Project Manager Rail - 3751
description: <strong>We Breathe Life Into Data<br><br></strong>At Komodo Health, our mission is to reduce the global burden of disease. And we believe that smarter use of data is essential to this mission. That’s why we built the Healthcare Map — the industry’s largest, most complete, precise view of the U.S. healthcare system — by combining de-identified, real-world patient data with innovative algorithms and decades of clinical experience. The Healthcare Map serves as our foundation for a powerful suite of software applications, helping us answer healthcare’s most complex questions for our partners. Across the healthcare ecosystem, we’re helping our clients unlock critical insights to track detailed patient behaviors and treatment patterns, identify gaps in care, address unmet patient needs, and reduce the global burden of disease.<br><br>As we pursue these goals, it remains essential to us that we stay grounded in our values: be awesome, seek growth, deliver “wow,” and enjoy the ride. At Komodo, you will be joining a team of ambitious, supportive Dragons with diverse backgrounds but a shared passion to deliver on our mission to reduce the burden of disease — and enjoy the journey along the way.<br><br><strong>The Opportunity at Komodo Health<br><br></strong>Komodo aims to build the best healthcare data analytics platform in the industry. As we are maturing, we are investing in our core application platform, building on our strengths in medical and prescription claims, to create consistent domain driven user experience across our different solutions. To do this, we are incrementally revisiting our client-facing applications to provide best of breed user experience starting with a design system.<br><br>The Frontend Engineer will play as a key contributor to the design, development and deployment of our common web UI components and framework for our client-facing applications.<br><br><strong>Looking back on your first 12 months at Komodo Health, you will have…<br></strong><ul><li>Have led the design, development and deployment in production of SaaS single-page applications</li><li>Have contributed to the creation and adoption of shared UI components across several SPA and frontend / fullstack teams, ideally on Analytics / Dashboarding types of applications</li><li>Have contributed to the creation and adoption of a design system</li><li>Have designed and implemented metrics collection/monitoring that reports web applications health and customer behaviour/adoption</li><li>Have helped create performant CI/CD pipelines for web applications<br></li></ul><strong><u>What You Bring To Komodo<br></u></strong><ul><li>Excited about UI automation, enabling best UI development practices, and being a team player</li><li>Proficiency in React/Redux-based frameworks, Data visualization frameworks (D3, Leaflet, ...), StoryBook and UI tests automation frameworks</li><li>Proficiency in programming languages such as Javascript, Typescript, CSS, WebComponent with deep technical troubleshooting skills</li><li>Hands-on experience in building CI/CD pipelines using ESLint, ESBuild, GitHub Actions, Jenkins, etc. with advanced packaging techniques (JS bundle optimization, tree shaking, umd…) and deploying to CDN services</li><li>Excellent cross-team communication and collaboration skills, with the ability to initiate and effectively drive projects proactively<br></li></ul><strong><u>Additionally<br></u></strong><ul><li>Passion! We hope you are passionate about our mission and technology</li><li>Ownership! We hope you own your work, be accountable, and push it through the finish line. We hope you treat yourself as a cofounder and do not hesitate to share any idea that helps Komodo</li><li>Expertise! We do not need you to know everything, but we hope you have deep knowledge in at least one area and can start contributing quickly. And we would love to learn from you in your area(s) of expertise<br></li></ul><strong><u>Compensation At Komodo Health<br><br></u></strong>We are committed to providing competitive compensation for all roles at Komodo Health. We carefully consider multiple factors when determining compensation, including your skills, experience, and location while balancing internal equity relative to peers at the company.<br><br>The targeted base salary range for the this role is listed below and is accompanied by a competitive bonus and equity package.<br><br>$123,900—$186,300 USD<br><br><strong>Where You’ll Work<br><br></strong>Komodo Health has a hybrid work model; we recognize the power of choice and importance of flexibility for the well-being of both our company and our individual Dragons. Roles may be completely remote based anywhere in the country listed, remote but based in a specific region, or local (commuting distance) to one of our hubs in San Francisco, New York City, or Chicago with remote work options.<br><br><strong><u>What We Offer<br><br></u></strong>On top of our commitment to providing competitive, fair pay for all roles at Komodo Health, we’re proud to offer robust and inclusive benefits to all Dragons at Komodo Health. We offer global time off programs, extensive internal and external career development and learning opportunities, multiple affinity groups celebrating our team’s diversity, and an annual wellness and productivity stipend to support you in being your healthiest, best self.<br><br><strong>Equal Opportunity Statement<br><br></strong>Komodo Health provides equal employment opportunities to all applicants and employees. We prohibit discrimination and harassment of any type with regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state, or local laws.<br><br>

title: Axiom Developer
description: Komatsu is an indispensable partner to the construction, mining, forestry, forklift, and industrial machinery markets, maximizing value for customers through innovative solutions. With a diverse line of products supported by our advanced IoT technologies, regional distribution channels, and a global service network, we tap into the power of data and technology to enhance safety and productivity while optimizing performance. Komatsu supports a myriad of markets, including housing, infrastructure, water, pipeline, minerals, automobile, aerospace, electronics and medical, through its many brands and subsidiaries, including TimberPro, Joy, P&amp;H, Montabert, Modular Mining Systems, Hensley Industries, NTC, and Gigaphoton.<br><strong><u>Job Overview<br></u></strong>The <strong>Financial Analyst</strong> is a key role within the Komatsu Organization and will have knowledge of Komatsu Mining Corporation (KMC) Financial Information that is not made known publicly or to all Company employees and will be able to tell the “story” within the financial numbers. This Role interacts with the Director of Finance, KMC Corporate Accounting - FP&amp;A and Financial Excellence, Operations Accounting, Regional Finance Directors, Managers and Controllers, Milwaukee leadership and Internal/External Auditors to name a few.<br><strong><u>Key Job Responsibilities<br></u></strong><ul><li> Support financial planning cycle by preparing templates that will be used to gather relevant data from business divisions; load corporate departmental data into SAP/BPC; analyze reconciliation of US GAAP to Standard Variable Margin (“SVM”) reporting. </li><li> Consolidate financial forecasts on a quarterly and annual basis. Compare forecasts with business trends and macro-economic data to determine the reasonableness of the current forecast. </li><li> Consolidate and report monthly the rolling CAPEX plan supporting approvals, purchase order, actual and planned spending for the current fiscal year and three-year plan. </li><li> Obtain variance explanations for capacity costs by business division. </li><li> Decision support including analysis of historical financials, obtain variance explanations, update risks and opportunities to current plan and maintain Key Performance Indicators (“KPI’s”) historical and planned trends. </li><li> Maintain trends for bookings and sales data by region, product, and commodity. </li><li> Prepare monthly flash of financial results to executive leadership. </li><li> Prepare monthly, quarterly, and annual bridge analysis. </li><li> Prepare monthly reporting metrics of KPI’s. </li><li> Preparation of monthly presentations to Executive Leadership and quarterly presentations to Komatsu Ltd. Management Committee. </li><li> Review calculation of foreign exchange impact on sales, operating profit, and bookings and backlog compared to prior year and budget. </li><li> Prepare ad hoc financial reports and analysis required by Komatsu Ltd., CFO, EVP Finance, Corporate Controller, Treasury, Tax, Human Resources, and segments. <br></li></ul><strong><u>Qualifications/Requirements<br></u></strong><ul><li>Bachelor’s Degree in Accounting or Finance (Discipline Preferred)</li><li>2+ years of experience in Financial Planning &amp; Analysis or Accounting, preferably for a manufacturing or global company. Ability to prepare financial statements and explain results.</li><li>SAP/BPC experience a plus</li><li>High level of proficiency with MS Excel. Proficiency in MS PowerPoint and Word. Especially strong with data analysis. </li><li>Working with and interpreting large amounts of data, developing trend lines, and assisting in formulating action plans.</li><li>Strong analytical, critical thinking, Problem Solving, written / verbal communication and interpersonal skills.</li><li>Attention to detail and accuracy is needed.</li><li>Work both independently and in collaboration with team members.</li><li>Ability to prioritize and manage multiple time-sensitive tasks. Committed to meeting established deliverables accurately and on-time.<br></li></ul><strong><u>Additional Information<br></u></strong>Komatsu is an Equal Opportunity Workplace and an Affirmative Action Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or protected veteran status.
industry: Construction, Civil Engineering, and Machinery Manufacturing
description_json: Komatsu is an indispensable partner to the construction, mining, forestry, forklift, and industrial machinery markets, maximizing value for customers through innovative solutions. With a diverse line of products supported by our advanced IoT technologies, regional distribution channels, and a global service network, we tap into the power of data and technology to enhance safety and productivity while optimizing performance. Komatsu supports a myriad of markets, including housing, infrastructure, water, pipeline, minerals, automobile, aerospace, electronics and medical, through its many brands and subsidiaries, including TimberPro, Joy, P&amp;H, Montabert, Modular Mining Systems, Hensley Industries, NTC, and Gigaphoton.<br><strong><u>Job Overview<br></u></strong>The <strong>Financial Analyst</strong> is a key role within the Komatsu Organization and will have knowledge of Komatsu Mining Corporation (KMC) Financial Information that is not made known publicly or to all Company employees and will be able to tell the “story” within the financial numbers. This Role interacts with the Director of Finance, KMC Corporate Accounting - FP&amp;A and Financial Excellence, Operations Accounting, Regional Finance Directors, Managers and Controllers, Milwaukee leadership and Internal/External Auditors to name a few.<br><strong><u>Key Job Responsibilities<br></u></strong><ul><li> Support financial planning cycle by preparing templates that will be used to gather relevant data from business divisions; load corporate departmental data into SAP/BPC; analyze reconciliation of US GAAP to Standard Variable Margin (“SVM”) reporting. </li><li> Consolidate financial forecasts on a quarterly and annual basis. Compare forecasts with business trends and macro-economic data to determine the reasonableness of the current forecast. </li><li> Consolidate and report monthly the rolling CAPEX plan supporting approvals, purchase order, actual and planned spending for the current fiscal year and three-year plan. </li><li> Obtain variance explanations for capacity costs by business division. </li><li> Decision support including analysis of historical financials, obtain variance explanations, update risks and opportunities to current plan and maintain Key Performance Indicators (“KPI’s”) historical and planned trends. </li><li> Maintain trends for bookings and sales data by region, product, and commodity. </li><li> Prepare monthly flash of financial results to executive leadership. </li><li> Prepare monthly, quarterly, and annual bridge analysis. </li><li> Prepare monthly reporting metrics of KPI’s. </li><li> Preparation of monthly presentations to Executive Leadership and quarterly presentations to Komatsu Ltd. Management Committee. </li><li> Review calculation of foreign exchange impact on sales, operating profit, and bookings and backlog compared to prior year and budget. </li><li> Prepare ad hoc financial reports and analysis required by Komatsu Ltd., CFO, EVP Finance, Corporate Controller, Treasury, Tax, Human Resources, and segments. <br></li></ul><strong><u>Qualifications/Requirements<br></u></strong><ul><li>Bachelor’s Degree in Accounting or Finance (Discipline Preferred)</li><li>2+ years of experience in Financial Planning &amp; Analysis or Accounting, preferably for a manufacturing or global company. Ability to prepare financial statements and explain results.</li><li>SAP/BPC experience a plus</li><li>High level of proficiency with MS Excel. Proficiency in MS PowerPoint and Word. Especially strong with data analysis. </li><li>Working with and interpreting large amounts of data, developing trend lines, and assisting in formulating action plans.</li><li>Strong analytical, critical thinking, Problem Solving, written / verbal communication and interpersonal skills.</li><li>Attention to detail and accuracy is needed.</li><li>Work both independently and in collaboration with team members.</li><li>Ability to prioritize and manage multiple time-sensitive tasks. Committed to meeting established deliverables accurately and on-time.<br></li></ul><strong><u>Additional Information<br></u></strong>Komatsu is an Equal Opportunity Workplace and an Affirmative Action Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or protected veteran status.

title: Software Engineer
description: <strong><span>Genesis10 is currently seeking a <u>Lead .Net Developer</u> for a contract ending in November 2023 working a hybrid schedule (3 days/week onsite) with a world-class manufacturing company in Lisle, IL. <u>Local candidates only please.<br></u></span></strong> <br><span>As a Lead Software Engineer supporting Service Solutions, this role will utilize both technical and soft skills. Being successful in the position will require gaining knowledge of several complex systems, primarily truck Service Diagnostics applications, in an effort to provide superior quality of service and uptime for our internal business partners and customers.<br></span> <br><strong><span>What we’re looking for:</span></strong><ul><li><span>MUST be US Citizen or GC Holder.</span></li><li><span>Must be a strong technical leader who can prioritize well and have the ability to work in environments with competing and alternating priorities, with a constant focus on delivery.</span></li><li><span>Analytical and problem-solving skills.</span></li><li><span>Must be a self-starter and work independently.</span></li><li><span>Experience working in a fast paced and demanding work environment.</span></li><li><span>Write testable code, unit tests, and mocking.</span></li><li><span>Skilled in web page performance optimization (code refactoring, SQL optimization).</span></li><li><span>Excellent written and verbal communication skills.</span></li><li><span>Occasional after hours or weekend support may be required.</span></li><li><span>Over 5 years of progressive hands-on experience with architecture, design and development of web applications using Microsoft technologies.</span></li><li><span>Integration with external 3rd party vendors experience is a plus.</span></li><li><span>BS in Computer Science or Engineering.</span></li><li><span>Strong plus: Automotive, commercial vehicle diagnostics, CAN communication experience.</span></li></ul><strong><span>Primary Required Skills and Experience:</span></strong><ul><li><span>3-5 years as LEAD Software Engineer or Developer.</span></li><li><span>.Net development.</span></li><li><span>Visual Basic.</span></li><li><span>Web development, JavaScript.</span></li><li><span>SQL Server.</span></li></ul><strong><span>Technical Skills:</span></strong><ul><li><span>.NET 4.5x development, MSCE preferred.</span></li><li><span>Visual Basic, VB Script, JavaScript, Angular JS, jQuery, AJAX, XML/XSL; Cascading Style Sheets (CSS).</span></li><li><span>Using at least one of the following databases: DB2, Oracle, SQL Server.</span></li><li><span>TFS (source code management).</span></li><li><span>WCF/Web API and related technologies (JSON, REST, SOAP, XML).</span></li><li><span>Azure Cloud based services (certifications preferred).</span></li><li><span>Architectural design patterns.</span></li><li><span>DevOps (certifications preferred).</span></li></ul><span>If you have the described qualifications and are interested in this exciting opportunity, apply today!<br></span> <br><strong><span>Compensation is $60-68 per hour.<br></span></strong> <br><span>If you have the described qualifications and are interested in this exciting opportunity, apply today!<br></span> <br><span>Ranked a Top Staffing Firm in the U.S. by Staffing Industry Analysts for six consecutive years, Genesis10 puts thousands of consultants and employees to work across the United States every year in contract, contract-for-hire, and permanent placement roles. With more than 300 active clients, Genesis10 provides access to many of the Fortune 100 firms and a variety of mid-market organizations across the full spectrum of industry verticals.<br></span> <br><strong><span>Benefits of Working with Genesis10:</span></strong><ul><li><span>Access to hundreds of clients, most who have been working with Genesis10 for 5-20+ years.</span></li><li><span>The opportunity to have a career-home in Genesis10; many of our consultants have been working exclusively with Genesis10 for years.</span></li><li><span>Access to an experienced, caring recruiting team (more than 7 years of experience, on average.)</span></li><li><span>Medical, Dental, Vision</span></li><li><span>Health Savings Account</span></li><li><span>Voluntary Hospital Indemnity (Critical Illness &amp; Accident)</span></li><li><span>Voluntary Term Life Insurance</span></li><li><span>401K</span></li><li><span>Sick Pay (for applicable states/municipalities)</span></li><li><span>Commuter Benefits (Dallas, NYC, SF)</span></li><li><span>Remote opportunities available</span></li></ul><span>For multiple years running, Genesis10 has been recognized as a Top Staffing Firm in the U.S., as a Best Company for Work-Life Balance, as a Best Company for Career Growth, for Diversity, and for Leadership, amongst others. To learn more and to view all our available career opportunities, please visit us at our website.<br></span> <br><strong><span>Genesis10 is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Candidates will receive consideration without regard to their race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or status as a protected veteran.</span></strong>

title: Android Software Engineer
description: <strong>Come join our team for an excellent role! We are looking for a Lead Java Developer<br><br></strong>Cognizant is looking for a<strong> Lead Java Developer </strong>in developing customized product for our clients. The role is expected to drive technology discussions and analyze the current landscape for gaps in addressing business needs. Cognizant needs a motivated individual to challenge the status quo and provide thought leadership/best practices to enhance our current services and technologies.<br><br>An ideal candidate is someone who enjoys working in a fast paced, collaborative environment. Someone that values the “team” and leverages the opinions and expertise of their teammates to deliver quality<br><br><strong>Summary:</strong> The main function of a developer is to develop create and modify general computer applications utilizing <strong>Lead Java Developer. <br><br></strong><strong><u>Responsibilities<br></u></strong><ul><li> Work with the Architect to define Application Integration and Security Design for various components involved.</li><li> Design, development and build of java solution components/modules and integrations</li><li> Hands-on knowledge in technology areas like Core Java, Java8, MicroServices, Web services(SOAP and REST), Spring boot, Spring Frameworks, Spring Data JPA, REST/SOAP services, Spring cloud, Spring MVC, JSON &amp; XML based processing.</li><li> Strong command on Java/J2EE &amp; OOPs concepts and current industry trends. Working knowledge of Java 8/11 new features.</li><li> Working knowledge of cloud-based server less application development on any of cloud platforms like AWS/Azure/GCP.</li><li> Candidates with experience in Cloud native application development experience will be preferred.</li><li> Working knowledge in any of the databases like MongoDB/Oracle/MySQL/SQL Server.</li><li> Working knowledge in any messaging platforms like Apache Kafka/Rabbit MQ/JMS/AWS SQS/Azure Event Hub/Service Bus.</li><li> Production implementation experience for large enterprise applications using Java/J2EE Web services/micro services will be preferred.</li><li> Experience in implementing Web services Security using WS-Security SAML OAUTH2 Kerberos and integrating with Identity providers LDAP and ADFS.</li><li> Experience working with credential vaults will be an add-on.</li><li> Strong knowledge on design and integration patterns especially in applications involving Portals/SSO legacy applications B2B Applications external partners using enterprise service bus.</li><li> Well versed with ensuring coding standards DevOps CI/CD implementations version management branching strategy security principles.</li><li> Ensure code quality and standards are followed. Experience in test automation is a plus.</li><li> Up-to-date technical knowledge by attending educational workshops reviewing publications<br></li></ul><strong><u>Must Have Skills<br></u></strong><ul><li>Microservices</li><li>Spring Boot</li><li>Java<br></li></ul><strong><u>Good To Have Skills<br></u></strong><ul><li>Core Java </li><li>J2EE</li><li>Cloud Platform</li><li>Database skills<br></li></ul><em>Cognizant will only consider applicants for this position who are legally authorized to work in the United States without requiring company sponsorship now or at any time in the future.<br><br></em>Cognizant is recognized as a Military Friendly Employer and is a coalition member of the Veteran Jobs Mission. Our Cognizant Veterans Network assists Veterans in building and growing a career at Cognizant that allows them to leverage the leadership, loyalty, integrity, and commitment to excellence instilled in them through participation in military service.<br><br>Employee Status : Full Time Employee<br><br>Shift : Day Job<br><br>Travel : No<br><br>Job Posting : May 09 2023<br><br><strong><u>About Cognizant<br><br></u></strong>Cognizant (Nasdaq-100: CTSH) is one of the world's leading professional services companies, transforming clients' business, operating and technology models for the digital era. Our unique industry-based, consultative approach helps clients envision, build and run more innovative and efficient businesses. Headquartered in the U.S., Cognizant is ranked 185 on the Fortune 500 and is consistently listed among the most admired companies in the world. Learn how Cognizant helps clients lead with digital at www.cognizant.com or follow us @USJobsCognizant.<br><br>Applicants may be required to attend interviews in person or by video conference. In addition, candidates may be required to present their current state or government issued ID during each interview.<br><br>Cognizant is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, race, color, religion, national origin, disability, protected Veteran status, age, or any other characteristic protected by law.<br><br>If you have a disability that requires a reasonable accommodation to search for a job opening or submit an application, please email CareersNA2@cognizant.com with your request and contact information.

title: Field Service Engineer
description: Sargent &amp; Lundy is one of the most experienced full-service architect-engineering firms in the world. Founded in 1891, the firm is a global leader in power and energy with expertise in grid modernization, renewable energy, energy storage, nuclear power, and fossil fuels. Sargent &amp; Lundy delivers comprehensive project services—from consulting, design and implementation to construction management, commissioning and operations/maintenance—with an emphasis on quality and safety. The firm serves public and private sector clients in the power and energy, gas distribution, industrial, and government sectors.<br><br><strong> Our Core Values <br><br></strong>Every decision we make is guided by our core values. By upholding these six principles, we support our clients, employees, and community. They are the compass we follow as we continue to grow our business and lead the industry.<br><br><strong>Quality </strong><strong>– </strong>We provide high-quality deliverables and services through an uncompromising focus on peer review, safety, and continuous improvement.<br><br><strong>Accountability </strong><strong>–</strong> Our actions demonstrate the highest levels of professionalism, integrity, and respect.<br><br><strong>Our People </strong><strong>– </strong>We value diverse perspectives, encourage professional growth, and are committed to providing a work community where people thrive. Our work is challenging but rewarding.<br><br><strong>Our Clients</strong><strong> – </strong>We deliver value and exceed our clients’ expectations through outstanding customer service, personal accessibility, and clear communication.<br><br><strong>Innovation </strong><strong>–</strong> Since 1891, we have invested in the people, training, tools, and technology needed to quickly adapt in a constantly changing world.<br><br><strong>Meaningful Impact </strong><strong>– </strong>We make a positive impact in the communities where we work and live.<br><br><strong><u>Responsibilities<br><br></u></strong>Sargent &amp; Lundy is seeking a highly motivated and collaborative individual like you to join our team! We currently have an opening for an experienced Microsoft Developer to utilize and expand your web-based development skills .<br><br><strong><u>Responsibilities<br></u></strong><ul><li> Collaborate with team other IT professionals and end users in developing code to build and integrate home grown and commercial applications </li><li> Coordinate internal customer requirements, build a programmatic solution, test the deliverable, and document what was done </li><li> Continuously learn and present new techniques learned at Communities of Practice to other development staff </li><li> Evaluate and recommend open source and other add-ins that will shorten development times <br></li></ul><strong><u>Qualifications<br></u></strong><ul><li> Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Computer Information Systems, or related field </li><li> Strong problem solving and excellent verbal/written communication skills to effectively to collaborate with others </li><li> C# and Visual Studio </li><li> HTML, JavaScript, JSON </li><li> Microsoft Azure (Portal and DevOps) </li><li> SOAP and Rest APIs </li><li> SQL Server <br></li></ul><strong><u>Knowledge Of The Following Would Be a Plus<br></u></strong><ul><li> Active Directory </li><li> Power Automate </li><li> Power Apps </li><li> ASP.NET Core Web APIs </li><li> REACT </li><li> Azure functions and APIM </li><li> JAVA using Eclipse <br></li></ul><strong> We do not sponsor employees for work authorization in the U.S. for this position. <br><br></strong>Sargent &amp; Lundy is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability status, protected veteran status, or any protected status as defined by law.

We currently have an opening for an experienced Microsoft Developer to utilize and expand your web-based development skills .<br><br><strong><u>Responsibilities<br></u></strong><ul><li> Collaborate with team other IT professionals and end users in developing code to build and integrate home grown and commercial applications </li><li> Coordinate internal customer requirements, build a programmatic solution, test the deliverable, and document what was done </li><li> Continuously learn and present new techniques learned at Communities of Practice to other development staff </li><li> Evaluate and recommend open source and other add-ins that will shorten development times <br></li></ul><strong><u>Qualifications<br></u></strong><ul><li> Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Computer Information Systems, or related field </li><li> Strong problem solving and excellent verbal/written communication skills to effectively to collaborate with others </li><li> C# and Visual Studio </li><li> HTML, JavaScript, JSON </li><li> Microsoft Azure (Portal and DevOps) </li><li> SOAP and Rest APIs </li><li> SQL Server <br></li></ul><strong><u>Knowledge Of The Following Would Be a Plus<br></u></strong><ul><li> Active Directory </li><li> Power Automate </li><li> Power Apps </li><li> ASP.NET Core Web APIs </li><li> REACT </li><li> Azure functions and APIM </li><li> JAVA using Eclipse <br></li></ul><strong> We do not sponsor employees for work authorization in the U.S. for this position. <br><br></strong>Sargent &amp; Lundy is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability status, protected veteran status, or any protected status as defined by law.

title: API Developer
description: The IT Analyst helps manage the provision of outsourced server operations and Infrastructure services including hardware and software asset management services for all business units. This role works closely with the Director of Operations and IT Ops Managers to ensure that Infrastructure Services for Data Center operations are provided within the scope of the services contract, the statement of work and pertinent schedules/exhibits. This role will specifically drive the Data Center operations. They will work closely with their Delivery Managers to track and monitor the overall progress of IT Operations processes. This role will work with Project Managers and Architects on small-to-medium sized infrastructure Services projects to ensure issues are communicated and resolved in a timely fashion Skills required: Azure or AWS training and certifications Experience with automation and orchestration tools Experience with Azure Virtual Desktop Experience with Microsoft 365 Administrative Roles Cloud financial management **C2C is not an option for this role. Data Center Analyst

Trade, Etherlands, Web3 Sheets, and Poppie. title: Financial Analyst
description: <strong>Department: </strong>SoC Administration<p><br></p><strong>Salary/Grade: </strong>ITS/78<p><br></p><strong><u>Job Summary</u></strong><p><br></p>The Learning Engineer will provide curriculum design, technology support, and course development services to faculty in the School of Communication, integrating learning and teaching technologies into their courses. The Learning Engineer will work closely with faculty teaching in the school’s hybrid and online programs and provide support and technical assistance for our active learning spaces/classrooms. In this role, the Learning Engineer will manage a portfolio of online classes to improve students’ learning through the creative use of technologies. The Learning Engineer should have knowledge in the learning sciences, learn or be able to provide assistance with classroom technology and applications that increase classroom engagement, be effective at authoring and editing content/training/tutorials using design methodologies that best serve digital education, and have experience in working with instructors in a higher education environment.<p><br></p><em> Please note </em> : This position will require flexible scheduling that includes some weekend and evening work.<p><br></p>This position is located both on the Chicago and Evanston campuses (Evanston primary).<p><br></p>This position will require the applicant to carry an NU cell phone or pager.<p><br></p><strong><u>Specific Responsibilities</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li> Manage a portfolio of online courses that you will prepare, revise, QA, and launch each quarter. In partnership with faculty, and using data, identify course/weekly objectives and instructional goals, align them with assessments, make recommendations for revisions, and support faculty in quarterly course updates. Offer guidance and mentorship to faculty, TA’s and students while the courses are live; </li><li> Provide support/technical assistance and training for all teaching technologies used in our schools online and live classes, including applications and hardware used in the live classroom environment; </li><li> Develop tutorials, workshops, and documentation for all school used learning technologies and classroom spaces; </li><li> Consult with faculty who express interest to broaden the reach of instructional design and innovation in their courses, especially encouraging the adoption of interactive applications and active learning techniques; </li><li> Conduct research to identify potential uses for new and emerging learning technologies with emphasis on technologies that support learning analytics, accessibility, student engagement, and consistent user experience across multiple platforms </li><li> Maintain current knowledge of learning science and instructional design principles for the effective support of online and blended education, peer learning, and active learning practices; </li><li> Collaborate with the Sr. Director of Academic Technology and other colleagues in the School of Communication on workshops, documentation, and training; </li></ul><p><br></p><em> Miscellaneous </em><p><br></p><ul><li> Performs other duties as assigned. </li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Minimum Qualifications</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li> Bachelor’s degree in instructional design, learning sciences or a related field; or a Bachelor’s degree in an unrelated field with certification in instructional design; or related, higher-education experience with training that is equivalent to the skills and knowledge of these degree credentials </li><li> Two years of experience working on faculty-driven educational initiatives, bringing instructional design and analysis to the cooperative development work of instructors, educational technology support staff, and teaching assistants. </li></ul><p><br></p><strong> Minimum Competencies: (Skills, knowledge, and abilities.) </strong><p><br></p><ul><li> The ability to work collaboratively with colleagues in a team environment; </li><li> Demonstrated skills in oral communication, listening, and building relationships with instructors; </li><li> Proven skills in writing for the web, as well as for reports, proposals, and traditional publishing platforms. </li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Preferred Qualifications</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li> A Master’s degree in Instructional Design, Learning Sciences, Educational Technology, or a similar field; </li><li> Three or more years of professional experience as an Instructional Designer in higher education or in a similar organization serving adult learners; </li><li> Expertise in developing instructional design strategies with school or departmental stakeholders; </li><li> Teaching or training experience in higher education. </li></ul><p><br></p><strong> Preferred Competencies: (Skills, knowledge, and abilities) </strong><p><br></p><ul><li> Expertise in Canvas or a similar Learning Management System; </li><li> Expertise with one or more digital education (content) authoring tools (e.g., Camtasia, Captivate, Lectora, Softchalk, Articulate); </li><li> General knowledge and ability to research/recommend learning applications; </li><li> Understanding of and application of social networking and mobile applications in environments for teaching and learning; </li><li> Knowledge of current learning technologies (online and traditional classroom); </li><li> Ability to adapt and communicate successfully with different people and situations. </li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Benefits</u></strong><p><br></p>At Northwestern, we are proud to provide meaningful, competitive, high-quality health care plans, retirement benefits, tuition discounts and more! Visit us at https://www.northwestern.edu/hr/benefits/index.html to learn more.<p><br></p><strong><u>Work-Life And Wellness</u></strong><p><br></p>Northwestern offers comprehensive programs and services to help you and your family navigate life’s challenges and opportunities, and adopt and maintain healthy lifestyles.<p><br></p>We support flexible work arrangements where possible and programs to help you locate and pay for quality, affordable childcare and senior/adult care. Visit us at https://www.northwestern.edu/hr/benefits/work-life/index.html to learn more. <strong> <strong> Professional Growth &amp; Development: <br><br></strong>Northwestern supports employee career development in all circumstances whether your workspace is on campus or at home. If you’re interested in developing your professional potential or continuing your formal education, we offer a variety of tools and resources. Visit us at https://www.northwestern.edu/hr/learning/index.html to learn more. <br><br></strong>Northwestern strongly recommends COVID-19 vaccinations and boosters for people who can obtain them as a critical tool for minimizing severe illness. More information can be found on the COVID-19 and Campus Updates webpage.<br><br><em>The Northwestern campus sits on the traditional homelands of the people of the Council of Three Fires, the Ojibwe, Potawatomi, and Odawa as well as the Menominee, Miami and Ho-Chunk nations. We acknowledge and honor the original people of the land upon which Northwestern University stands, and the Native people who remain on this land today.<br><br></em><em>Northwestern University is an Equal Opportunity, Affirmative Action Employer of all protected classes, including veterans and individuals with disabilities. Women, racial and ethnic minorities, individuals with disabilities, and veterans are encouraged to apply. Click for information on EEO is the Law.</em>
