title: System Engineer
description: <strong><u>Description<br><br></u></strong><em>Position at Wind River<br><br></em><strong><u>About Wing River<br><br></u></strong>Wind River is a global leader in delivering software for mission-critical intelligent systems. For more than four decades, the company has been an innovator and pioneer, powering billions of systems that require the highest levels of security, safety, and reliability.<br><br>Wind River helps customers across automotive, aerospace, defense, industrial, medical, and telecommunications industries solve complex technology challenges on their journey toward the new intelligent machine economy.<br><br>The company’s software powers generation after generation of the safest, most secure systems in the world. Examples include playing a key role in NASA space missions — such as Artemis I, the James Webb Space Telescope, and multiple Mars rovers — and in recent 5G milestones — including the world’s first successful 5G data session with Verizon and in building one of the largest Open RAN networks in the world with Vodafone.<br><br>The company has received industry recognition for its technology innovation and leadership, and for its workplace culture, including global Great Place to Work certification and being named a “Top Workplace” for ten consecutive years. If you want to be part of a unique culture where the lived experience is based on our cultural attributes of growth mindset, customer-focus, and diversity, equity, inclusion &amp; belonging, come join us and help advance the future software defined world.<br><br><strong>Why Choose Wind River? <br><br></strong>For almost 40 years, Wind River has been the leading provider of embedded operating systems to the world’s leading developers of mission-critical infrastructure. Our customers include top Global 1000 companies across industries: Aerospace and Defense, Telecommunications, Industrial Controls and Robotics, Automotive, and Medical. Our VxWorks RTOS, Linux, and Helix Virtualization Platform power 2 billion-plus devices worldwide.<br><br>Within WindRiver, we have an opportunity to work with large-scale cloud native projects like Kubernetes, Docker and fast-paced open-source technologies. Wind River has adopted these technologies into the core of our product, which is driving us to find experienced and high-performing individuals that can learn and contribute towards secure development practices and securing these container and virtualization solutions.<br><br><strong><u>What You’ll Do<br><br></u></strong>WindRiver Systems is seeking an experienced high-performing professional, developing Site Reliability Engineering Function and offer shared services that spans across all products.<br><br>As the industry is moving intelligence to the Edge, this introduces challenges to ensure systems are highly available, reliable, free from threats and vulnerabilities. The successful candidate will join a highly skilled SRE and shared services team focused on implementing modern monitoring and observable platforms, enable systems for early detections, programmatically control the infrastructure, work on DevSecOps technologies, pioneer new tools, processes and capabilities for cloud-native solutions.<br><br>The candidate must have experience in cloud-native development environments and be a highly adaptable team player who can quickly ramp up on new technologies and accomplish goals in a fast-paced agile environment. A combination of strong technical and communication skills is a must, along with an unbounded desire to learn new technologies and their application.<br><br><strong><u>Who You Will Work With<br><br></u></strong>In SRE and Shared Services org, with primary focus on Site Reliability Engineering, Cloud Infrastructure Orchestration, Engineering Operations, Security implementation and you will work with Production Engineering, Software Development, QA and our Customer-facing teams to ensure requisite levels of infrastructure, application and software security/quality.<br><br><strong><u>Responsibilities<br></u></strong><ul><li> Drive the architectural efforts to improve resiliency, efficiency, performance, and costs.</li><li> Ensure the systems are highly reliable, available, free from threats &amp; vulnerabilities in cloud, internal environments, and applications for engineering stakeholders.</li><li> Write programs or scripts to replace manual tasks and automate the services to make it stable and operable.</li><li> Develop systems in place for the three pillars of observability- Logs, metrics, and traces. </li><li> Integrate various systems for better monitoring mechanisms in place by writing code, integrating APIs and plugins and prepare dashboards for better visibility.</li><li> Enabling systems for early problem detections with effective alerts &amp; monitors for cloud and on-prem infrastructure.</li><li> Be responsible to remediate tickets in Issue Tracking systems.</li><li> Be responsible to identify risks, defects, bottlenecks, and anything that can impair quality, availability, performance of deployed workloads/applications.</li><li> Secure OnPrem and Public Cloud environments leveraging IAC<br></li></ul><strong><u>Minimum Qualifications<br></u></strong><ul><li> 8+ relevant experience in cloud, DevOps, operations, security principles and trends with 2+ years of experience in software engineering.</li><li> Strong problem-solving, analytical skills, willing to take up complex challenges and triage environmental issues.</li><li> Strong programming &amp; scripting experience using Python, Shell, Java, C#, Yaml, Json, Restful API services etc.</li><li> Extensive experience in public cloud service like AWS, Azure, GCP and on-prem servers.</li><li> Extensive experience in Linux/Unix systems and networking fundamentals. </li><li> Extensive experience in monitoring &amp; logging tools such as Grafana, CheckMK, Prometheus, Loki, Elastic search, Kibana etc.</li><li> Extensive experience in DevOps tools such as Jenkins, Bitbucket, Gitlab etc.</li><li> Extensive experience with container ecosystems such as Docker, Kubernetes, Kubeflow etc.</li><li> Excellent knowledge in microservices, VMs deployments, Windows &amp; Linux servers.</li><li> Good knowledge in maintaining Kubernetes clusters, ensuring security, compliance and 24/7 availability of deployed workloads.</li><li> Good knowledge in AWS Cloud formation, Infra automation using Terraform, chef, ansible or puppet.</li><li> Understanding of relevant database technologies (MySQL, PostgreSQL, MongoDB, etc.)</li><li> Thorough understanding of Agile, Scrum and SaFe Agile principles. </li><li> Self-managed, fast learner, and aptitude to learn quickly.</li><li> Excellent verbal and written communication skills and a good listener.</li><li> Exceptional team player who works well in collaborative situations.</li><li> Ability to brainstorm and represent competing ideas simultaneously.</li><li> Growth mindset who is passionate about learning and applying new technologies.</li><li> BS / MS degree (Computer Science, Electronics Engineering, or equivalent technical degree)<br></li></ul><strong><u>Benefits<br></u></strong><ul><li> Flexible home office! We offer the flexibility of a hybrid work schedule or 100% remote</li><li> Named Top Workplace for the 8th year in a row</li><li> Wind River’s commitment to DEIB</li><li> 100% Employee covered Medical, Dental, and Vision insurance*</li><li> Flexible Time Off policy* + 12 observed Holidays</li><li> 401K with company match</li><li> Health Savings Account (HSA) and Flexible Spending Account (FSA)</li><li> Wellness Benefits through Unmind</li><li>varies by region and country<br></li></ul><strong><u>Compensation<br><br></u></strong>The annual base salary range for this role’s listed grade level is currently $122,100-$165,780 plus bonus for Colorado residents, New York and New Jersey residents, and $135,100-$182,420 plus bonus for California and Washington residents. Salary ranges are determined through interviews and a review of education, experience, knowledge, skills, location and abilities of the applicant, and equity with other team members. Employees in this role are also eligible for the following benefits in accordance with the terms of the Company's plans: health, dental, vision insurance, life insurance, flex time off, eligibility to enroll in 401k, 12 paid holidays.
description_json: <strong><u>Description<br><br></u></strong><em>Position at Wind River<br><br></em><strong><u>About Wing River<br><br></u></strong>Wind River is a global leader in delivering software for mission-critical intelligent systems. For more than four decades, the company has been an innovator and pioneer, powering billions of systems that require the highest levels of security, safety, and reliability.<br><br>Wind River helps customers across automotive, aerospace, defense, industrial, medical, and telecommunications industries solve complex technology challenges on their journey toward the new intelligent machine economy.<br><br>The company’s software powers generation after generation of the safest, most secure systems in the world. Examples include playing a key role in NASA space missions — such as Artemis I, the James Webb Space Telescope, and multiple Mars rovers — and in recent 5G milestones — including the world’s first successful 5G data session with Verizon and in building one of the largest Open RAN networks in the world with Vodafone.<br><br>The company has received industry recognition for its technology innovation and leadership, and for its workplace culture, including global Great Place to Work certification and being named a “Top Workplace” for ten consecutive years. If you want to be part of a unique culture where the lived experience is based on our cultural attributes of growth mindset, customer-focus, and diversity, equity, inclusion &amp; belonging, come join us and help advance the future software defined world.<br><br><strong>Why Choose Wind River? <br><br></strong>For almost 40 years, Wind River has been the leading provider of embedded operating systems to the world’s leading developers of mission-critical infrastructure. Our customers include top Global 1000 companies across industries: Aerospace and Defense, Telecommunications, Industrial Controls and Robotics, Automotive, and Medical. Our VxWorks RTOS, Linux, and Helix Virtualization Platform power 2 billion-plus devices worldwide.<br><br>Within WindRiver, we have an opportunity to work with large-scale cloud native projects like Kubernetes, Docker and fast-paced open-source technologies. Wind River has adopted these technologies into the core of our product, which is driving us to find experienced and high-performing individuals that can learn and contribute towards secure development practices and securing these container and virtualization solutions.<br><br><strong><u>What You’ll Do<br><br></u></strong>WindRiver Systems is seeking an experienced high-performing professional, developing Site Reliability Engineering Function and offer shared services that spans across all products.<br><br>As the industry is moving intelligence to the Edge, this introduces challenges to ensure systems are highly available, reliable, free from threats and vulnerabilities. The successful candidate will join a highly skilled SRE and shared services team focused on implementing modern monitoring and observable platforms, enable systems for early detections, programmatically control the infrastructure, work on DevSecOps technologies, pioneer new tools, processes and capabilities for cloud-native solutions.<br><br>The candidate must have experience in cloud-native development environments and be a highly adaptable team player who can quickly ramp up on new technologies and accomplish goals in a fast-paced agile environment. A combination of strong technical and communication skills is a must, along with an unbounded desire to learn new technologies and their application.<br><br><strong><u>Who You Will Work With<br><br></u></strong>In SRE and Shared Services org, with primary focus on Site Reliability Engineering, Cloud Infrastructure Orchestration, Engineering Operations, Security implementation and you will work with Production Engineering, Software Development, QA and our Customer-facing teams to ensure requisite levels of infrastructure, application and software security/quality.<br><br><strong><u>Responsibilities<br></u></strong><ul><li> Drive the architectural efforts to improve resiliency, efficiency, performance, and costs.</li><li> Ensure the systems are highly reliable, available, free from threats &amp; vulnerabilities in cloud, internal environments, and applications for engineering stakeholders.</li><li> Write programs or scripts to replace manual tasks and automate the services to make it stable and operable.</li><li> Develop systems in place for the three pillars of observability- Logs, metrics, and traces. </li><li> Integrate various systems for better monitoring mechanisms in place by writing code, integrating APIs and plugins and prepare dashboards for better visibility.</li><li> Enabling systems for early problem detections with effective alerts &amp; monitors for cloud and on-prem infrastructure.</li><li> Be responsible to remediate tickets in Issue Tracking systems.</li><li> Be responsible to identify risks, defects, bottlenecks, and anything that can impair quality, availability, performance of deployed workloads/applications.</li><li> Secure OnPrem and Public Cloud environments leveraging IAC<br></li></ul><strong><u>Minimum Qualifications<br></u></strong><ul><li> 8+ relevant experience in cloud, DevOps, operations, security principles and trends with 2+ years of experience in software engineering.</li><li> Strong problem-solving, analytical skills, willing to take up complex challenges and triage environmental issues.</li><li> Strong programming &amp; scripting experience using Python, Shell, Java, C#, Yaml, Json, Restful API services etc.</li><li> Extensive experience in public cloud service like AWS, Azure, GCP and on-prem servers.</li><li> Extensive experience in Linux/Unix systems and networking fundamentals. </li><li> Extensive experience in monitoring &amp; logging tools such as Grafana, CheckMK, Prometheus, Loki, Elastic search, Kibana etc.</li><li> Extensive experience in DevOps tools such as Jenkins, Bitbucket, Gitlab etc.</li><li> Extensive experience with container ecosystems such as Docker, Kubernetes, Kubeflow etc.</li><li> Excellent knowledge in microservices, VMs deployments, Windows &amp; Linux servers.</li><li> Good knowledge in maintaining Kubernetes clusters, ensuring security, compliance and 24/7 availability of deployed workloads.</li><li> Good knowledge in AWS Cloud formation, Infra automation using Terraform, chef, ansible or puppet.</li><li> Understanding of relevant database technologies (MySQL, PostgreSQL, MongoDB, etc.)</li><li> Thorough understanding of Agile, Scrum and SaFe Agile principles. </li><li> Self-managed, fast learner, and aptitude to learn quickly.</li><li> Excellent verbal and written communication skills and a good listener.</li><li> Exceptional team player who works well in collaborative situations.</li><li> Ability to brainstorm and represent competing ideas simultaneously.</li><li> Growth mindset who is passionate about learning and applying new technologies.</li><li> BS / MS degree (Computer Science, Electronics Engineering, or equivalent technical degree)<br></li></ul><strong><u>Benefits<br></u></strong><ul><li> Flexible home office! We offer the flexibility of a hybrid work schedule or 100% remote</li><li> Named Top Workplace for the 8th year in a row</li><li> Wind River’s commitment to DEIB</li><li> 100% Employee covered Medical, Dental, and Vision insurance*</li><li> Flexible Time Off policy* + 12 observed Holidays</li><li> 401K with company match</li><li> Health Savings Account (HSA) and Flexible Spending Account (FSA)</li><li> Wellness Benefits through Unmind</li><li>varies by region and country<br></li></ul><strong><u>Compensation<br><br></u></strong>The annual base salary range for this role’s listed grade level is currently $122,100-$165,780 plus bonus for Colorado residents, New York and New Jersey residents, and $135,100-$182,420 plus bonus for California and Washington residents. Salary ranges are determined through interviews and a review of education, experience, knowledge, skills, location and abilities of the applicant, and equity with other team members. Employees in this role are also eligible for the following benefits in accordance with the terms of the Company's plans: health, dental, vision insurance, life insurance, flex time off, eligibility to enroll in 401k, 12 paid holidays.

title: Lead .Net Developer
description: Take your career to the next level as an embedded software engineer, using your expertise in embedded C and MATLAB/Simulink to develop advanced features for the off-highway autonomous vehicle industry and push the technology of flagship vehicles such as tractors, harvesters, combines, and excavators to the next level.<br><ul><li>Your Responsibilities:*</li><li>Design, develop, and test software for enterprise programming and infrastructure solutions</li><li>Operate in a scrum team environment on varying project scope and direction from a project lead</li><li>Support the team with concept, development and testing of solutions</li><li>Software:*</li><li>Embedded C/C++</li><li>MATLAB/Simulink</li><li>Qualifications:*</li><li>Demonstrated capability in software product development using C++, C, Python and scripting languages</li><li>Training or experience with Object-Oriented Analysis/Design (OOA/D) and multi-threaded systems</li><li>Experience that demonstrates you are a self-starter, and able to work well without close direction</li><li>Demonstrated capability performing in an engineering team environment and interfacing with engineers and personnel of other disciplines</li><li>Minimum of 2 years of software industry experience<br><br></li></ul>About Actalent:<br><br>Actalent connects passion with purpose. Our scalable talent solutions and services capabilities drive value and results and provide the expertise to help our customers achieve more. Every day, our experts around the globe are making an impact. We’re supporting critical initiatives in engineering and sciences that advance how companies serve the world. Actalent promotes consultant care and engagement through experiences that enable continuous development. Our people are the difference. Actalent is an operating company of Allegis Group, the global leader in talent solutions. The company is an equal opportunity employer and will consider all applications without regards to race, sex, age, color, religion, national origin, veteran status, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, genetic information or any characteristic protected by law.

title: Microsoft Developer – Hybrid
description: Open for "C2H" only.We are Wipro (NYSE: WIT), a rapidly expanding and leading global Information Technology, Consulting and Business Process Services company with over 225,000 employees worldwide, servicing clients in 175+ cities and 69 countries across 6 continents. For more information, please visit Role: Sysyem EngineerLocation-IL.Role Description:Performs Problem determination and resolution of mobile Equipment and Software problems through the effective use of available technical resources. Resolves Problems, including completing all related administrative duties. Resolves Customer's Equipment/Software mobility Problem tickets.Below is the JD- Field Support EngineerThe Field Support Engineer will be responsible for the installation, configuration, and troubleshooting of network infrastructure hardware and software. This position supports a broad range of IT hardware and software.The selected professional will be responsible for working with end users about the issues related to physical workstations, including laptops, desktops, peripherals, network devices, among others. Individual should also be well versed about remote troubleshooting and remote desktop support, Physical hardware inventory etc.In addition, they will also be responsible for serving in a client-facing role to carry out imaging and deploying desktop equipment, fielding onsite escalations from services desk, supervisor and customer.Responsibilities: Responsible for installing, maintaining and repairing company and multi-vendor systems which include hardware, software and networking products as well as operating systems.Diagnose and resolve various hardware performance issues, make decisions when appropriate related to replacing existing user workstation equipment and carry out the entire product replacement process, including the removal of existing IT assets as well as the implementation of new IT assets.Takes responsibility for potential or desired follow-up services or problem escalation.Should contribute directly to the implementation of new company service solutions, or short projects as per the supervisor?s directives.Manage all IT assets, including tagging in / out existing and new IT assets as they are rolled out to end users.Ensure the best possible experience when setting up new user equipment, perform the necessary onsite testing to assure existing and / or new employees have access to equipment, applications, and various other technical solutions.Friendly presence and helpful attitude; good interpersonal skills and ability to work well with others.Good problem solving skills; ability to visualize a problem or situation and think abstractly to solve it.Ability to handle constantly changing flow of traffic; remain productive during slow times, be able to multitask effectively during busy times, exercise patience and professionalism during stressful situations.Dealing with hardware and application support queries and issues reported to the Field Services teamTake ownership and responsibility of an issues from start through to a successful resolutionEscalate issues and involve experts wherever required in order to resolve issues as quickly as possibleEnsures that supported customer accurately completes the approved work request with the date and time of submissionDevelop sound understanding of IT operations and related applications and IT systems as well as business related processes and proceduresDevelop technical knowledge of each system within company profile and specialized knowledge of certain nominated areasMaintain adequate knowledge of operating systems and application software used to provide a high level of supportMaintains and consistently demonstrates a general knowledge of company guidelines, processes, practices and proceduresWhen the restoration is beyond the scope of the Service Desk Agent he/she will escalate the issue/problem to proper tier 2 and 3 support team membersRequirements5+ years of experience working in a field services support capacity, with specific experience in the configuration, implementation, and maintenance of IT assets (Laptops, Desktops, Peripherals), troubleshooting and resolving any and all technical issues which require onsite service support.Knowledge and practical experience troubleshooting and supporting local area data networking (hardware/software/protocols and best practices).Knowledge of Incident Management, Service Request management, DEPOT model etc.Proficiency in Microsoft Desktop OS (domain environment), Desktop application related configurations, troubleshooting etc..Knowledge of standard Microsoft Productivity Applications such as Microsoft Office and Outlook. Familiarity with all major web browsers including Google Chrome and Mozilla Firefox, EDGE and IE etc.Working knowledge of Apple-MAC operating systems and devices configuration and troubleshootingWorking knowledge of ServiceNow ticketing tool.Wipro is an Equal Employment Opportunity employer and makes all employment and employment-related decisions without regard to a person's race, sex, national origin, ancestry, disability, sexual orientation, or any other status protected by applicable law TIS Service Desk System Engineer

title: Embedded Software Engineer
description: <ul><li>Looking for:* *-Proficient in Excel (Highly proficient skills: create spreadsheets, formulas, Vlook ups and pivot tables is a plus)* *-2-4 years of data heavy position* *-HS Diploma or GED*</li><li>Hours:* Monday through Friday</li><li>8am to 5pm* 2 days in office, 3 days remote</li><li>Description:* The new business job family roles will be responsible for the retrieval, validation, and processing of all worksite and group benefit enrollment files and manual production submissions inclusive of file balancing and audits. The team will be responsible for accurate processing of new enrollments, routing of benefit changes, and handling of termination notifications. Job responsibilities:</li><li>Ability to work with large data sets and run simple formula (VLOOKUP and logic functions are a plus)</li><li>Perform quality assurance and testing to ensure accuracy of setup and ability to process new business</li><li>Retrieve data files from various enrollment platforms and secure server transmissions; validate format and completeness of information received based upon product requirements, and prepare to load into administrative system</li><li>Review state and product compliance requirements, ensure appropriate approvals have been received</li><li>Provide support to field sales, brokers, and employer groups to resolve issues, collect missing information, and ensure accuracy of information received</li><li>Investigate errors that occur on assigned employer groups, research issue and follow through to resolution partnering with internal stakeholders</li><li>Escalate errors and risks as appropriate to bring to resolution and management intervention</li><li>Meet or exceed department established production and quality goals, ensuring service levels are met</li><li>Provide superior customer support to internal and external customers<br><br></li></ul>About Aston Carter:<br><br>Please Note: Scammers are posing as Aston Carter. We'll never contact you via Gmail, Telegram, or WhatsApp and we'll never solicit money from you.<br><br>At Aston Carter, we’re dedicated to expanding career opportunities for the skilled professionals who power our business. title: Systems Engineer
description: We’re building a relationship-oriented bank for the modern world. We need talented, passionate professionals who are dedicated to doing what’s right for our clients.<p><br></p>At CIBC, we embrace your strengths and your ambitions, so you are empowered at work. Our team members have what they need to make a meaningful impact and are truly valued for who they are and what they contribute.<p><br></p>To learn more about CIBC, please visit CIBC.com<p><br></p><strong>Job Description</strong><p><br></p>The Data Governance Analyst supports ongoing critical data identification and definition activities. The incumbent will be responsible for two critical functions: 1) use independent judgement to identify, anticipate and oversee identification of data that is critical to strategic business objectives and 2) execution of data policy and standard requirements for identified critical data elements in partnership with lines of business and functional groups. The ideal candidate will bring a variety of skills, be proactive in solving problems, be able to work independently and part of a team, and be comfortable communicating with many different levels of employees across the organization.<p><br></p><strong>Business Unit Description</strong><p><br></p>The US Data Management Office is responsible for establishing data as a strategic asset for CIBC US Region, further enhancing data governance, building out our data and analytic capabilities, and developing the US Region data management strategy.<p><br></p>Our strategy: Leverage data and analytics to build competitive advantage to enhance our client focus. To facilitate this, we will:<p><br></p><ul><li>Improve our data quality through focused data governance programs and processes</li><li>Use new data technology to increase agility and reduce cost</li><li>Become an analytics leader, focusing on continuous advancement</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Position Responsibilities</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Analyze reporting outputs to trace metrics back to underlying data components and sources to facilitate critical data identification and classification discussions with business Subject Matter Experts</li><li>Coordinate with stakeholders across the business and technology to define critical data including business, technical and operational metadata attributes</li><li>Monitoring, measuring and taking action to address data quality within the US Data Catalog by incorporating and understanding information from a variety of sources to recommend a course of action</li><li>Escalating, managing and reporting critical data identification and definition issues with transparency, as well as effectively creating accountability with those who fail to maintain these standards</li><li>Be informed and engaged as a subject matter expert on data-related regulatory requirements, organizational policies and standards, as well as industry best practices</li><li>Provide appropriate guidance, education, training, and communication to all relevant stakeholders</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Qualifications</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>5 years of related work experience in Data Governance</li><li>Broad and comprehensive knowledge and understanding of banking operations and data governance concepts (DCAM preferred) </li><li>Disciplined self-starter with strong analytical, logical, reasoning and problem-solving skills</li><li>Ability to prioritize and handle multiple tasks in a fast-paced environment with attention to detail and accuracy</li><li>Confidence to work directly with all levels of management and facilitate meetings</li><li>Excellent communication skills - both verbally and written</li><li>Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite (Excel, PowerPoint and Word) and SharePoint</li><li>Ability to work flexibly in a team environment</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>What You Need To Know</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>CIBC is committed to creating an inclusive environment where all team members and clients feel like they belong. We seek applicants with a wide range of abilities and we provide an accessible candidate experience. If you need accommodation, please contact Mailbox.careers-carrieres@cibc.com</li><li>You need to be legally eligible to work at the location(s) specified above and, where applicable, must have a valid work or study permit.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Job Location</strong><p><br></p>IL-70 W Madison St, 8th Fl<p><br></p><strong>Employment Type</strong><p><br></p>Regular<p><br></p><strong>Weekly Hours</strong><p><br></p>40<p><br></p><strong>Skills</strong><p><br></p>Data Analysis, Data Governance, Data Management, Facilitation, Microsoft Power BI, Prioritization, Problem Solving, Project Management, Working Independently

title: Learning Engineer
description: <strong>Department: </strong>IPR - Inst for Policy Res<p><br></p><strong>Salary/Grade: </strong>ITS/80<p><br></p><strong><u>Job Summary</u></strong><p><br></p>The Center for Neighborhood Engaged Research &amp; Science (CORNERS) at Northwestern University is seeking a Database Systems Engineer to join our growing team. CORNERS conducts cutting-edge research into the ways that network and neighborhood science can be used to understand gun violence and help our community and civic partners build safer, healthier, more equitable neighborhoods. Learn more about our work at www.cornersresearch.org.<p><br></p>The Database Systems Engineer will manage all of CORNERS’ database and data/file management systems, including our Google Cloud Platform and secure SharePoint sites. We are looking for individuals with a broad technical skillset and strong communication skills. The Database Systems Engineer will serve as a liaison to various internal and external stakeholders, including Northwestern University’s IT community and data managers from CORNERS’ partner organizers. This individual will be responsible for helping debug issues related to data access and analysis and will serve as the Center’s primary data manager and as an analyst on our growing data team, when needed.<p><br></p>The Database Systems Engineer will be a full-time employee of Northwestern University with full benefits. They will work alongside CORNERS’ team members on the Evanston campus of Northwestern University.<p><br></p>This is a two-year, term-limited position. Opportunity for renewal will be based on performance and available funding.<p><br></p><strong><u>Specific Responsibilities</u></strong><p><br></p><em> Strategic Planning </em><p><br></p><ul><li> Understands user objectives and goals and can translate those goals and objectives into actionable plans. </li></ul><p><br></p><em> Administration </em><p><br></p><ul><li> Reviews and recommends enhancements to policies, procedures, and standards relating to database management. </li><li> Supports data backup and recovery processes. </li><li> Develops and maintains supporting documentation. </li><li> Ensures that appropriate patches are applied in a timely fashion. </li></ul><p><br></p><em> Development </em><p><br></p><ul><li> Designs, configures and implements databases. </li><li> Creates database objects. </li></ul><p><br></p><em> Performance </em><p><br></p><ul><li> Coordinates quality control and auditing of databases to ensure accurate and appropriate use of data. </li><li> Ensures data integrity. </li><li> Prioritizes and resolves database issues. </li><li> Coordinates maintenance and use of data dictionary. </li><li> Performs software installations and upgrades to databases. </li><li> Monitors and responds to security alerts. </li></ul><p><br></p><em> Miscellaneous </em><p><br></p><ul><li> Performs other duties as assigned. </li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Minimum Qualifications</u></strong>      <ul><li> Successful completion of a full 4-year course of study in an accredited college or university leading to a bachelor's or higher degree in a major such as computer science, information technology, or related; OR appropriate combination of education and experience. </li><li> 2 years database administration or other relevant experience required. </li><li> Please see information highlighted below.</li><ul><li> Infrastructure</li><ul><li> Code Repositories (Git, Subversion) </li><li> identity management/provisioning </li><li> information security </li><li> Linux Operating System </li><li> Mac OS X Operating System </li><li> Microsoft Office (Word, Excel, Powerpoint, Access, Outlook) </li><li> Microsoft SharePoint </li><li> SQL/MySQL/Postgres </li><li> Windows Operating System </li><li> Google Cloud Platform; virtual machine maintenance </li></ul><li> Programming Languages and Frameworks</li><ul><li> Python </li><li> R </li></ul><li> Compliance</li><ul><li> IRB </li></ul><li> Analytical</li><ul><li> critical thinking </li><li> data mining </li><li> data modeling </li><li> database design/ data structure </li><li> Debugging </li><li> judgment </li><li> metadata creation and management </li><li> problem solving </li><li> Troubleshooting </li><li> use-case analysis </li></ul><li> Project</li><ul><li> Code documentation </li><li> Collaboration and teamwork </li><li> Functional documentation </li><li> Organizational skills </li><li> Workflow development &amp; documentation </li></ul></ul></ul><p><br></p><strong> Minimum Competencies: (Skills, knowledge, and abilities.) </strong><p><br></p><ul><li> Basic familiarity with command line coding. </li><li> Experience working with structured and relationship databases. </li><li> Respect and discretion when it comes to handling sensitive data. </li><li> Basic familiarity working with social science data. </li><li> Experience with basic statistical modeling of social science data. </li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Preferred Qualifications</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li> Master’s degree at an accredited college or university OR undergraduate degree with equivalent work experience. Field of study open but technical training is required. </li><li> Proficiency in R required. </li><li> Experience with Python and SQL strongly preferred. </li><li> 4 years data management or similar experience required. </li></ul><p><br></p><strong> Preferred Competencies: (Skills, knowledge, and abilities) </strong><p><br></p><ul><li> Strong attention to detail. </li><li> Ability to work independently with a high degree of initiative and self-motivation required. </li><li> Ability to prioritize and balance competing demands and make decisions that you can stand by. </li><li> Excellent communication skills and experience collaborating with diverse stakeholders. </li><li> Experience scraping the web for data and/or creating datasets. </li><li> Experience building ETL (extract, transform, load) pipelines for processing, storing, and disseminating administrative data. </li><li> Experience developing and maintaining systems and culture for reproducible, transparent, version-controlled research and analysis using cloud storage and Git/GitHub. </li><li> Familiarity with geographic/spatial analysis. </li><li> Familiarity with network science and social network analysis. </li><li> Working knowledge of social science research design and statistical analysis. </li><li> Proficiency with various coding languages, (e.g., R, Python). </li><li> Proficiency with basic statistical software (e.g., R, Stata). </li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Benefits</u></strong><p><br></p>At Northwestern, we are proud to provide meaningful, competitive, high-quality health care plans, retirement benefits, tuition discounts and more! Visit us at https://www.northwestern.edu/hr/benefits/index.html to learn more.<p><br></p><strong><u>Work-Life And Wellness</u></strong><p><br></p>Northwestern offers comprehensive programs and services to help you and your family navigate life’s challenges and opportunities, and adopt and maintain healthy lifestyles.<p><br></p>We support flexible work arrangements where possible and programs to help you locate and pay for quality, affordable childcare and senior/adult care. Visit us at https://www.northwestern.edu/hr/benefits/work-life/index.html to learn more. <strong> <strong> Professional Growth &amp; Development: <br><br></strong>Northwestern supports employee career development in all circumstances whether your workspace is on campus or at home. If you’re interested in developing your professional potential or continuing your formal education, we offer a variety of tools and resources. Visit us at https://www.northwestern.edu/hr/learning/index.html to learn more. <br><br></strong>Northwestern strongly recommends COVID-19 vaccinations and boosters for people who can obtain them as a critical tool for minimizing severe illness. More information can be found on the COVID-19 and Campus Updates webpage.<br><br><em>The Northwestern campus sits on the traditional homelands of the people of the Council of Three Fires, the Ojibwe, Potawatomi, and Odawa as well as the Menominee, Miami and Ho-Chunk nations. We acknowledge and honor the original people of the land upon which Northwestern University stands, and the Native people who remain on this land today.<br><br></em><em>Northwestern University is an Equal Opportunity, Affirmative Action Employer of all protected classes, including veterans and individuals with disabilities. Women, racial and ethnic minorities, individuals with disabilities, and veterans are encouraged to apply. Click for information on EEO is the Law.</em>

Opportunity for renewal will be based on performance and available funding.<p><br></p><strong><u>Specific Responsibilities</u></strong><p><br></p><em> Strategic Planning </em><p><br></p><ul><li> Understands user objectives and goals and can translate those goals and objectives into actionable plans. </li></ul><p><br></p><em> Administration </em><p><br></p><ul><li> Reviews and recommends enhancements to policies, procedures, and standards relating to database management. </li><li> Supports data backup and recovery processes. </li><li> Develops and maintains supporting documentation. </li><li> Ensures that appropriate patches are applied in a timely fashion. </li></ul><p><br></p><em> Development </em><p><br></p><ul><li> Designs, configures and implements databases. </li><li> Creates database objects. </li></ul><p><br></p><em> Performance </em><p><br></p><ul><li> Coordinates quality control and auditing of databases to ensure accurate and appropriate use of data. </li><li> Ensures data integrity. </li><li> Prioritizes and resolves database issues. </li><li> Coordinates maintenance and use of data dictionary. </li><li> Performs software installations and upgrades to databases. </li><li> Monitors and responds to security alerts. </li></ul><p><br></p><em> Miscellaneous </em><p><br></p><ul><li> Performs other duties as assigned. </li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Minimum Qualifications</u></strong>      <ul><li> Successful completion of a full 4-year course of study in an accredited college or university leading to a bachelor's or higher degree in a major such as computer science, information technology, or related; OR appropriate combination of education and experience. </li><li> 2 years database administration or other relevant experience required. </li><li> Please see information highlighted below.</li><ul><li> Infrastructure</li><ul><li> Code Repositories (Git, Subversion) </li><li> identity management/provisioning </li><li> information security </li><li> Linux Operating System </li><li> Mac OS X Operating System </li><li> Microsoft Office (Word, Excel, Powerpoint, Access, Outlook) </li><li> Microsoft SharePoint </li><li> SQL/MySQL/Postgres </li><li> Windows Operating System </li><li> Google Cloud Platform; virtual machine maintenance </li></ul><li> Programming Languages and Frameworks</li><ul><li> Python </li><li> R </li></ul><li> Compliance</li><ul><li> IRB </li></ul><li> Analytical</li><ul><li> critical thinking </li><li> data mining </li><li> data modeling </li><li> database design/ data structure </li><li> Debugging </li><li> judgment </li><li> metadata creation and management </li><li> problem solving </li><li> Troubleshooting </li><li> use-case analysis </li></ul><li> Project</li><ul><li> Code documentation </li><li> Collaboration and teamwork </li><li> Functional documentation </li><li> Organizational skills </li><li> Workflow development &amp; documentation </li></ul></ul></ul><p><br></p><strong> Minimum Competencies: (Skills, knowledge, and abilities.) </strong><p><br></p><ul><li> Basic familiarity with command line coding. </li><li> Experience working with structured and relationship databases. </li><li> Respect and discretion when it comes to handling sensitive data. </li><li> Basic familiarity working with social science data. </li><li> Experience with basic statistical modeling of social science data. </li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Preferred Qualifications</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li> Master’s degree at an accredited college or university OR undergraduate degree with equivalent work experience. Field of study open but technical training is required. </li><li> Proficiency in R required. </li><li> Experience with Python and SQL strongly preferred. </li><li> 4 years data management or similar experience required. </li></ul><p><br></p><strong> Preferred Competencies: (Skills, knowledge, and abilities) </strong><p><br></p><ul><li> Strong attention to detail. </li><li> Ability to work independently with a high degree of initiative and self-motivation required. </li><li> Ability to prioritize and balance competing demands and make decisions that you can stand by. </li><li> Excellent communication skills and experience collaborating with diverse stakeholders. </li><li> Experience scraping the web for data and/or creating datasets. </li><li> Experience building ETL (extract, transform, load) pipelines for processing, storing, and disseminating administrative data. </li><li> Experience developing and maintaining systems and culture for reproducible, transparent, version-controlled research and analysis using cloud storage and Git/GitHub. </li><li> Familiarity with geographic/spatial analysis. </li><li> Familiarity with network science and social network analysis. </li><li> Working knowledge of social science research design and statistical analysis. </li><li> Proficiency with various coding languages, (e.g., R, Python). </li><li> Proficiency with basic statistical software (e.g., R, Stata). </li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Benefits</u></strong><p><br></p>At Northwestern, we are proud to provide meaningful, competitive, high-quality health care plans, retirement benefits, tuition discounts and more! Visit us at https://www.northwestern.edu/hr/benefits/index.html to learn more.<p><br></p><strong><u>Work-Life And Wellness</u></strong><p><br></p>Northwestern offers comprehensive programs and services to help you and your family navigate life’s challenges and opportunities, and adopt and maintain healthy lifestyles.<p><br></p>We support flexible work arrangements where possible and programs to help you locate and pay for quality, affordable childcare and senior/adult care. Visit us at https://www.northwestern.edu/hr/benefits/work-life/index.html to learn more. <strong> <strong> Professional Growth &amp; Development: <br><br></strong>Northwestern supports employee career development in all circumstances whether your workspace is on campus or at home. If you’re interested in developing your professional potential or continuing your formal education, we offer a variety of tools and resources. Visit us at https://www.northwestern.edu/hr/learning/index.html to learn more. <br><br></strong>Northwestern strongly recommends COVID-19 vaccinations and boosters for people who can obtain them as a critical tool for minimizing severe illness. More information can be found on the COVID-19 and Campus Updates webpage.<br><br><em>The Northwestern campus sits on the traditional homelands of the people of the Council of Three Fires, the Ojibwe, Potawatomi, and Odawa as well as the Menominee, Miami and Ho-Chunk nations. We acknowledge and honor the original people of the land upon which Northwestern University stands, and the Native people who remain on this land today.<br><br></em><em>Northwestern University is an Equal Opportunity, Affirmative Action Employer of all protected classes, including veterans and individuals with disabilities. Women, racial and ethnic minorities, individuals with disabilities, and veterans are encouraged to apply. Click for information on EEO is the Law.</em>

title: Shared Services / Site Reliability Engineer
description: Top Growing Global Markets Prop Trading Shop - Hiring Infrastructure/Systems EngineersThis Jobot Job is hosted by: Ryan KilroyAre you a fit? Easy Apply now by clicking the "Apply Now" button and sending us your resume.Salary: $100,000 - $175,000 per yearA bit about us:Founded over 45 years ago- we are a privately held global markets proprietary trading firm with offices in Chicago, Caribbean, and Europe. We use next generation technology to capture opportunities around the world and manage risk in financial markets. Our mission is to bless others through the services we provide and through generous stewardship of the wealth we create. We are a well-established and profitable business as a respected member of the global financial system for over 40 years, but also is like a startup because the potential of our group is at least one order of magnitude greater than what we are currently producing. We have an entrepreneurial culture and collaboratively develop our business with patience and discipline; we work hard, learn constantly, and relentlessly improve our expertise.Why join us?Responsibilities Ownership over our data center infrastructure, tasked with all aspects of keeping it up and operating in an optimal and reliable manner Contacting third-party vendors about remote equipment installation and maintenance and then supervising those projects through completion Performing hardware installation and troubleshooting existing hardware Documenting both new and established procedures to establish and foster best practices firmwide Cooperating with other engineers to provide stable and secure deployments of new infrastructure components Working with network engineers to reliably upgrade and replace old network equipment Developing an automated provisioning system and keeping the inventory system up to date Troubleshooting software issues that might be related to hardware failures Providing in-office hardware support Working as part of an in-office team to collaborate directly with our experienced traders and technologists on brainstorming and implementing creative solutions to a wide range of problemsJob DetailsRequirements BA/BS/MS degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, or related experience 2+ years of experience in related field Hands-on experience cabling, racking, and installing bare metal servers, network devices, and network cards Experience with remote management tools for servers (iDrac, iLO) Understanding of automated provisioning tools (PXE, Foreman) and ability to create installation files Experience with Linux at the administration level (Debian, CentOS) Working experience with Windows is a plus Practical knowledge of inventory tools (Netbox) Good understanding of monitoring tools (Icinga2, Grafana, ELK) Experience with infrastructure management tools (Ansible, Puppet) Good management skills with ticketing and documentation tools (Jira, Confluence) Experience with scripting and automation (Python, Bash or other) is a plus Experience in a low latency environment a strong plus, e.g., Solarflare, Onload, PTPAdditional Requirements Flexibility to occasionally work outside of core business hours and on weekends. Ability to travel and provide support to other regions occasionally as needed. This position requires physical presence and is onsite (no remote work)Interested in hearing more? Easy Apply now by clicking the "Apply Now" button. Infrastructure Engineer

title: SOFTWARE DEVELOPER (contract)
description: Open for "C2H" only.We are Wipro (NYSE: WIT), a rapidly expanding and leading global Information Technology, Consulting and Business Process Services company with over 225,000 employees worldwide, servicing clients in 175+ cities and 69 countries across 6 continents. For more information, please visit Role: Sysyem EngineerLocation-IL.Role Description:Performs Problem determination and resolution of mobile Equipment and Software problems through the effective use of available technical resources. Resolves Problems, including completing all related administrative duties. Resolves Customer's Equipment/Software mobility Problem tickets.Below is the JD- Field Support EngineerThe Field Support Engineer will be responsible for the installation, configuration, and troubleshooting of network infrastructure hardware and software. This position supports a broad range of IT hardware and software.The selected professional will be responsible for working with end users about the issues related to physical workstations, including laptops, desktops, peripherals, network devices, among others. Individual should also be well versed about remote troubleshooting and remote desktop support, Physical hardware inventory etc.In addition, they will also be responsible for serving in a client-facing role to carry out imaging and deploying desktop equipment, fielding onsite escalations from services desk, supervisor and customer.Responsibilities: Responsible for installing, maintaining and repairing company and multi-vendor systems which include hardware, software and networking products as well as operating systems.Diagnose and resolve various hardware performance issues, make decisions when appropriate related to replacing existing user workstation equipment and carry out the entire product replacement process, including the removal of existing IT assets as well as the implementation of new IT assets.Takes responsibility for potential or desired follow-up services or problem escalation.Should contribute directly to the implementation of new company service solutions, or short projects as per the supervisor?s directives.Manage all IT assets, including tagging in / out existing and new IT assets as they are rolled out to end users.Ensure the best possible experience when setting up new user equipment, perform the necessary onsite testing to assure existing and / or new employees have access to equipment, applications, and various other technical solutions.Friendly presence and helpful attitude; good interpersonal skills and ability to work well with others.Good problem solving skills; ability to visualize a problem or situation and think abstractly to solve it.Ability to handle constantly changing flow of traffic; remain productive during slow times, be able to multitask effectively during busy times, exercise patience and professionalism during stressful situations.Dealing with hardware and application support queries and issues reported to the Field Services teamTake ownership and responsibility of an issues from start through to a successful resolutionEscalate issues and involve experts wherever required in order to resolve issues as quickly as possibleEnsures that supported customer accurately completes the approved work request with the date and time of submissionDevelop sound understanding of IT operations and related applications and IT systems as well as business related processes and proceduresDevelop technical knowledge of each system within company profile and specialized knowledge of certain nominated areasMaintain adequate knowledge of operating systems and application software used to provide a high level of supportMaintains and consistently demonstrates a general knowledge of company guidelines, processes, practices and proceduresWhen the restoration is beyond the scope of the Service Desk Agent he/she will escalate the issue/problem to proper tier 2 and 3 support team membersRequirements5+ years of experience working in a field services support capacity, with specific experience in the configuration, implementation, and maintenance of IT assets (Laptops, Desktops, Peripherals), troubleshooting and resolving any and all technical issues which require onsite service support.Knowledge and practical experience troubleshooting and supporting local area data networking (hardware/software/protocols and best practices).Knowledge of Incident Management, Service Request management, DEPOT model etc.Proficiency in Microsoft Desktop OS (domain environment), Desktop application related configurations, troubleshooting etc..Knowledge of standard Microsoft Productivity Applications such as Microsoft Office and Outlook. Familiarity with all major web browsers including Google Chrome and Mozilla Firefox, EDGE and IE etc.Working knowledge of Apple-MAC operating systems and devices configuration and troubleshootingWorking knowledge of ServiceNow ticketing tool.Wipro is an Equal Employment Opportunity employer and makes all employment and employment-related decisions without regard to a person's race, sex, national origin, ancestry, disability, sexual orientation, or any other status protected by applicable law Desktop Support System Engineer

title: .NET Developer
description: <p><span>Write clean, scalable code using .Net/ C# programming language</span></p><p><span>Test and deploy applications and systems.</span></p><p><span>Develop documentation throughout the software development life cycle (SDLC).</span></p><p><span>Collaborate with Scrum Masters, Product Managers, Application and Data Lake Leads to deliver complex products from inception to implementation.</span></p><p><span>Engages with business partners to analyze, implement, and update .NET framework application needs by utilizing sound process improvement models and techniques.</span></p><p><span>Utilize Microsoft BI tools (.NET 4.0/4.5.2, MS SQL Server 2008/2012/2016/2018 and SSIS) to manage the design, development, and implementation of enhancements.</span></p><p><span>Contribute to the technical and operational feasibility of reporting &amp; UI's by creating well designed database solutions.</span></p><p><span>Build action plans and drives execution while Marshalls in appropriate partners to achieve objectives.</span></p>

title: System Engineer
description: AHEAD builds platforms for digital business. By weaving together advances in cloud infrastructure, automation and analytics, and software delivery, we help enterprises deliver on the promise of digital transformation.<br><br>At AHEAD, we prioritize creating a culture of belonging, where all perspectives and voices are represented, valued, respected, and heard. We create spaces to empower everyone to speak up, make change, and drive the culture at AHEAD.<br><br>We are an equal opportunity employer, and do not discriminate based on an individual's race, national origin, color, gender, gender identity, gender expression, sexual orientation, religion, age, disability, marital status, or any other protected characteristic under applicable law, whether actual or perceived.<br><br><em><strong>We embrace all candidates that will contribute to the diversification and enrichment of ideas and perspectives at AHEAD. <br><br></strong></em>AHEAD is looking for Data Migration Engineer to work closely with our dynamic project teams (both on-site and remotely). This Data Migration Engineer will be responsible for providing technical expertise to help organizations design, architect, and implement large database migrations, generally from on-premises systems to cloud-based solutions.<br><br>The consultant will have to have previous experience guiding migrations from technical perspective. Examples would be migrating existing MSSQL server environment with 20 to 200 servers to Azure. They should have the experience recommend tools to assist the migration, and the technical skills to operate them.<br><br>This consultant will architect, design, build, and support modern data environments that reside in the public cloud or multi-cloud enterprise architectures. They will be expected to be hands-on, but also be client-facing and present to leadership.<br><br><strong><u>Responsibilities<br></u></strong><ul><li>Assess existing database environments migration planning</li><li>Design appropriate target architectures in the Cloud platform</li><li>Document design and key technical issues for communication with client engineers</li><li>Integrate solution with data governance monitoring tools</li><li>Knowledgeable about the various platforms used for ingesting, cleansing and transformation of data, both legacy and cloud solutions.</li><li>Engineers and supports data structures including but not limited to SQL and NoSQL databases</li><li>Leverages the right tools for the right job to deliver testable, maintainable, and modern data solutions</li><li>Respond to customer/team inquiries and assist in troubleshooting and resolving challenges</li><li>Works with and guides other scrum team members to estimate and deliver work inside of a sprint</li><li>Research data questions identify root causes and interact closely with business users and technical resources<br></li></ul><strong><u>Qualifications<br></u></strong><ul><li>3+ years of professional technical experience with real world experience migrating existing data environments to the cloud</li><li>Deep understanding of SQL and related technologies</li><li>Experience with building highly scalable Big Data solutions using Hadoop, Spark, stream processing, and Lambda architecture</li><li>Experience in an IT strategy &amp; enterprise architecture / consulting role in an organization that has executed large scale migrations to cloud.</li><li>Proven experience with Cloud infrastructure and security</li><li>Experience implementing complex solutions in large enterprise companies</li><li>Cloud Certification (AWS, Azure, GCP) would be advantageous</li><li>Strong client-facing communication and facilitation skills<br></li></ul><strong><u>Key Skills<br></u></strong><ul><li>Organizing and running complex data migrations to the cloud (AWS, Azure, GCP)</li><li>Data Migration tools (Striim, iSpirer, DVT)</li><li>Migvisor</li><li>Traditional data environment (OLAP/OLTP servers, ETL platforms)</li><li>Cloud Data Services</li><li>Oracle or MSSQL, NoSQL, ETL/ELT, Spark, Data Warehouse, Data Lake, Snowflake<br></li></ul><strong><u>Why AHEAD<br><br></u></strong>Through our daily work and internal groups like Moving Women AHEAD and RISE AHEAD, we value and benefit from diversity of people, ideas, experience, and everything in between.<br><br>We fuel growth by stacking our office with top-notch technologies in a multi-million-dollar lab, by encouraging cross department training and development, sponsoring certifications and credentials for continued learning.<br><br>We understand that you have a life outside of work. That’s why we offer flexible paid time off, paid company holidays, and the ability for you to manage your work schedule as needed.

That’s why we offer flexible paid time off, paid company holidays, and the ability for you to manage your work schedule as needed.

title: Data Analyst (19-22/hr)

title: Application Developer
description: <strong>Job Description:</strong><p><br></p><strong>The Job/What You’ll Do:</strong><p><br></p>AssetMark is seeking a Business Intelligence Analyst for the Marketing team. In this hands-on role, this person will be responsible for partnering with various departments and business units to implement data solutions that will provide robust insights to the business. This includes creating processes for receiving and transferring data to and from various business partner systems, transforming and combining data from various sources, designing schemas for the data, developing critical metrics, and delivering reporting solutions. This individual must be capable of interfacing with all levels of the organization to achieve success.<p><br></p><strong>We can consider candidates for this position who are able to accommodate a hybrid work schedule and are close to any one of our office locations in either Chicago, IL, Phoenix, AZ, or Concord, CA.</strong><p><br></p><strong>Responsibilities:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Partner with Finance, Sales, Commercial, Investments, IT and other business functions to develop data solutions while ensuring alignment to AssetMark’s business strategy and overall data strategies</li><li>Analyze business need, develop metrics, as well as design and develop reporting solutions to make the metrics available to business users</li><li>Analyze data to identify and implement new data and reporting solutions that provide meaningful insight to improve the effectiveness of business areas</li><li>Will design, develop, and maintain production database systems, tools, and applications leveraging the Microsoft SQL Server platform</li><li>Design and develop processes to extract data received from various internal and external sources, transform them into meaningful data elements relevant to the business, combine various data elements, and load them into various types of database schemas</li><li>Manage the production support for data-related processes to ensure business continuity, performance, and integrity of reports, dashboards, and other business visible data solutions</li><li>Work collaboratively with IT teams, internal business partners, and external vendors to identify, understand, implement and support new business capabilities around business intelligence</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Must have strong business and data analysis skills and be able to understand complex business processes to develop meaningful and insightful data-rich solutions that do not rely on infrastructure-heavy technology platforms</li><li>Must possess excellent communication (oral and written) and problem-solving skills</li><li>Must be self-motivated, detail-oriented and able to multi-task</li><li>Must be comfortable in a fast-paced, demanding, and dynamic work environment</li><li>Passion to analyze data to find insightful information to improve the business</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Education &amp; Experience:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Extensive experience with SQL, SQL Server 2008 R2</li><li>At least 1-3 years of relevant business intelligence experience working in the financial services, energy, marketing, advertising, mobile gaming, healthcare, biotech, retail, consumer goods, software, hardware, or related industries</li><li>Must have at least 1-3 years of experience manipulating large datasets and the ability to analyze data to develop various technology solutions</li><li>Must have experience working with various types of ETL software directly or indirectly related to business intelligence solutions. Must be familiar with visualization and reporting solutions (e.g. Tableau, Birst, MicroStrategy, Qlikview, PowerBI)</li></ul><p><br></p><em>Compensation: The Base Salary range for this position is between $70,000-$90,000. </em><p><br></p><em>This information reflects a base salary range that AssetMark reasonably expects to pay for the position based on a number of factors which may include job-related knowledge, skills, education, experience, and actual work location. This position will also be eligible for additional variable incentive compensation and competitive benefits.</em><p><br></p><em>Candidates must be legally authorized to work in the US to be considered. We are unable to provide visa sponsorship for this position.</em><p><br></p><strong>Who We Are &amp; What We Offer:</strong><p><br></p>AssetMark’s mission is centered around helping financial advisors make a difference in the lives of their clients. To help them do that, we aim to provide advisors with holistic support. We offer compelling technology that facilitates a better client experience, consulting services that ensure advisors’ businesses are running at their best and a comprehensive suite of investment solutions. AssetMark’s platform empowers advisors to provide the highest level of service possible to their clients.<p><br></p>AssetMark’s culture is driven by our mission and connected by our values; Heart, Integrity, Excellence and Respect. You will join a team that lives these values every day by doing the best and what is right in all we do and encouraging different ideas for continual success and innovation. Additionally, we offer a wide range of benefits to meet the needs of our team members and their families.<p><br></p><ul><li>Flex Time Off or Paid Time/Sick Time Off</li><li>401K – 6% Employer Match</li><li>Medical, Dental, Vision – HDHP or PPO</li><li>HSA – Employer contribution (HDHP only)</li><li>Volunteer Time Off</li><li>Career Development / Recognition</li><li>Fitness Reimbursement</li><li>Hybrid Work Schedule</li></ul><p><br></p>As an Equal Opportunity Employer, AssetMark is committed to building a diverse and inclusive workplace where everyone feels valued.

title: Infrastructure Engineer- Remote
description: Our Client, A consortium of 11 regional banks across the U.S., is seeking a Security Engineer<p><br></p><strong> Location: </strong>Chicago, IL/ Hybrid<p><br></p><strong> Position Type: </strong>Contract<p><br></p><strong><u>Duties</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li> Design, implement and operate security controls for various services in the Microsoft and Amazon cloud, with a primary focus in Azure AD.</li><li> Design and implement access control policies within Azure AD and MDM.</li><li> Occasionally provide support off-hours when business critical problems arise.</li><li> Analyze requirements and apply knowledge of business needs and security risks to determine appropriate course of action.</li><li> Collaborate with different areas of IT in order to provide security and business technology solutions for the Bank.</li><li> Development of security policy, standard, procedure and design documents.</li><li> Design, engineer, and deploy technologies for application integrations for using SAML, Open ID, or OAuth</li><li> Act as a point of escalation for issues relating to security controls or tools, including (but not limited to) SSO, MFA, certificates.</li><li> Occasionally provide support off-hours when business critical problems arise.</li></ul> <strong> Software Requirements:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li> Active Directory (On-Prem)</li><li> Azure Active Directory</li><li> CyberArk (Preferred)</li><li> Windows Servers (2016 and newer)</li><li> Azure B2C (preferred)</li><li> Azure Application Proxy (preferred)</li></ul>

title: Financial Python Developer
description: Salary: $130k-$145k + bonus<p><br></p>Location: Hybrid role in either location<p><br></p>Chicago, IL/Dallas, TX<p><br></p><strong><u>Qualifications</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Bachelor's or Master's Degrees in Computer Science, Information Systems or other related field. Or equivalent work experience.</li><li>Minimum of 5-8 years of experience in Site Reliability Engineering/DevOps</li><li>Experience managing infrastructure in public cloud environments like AWS (preferred), Azure or GCP.</li><li>Experience providing visibility using monitoring and alerting tools like Splunk, SignalFx, AppDynamics, Datadog, ELK, Prometheus or Grafana.</li><li>Experience with container orchestration systems like Kubernetes, Mesos, Docker Swarm or Rancher.</li><li>Experience with infrastructure as code and configuration management tools like Terraform, Ansible, Puppet or Chef.</li><li>Programming/Scripting experience in languages like Java, Bash, Python or Go.</li><li>Experience with distributed messaging systems like Kafka, RabbitMQ, or ActiveMQ.</li><li>Experience with using Continuous Integration and Continuous Delivery (CI/CD) tools like Jenkins, Travis, Harness, Spinnaker, Appveyor, CodeBuild or CodePipeline.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Responsibilities</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Collaborate with development, operations and infrastructure teams to ensure availability of services, and to work through implementation issues.</li><li>Develop automation for incident response and to prevent problem recurrence</li><li>Create and enhance runbooks to respond to service outages or degradations</li><li>Assess the production readiness of services</li><li>Define and track operational metrics for production performance, reliability, scalability and availability</li><li>Architect, develop and maintain shared services and tools to improve reliability and reduce toil across the organization</li><li>Contribute to the team's continuous improvement through research, retrospectives, discussion groups and code reviews</li><li>Provide leadership within the team by guiding and mentoring junior members, and preparing stories for the sprint backlog</li></ul>

title: Data Governance Analyst
description: <strong>Job Description </strong> LaSalle Network is partnered with a leading law firm, based in Chicago, that represents a diverse range of clients in various legal matters in both federal and state courts. They have a mission to achieve exceptional results for their clients, drive innovation in the practice of law and pursue excellence in everything they do.<br><br>They are seeking a <strong>Systems Integration Developer</strong> who will be responsible for ensuring the seamless operation of the firm's software and data platforms and assist attorneys and other key stakeholders with the development of scalable business processes and automated solutions.<br><br><strong><u>Systems Integration Developer Responsibilities<br></u></strong><ul><li> Develop webhook endpoints and workflows to ingest data and documents from external partners </li><li> Develop code solutions for document manipulation and internal integrations between web platforms </li><li> Respond to internal stakeholder inquiries in a timely manner and utilize skills and knowledge of applications to answer questions and solve technical problems </li><li> Work directly with attorneys and other internal users to resolve business problems </li><li> Manipulate data tables in Excel and upload spreadsheets to cloud platforms to trigger bulk actions or database updates </li><li> Actively assist in maintaining and administering the firm's cloud-based services </li><li> Contribute to software documentation, knowledgebase articles and other support materials </li><li> Program tasks to customize solutions in platforms that enable custom scripting, such as Tray.io and AWS Lambda </li><li> Develop custom scripted solutions to solve ad-hoc business problems </li><li> Manage testing scripts and run manual testing to reproduce reported issues; identify root cause of problems, then develop and implement a solution <br></li></ul><strong><u>Systems Integration Developer Requirements<br></u></strong><ul><li> Bachelor's degree preferred </li><li> 2-3 years of application support experience </li><li> Experience with Zapier, Tray.io or another integration-as-a-service platform preferred </li><li> Experience with web automation tools such as Selenium or UI.Vision preferred </li><li> Python programming experience, including manipulating PDF documents </li><li> Software integration experience, ideally accessing medical data using FHIR </li><li> Strong diagnostic and problem-solving skills </li><li> Advanced skills in Excel, including pivot tables and xlookup </li><li> Keen attention to detail and excellent organizational skills </li><li> Ability to multi-task and adapt to changes quickly </li><li> Ability to collaborate across functional teams </li><li> Proficiency with programming concepts and APIs </li><li> Strong written and verbal communication skills with the ability to communicate in both technical and non-technical language <br></li></ul>Thank you,<br><br>Mikey Dougala<br><br>Team Lead, Product &amp; Engineering Practice<br><br>LaSalle Network<br><br><strong> Keywords and Related Terms: </strong> python , systems , application developer , systems integration developer , zpier , tray.io , Iaas<br><br>LaSalle Network is an Equal Opportunity Employer m/f/d/v.<br><br>LaSalle Network is the leading provider of direct hire and temporary staffing services. For over two decades, LaSalle has helped organizations hire faster and connect top talent with opportunities, from entry-level positions to the C-suite. With units specializing in Accounting and Finance, Administrative, Marketing, Technology, Supply chain, Healthcare Revenue Cycle, Call Center, Human Resources and Executive Search. LaSalle offers staffing and recruiting solutions to companies of all sizes and across all industries. LaSalle Network is the premier staffing and recruiting firm, earning over 100 culture, revenue and industry-based awards from major publications and having its company experts regularly contribute insights on retention strategies, hiring trends and hiring challenges, and more to national news outlets.<br><br>

title: Database Systems Engineer (2-year Term)
description: We are looking for a VMware Engineer to join our multi-tenant, industry-leading, hosting team managing an environment of over 6000 hosts and over 65,000 virtual machines. You’ll apply your technical prowess and problem-solving skills to develop and maintain a robust, reliable, high-performance foundation for some of the largest healthcare organizations in the country to access our world-class software. Our multi-tenant, ever-growing environment scales through our code-first, DevOps focused culture. Spend more time automating and orchestrating and less time performing point-and-click tasks.<p><br></p>As part of Epic's hosting team, you'll enjoy opportunities to keep abreast of the latest technologies. You'll collaborate with infrastructure teams from traditional networking to storage administration to influence the design of our high-performance systems that ultimately allow healthcare providers to better do what they do best - take great care of patients. Shifted hours available. Learn more about the team at https //careers.epic.com/Jobs/Hosting.<p><br></p>As an Epic employee, you'll get to experience our state-of-the-art campus, eat delicious food, and improve healthcare for the world. We don't believe in cubicles here at Epic but instead believe that your best work is done in a spot that works for you. Whether it be working in your office, a conference room, or in our hosting facility, there are plenty of places to do important work that is helping healthcare organizations improve care for patients. Our award-winning culinary team will keep you well fed with meals prepared by top culinary talent and our sabbatical program will ensure you are able to travel to global destinations you've always wanted to visit.<p><br></p><strong>More than just important work</strong>.<p><br></p>Epic is located in Madison, Wisconsin, a city regularly ranked as one of America's best places to live. Epic's environment is one of continuous learning; you'll have access to opportunities to expand your skill set and share your knowledge with others. We offer comprehensive benefits to keep you healthy and happy as you grow in your life and career, and your merit-based compensation will reflect the impact your work has on the company and our customers. You'll also be eligible for annual raises and bonuses, as well as stock grants, which give you an even greater stake in the success of Epic and our customers. Epic is an Equal Opportunity employer. We seek diverse perspectives, backgrounds, and experiences in our mission to improve healthcare. Research has shown that job-seekers who are women, LGBTQ+, or members of the global majority are less likely to apply for roles they don't seem completely qualified for, so we encourage all who are interested to apply. Please see our full non-discrimination statement at https //careers.epic.com/EEO.<p><br></p>This position features two different starting points, based upon prior experience.<p><br></p><em>Junior VMware Engineer</em> requires 0-2 years of experience in the following<p><br></p><em>VMware Engineer</em> requires 2+ years of experience in the following<p><br></p><ul><li>Exposure to VMware vSphere</li><li>Experience or interest in scripting and automation with tools such as vSphere PowerCLI, GoLang, or Python</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Additional Requirements</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Strong individual and collaborative troubleshooting skills</li><li>Relocation to the Madison, WI area (reimbursed)</li><li>Eligibility to work in the US without visa sponsorship</li><li>COVID-19 vaccination</li></ul><p><br></p>As a member of the Hosting team at Epic you'll be responsible for the confidentiality, integrity, and availability of Epic Hosting. Those responsibilities include:<p><br></p><ul><li>Following policies and procedures and escalating when policies or procedures are not followed</li><li>Escalating potential security incidents and providing relevant information</li><li>Meeting all security responsibilities defined in policies and procedures</li></ul>
