title: Infrastructure Engineer
description: Onsite role, must be able to work without sponsorship<p><br></p>Portfolio link must be on the resume.<p><br></p><strong> Job Title: UX/UI Designer and Developer</strong><p><br></p><strong><u>Job Summary</u></strong><p><br></p>We are seeking a highly skilled UX/UI Designer and Developer to join our team. The ideal candidate would be responsible for designing and developing intuitive and visually appealing interfaces for our responsive web applications. The candidate should have experience using design tools such as Figma or Sketch, and prototyping tools such as Invision. Additionally, the candidate should be proficient in HTML, CSS, and Angular with the ability to transform design concepts into working code.<p><br></p><strong><u>Responsibilities</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li> Work collaboratively with cross-functional teams and business stakeholders to understand their requirements and design solutions that align with their needs. </li><li> Design user-centered interfaces for responsive web applications using design tools such as Figma or Sketch. </li><li> Create high-fidelity wireframes, prototypes, and visual designs that effectively communicate design concepts and user interactions. </li><li> Transform design concepts into high-quality, responsive, and cross-browser-compatible web pages using HTML, CSS, and Angular while adhering to best practices to ensure code is efficient, scalable, and maintainable. </li><li> Collaborate with developers to ensure designs are accurately implemented and facilitate a seamless handoff for functional development. </li><li> Develop and maintain style guides and design systems to integrate into our web applications. </li><li> Design custom vector icons that align with the brand and style guidelines. </li><li> Strong understanding of version control principles and proficiency in using tools such as Git to track design and development iterations. </li><li> Exhibit a strong commitment to quality and accuracy with an eye for detail and precision. </li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Required Soft Skills</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li> Communication: Ability to communicate effectively and clearly with both technical and non-technical stakeholders, including team members, and end-users. </li><li> Collaboration: Ability to work collaboratively with cross-functional teams, including designers, developers, project managers, and product owners to deliver high-quality products. </li><li> Attention to detail: Ability to pay close attention to details to ensure that designs and code are accurate, consistent, and error-free. </li><li> Creativity: Ability to think outside the box and come up with innovative and creative solutions to design and development challenges. </li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Requirements</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li> Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Human Computer Interaction, or a related field. </li><li> 5+ years of experience in UX/UI Design and Web Development. </li><li> Strong proficiency in design tools such as Figma or Sketch, and prototyping tools such as Invision. </li><li> Proficiency in front-end development technologies such as HTML, CSS, JavaScript, and Angular 13+. </li><li> Experience working with cross-functional teams in an Agile environment. </li><li> Strong problem-solving and communication skills. </li><li> Knowledge of best practices in UX/UI design and responsive web development. </li><li> Skilled in version control using Git or similar tools.</li></ul>

title: Data Analyst (Healthcare)
description: Data Scientist6 Month Contract-to-HireChicago, IL (Hybrid) This role is responsible for working on developing trade promotion forecasting, scenario generation, optimization and other models. This role will involve creating, understanding and deploying ML models for our client, developed internally in collaboration with Revenue Growth Management, Finance, and Commercial teams to incorporate learnings into a sustainable, scalable product. These models will be deployed on our client’s platform in Google Cloud while supporting the use of standard internal toolsets and libraries. This role will continue to develop machine learning and deep learning models while collaborating with the central IT team in creating best practice approaches to industrialize models, drive technical solutions in which to host models at scale and help in deploying these models. This role also needs to engage with market business processes and data experts to better understand specific market data nuances and ways in which output of the models will be consumed (e.g. dashboards, integration with other systems, etc.).<p><br></p>This role will support the following activities: Support development of the trade promotion forecasting models algorithmsPartner with Data Engineers to help extract models’ best practices and expand our client’s digital productPartner with Data Engineers to ensure that proper data is prepared for model consumptionCoordinate work activities with Business teams, other IT services and as requiredHelp hold IT team accountable for milestone deliverables to the product team and Business stakeholders.Drive the use of the Platform toolset and to also focus on 'the art of the possible' demonstrations to the business as needed.Help ensure all statistical / ML / AI methods will be developed in a ‘product’ type nature with the ability to lift and shift to other marketsRequires strong communications with RGM, Commercial Teams, and extended IT/ CDO teamsSupport large-scale experimentation and build data-driven modelsRefine requirements that will be used to train and evolve deep learning models and algorithms.Influence RGM and Commercial product teams through data-based recommendations Qualifications &amp; ExperienceDegree (Master’s or PhD strongly preferred) in computer science, applied mathematics, statistics, machine learning, or other data centric disciplines2-5 years of relevant industry work experience providing advanced analytics solutions strongly preferredAdditional experience in core analytic methods such as predictive modeling, customer segmentation/clustering, network analysis, supply chain optimization, etc.Strong programming skills in PythonExperience with cloud-based data solutions like Google Cloud Platform, AWS or AzureExperience with Google Cloud Platform technology stack for Data Analytics (Big Query, Data Warehousing, Spark/Hadoop, Dataflow) is highly valuedExperience using DevOps/Cloud Build tools for continuous integration and deploymentExperience of using Jenkins, GitHub flow and artifact repo Eight Eleven Group (Brooksource) provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, age, sex, citizenship, disability, genetic information, sexual orientation, gender identity, marital status, amnesty or status as a covered veteran in accordance with applicable federal, state, and local laws.

title: OKTA Developer - Remote
description: <strong>Passionate about precision medicine and advancing the healthcare industry?<br><br></strong>Recent advancements in underlying technology have made it possible for AI to impact clinical care in a meaningful way. Tempus' proprietary platform connects an entire ecosystem of real-world evidence to deliver real-time, actionable insights to physicians, providing critical information about the right treatments for the right patients, at the right time.<br><br>The Real-world Claims Data Scientist will be responsible for serving as the subject-matter-expert for the production, maintenance, and commercialization of Tempus’ real-world claims data product, including defining data transformations and validations, writing code to implement and maintain the data model, supporting internal and external user experience, and mentoring other analysts in performing claims-related analyses. This is a cross-functional role within Data Science working closely with Clinical Development, Product, and Engineering to ensure that Tempus real-world claims data can be utilized to its full potential by both internal and external stakeholders.<br><br><strong><u>Responsibilities<br></u></strong><ul><li>Work within an interdisciplinary team of data scientists, engineers, and clinical SMEs to define key business logic, implement data transformations/validations, and build out quality monitoring to maintain and improve a real-world claims dataset</li><li>Collaborate on data model enhancements and optimizations in productionalized SQL to facilitate development of sustainable and adaptable claims dataset</li><li>Serve as the subject-matter expert on strengths and limitations of health claims data for both internal and external users</li><li>Contribute to the development and maintenance of external-facing documentation to support use of real world claims product offering </li><li>Work closely with product and commercial teams to ensure customer needs are addressed and opportunities are appropriately prioritized </li><li>Help organize and apply customer feedback to prioritize internal development of new claims product features </li><li>Advise on the design, execution, and dissemination of results for claims-related projects for internal and external stakeholders<br></li></ul><strong><u>Required Qualifications<br></u></strong><ul><li>4+ years experience in analyzing health claims data for clinical research, health economics and outcomes research, or similar</li><li>Subject matter expertise in claims with notable experience around different reference sets &amp; coding guidelines, insurance and collection procedures, payer operations &amp; business processes, and payer/provider pipelines</li><li>Basic understanding of data schemas/models (e.g., primary/foreign key relationships)</li><li>Proficiency with basic SQL, including SELECT, FROM, WHERE, and different JOIN types</li><li>Strong analytical skills and familiarity with real world data, with fluency in either R or Python</li><li>Ability to collaborate within cross-functional teams</li><li>An eagerness to learn new technical skills and take ownership of data-focused projects &amp; initiatives<br></li></ul><strong>Suggested Qualifications</strong> (feel encouraged to apply even if not all are met):<br><ul><li>PhD (or equivalent experience) in health economics, epidemiology, statistics, or related field</li><li>Industry experience working with different streams of healthcare data (e.g., claims, EHR, etc.)</li><li>Experience working with datasets in at least one of the following areas: genetic testing, oncology, pharmaceuticals</li><li>Understanding of HIPAA and importance of privacy of patient data</li><li>Strong interpersonal skills that include excellent written and oral communicative ability, and problem solving with other departments and colleagues</li><li>Experience in generating data visualizations &amp; summarizing outcomes</li><li>A sense of humility and an eagerness to contribute to a supportive, interdisciplinary team<br></li></ul>The expected salary range below is applicable if the role is performed from [<em>New York</em>] and may vary for other locations. Actual salary may vary based on qualifications and experience. Tempus offers a full range of benefits, which may include incentive compensation, restricted stock units, medical and other benefits, depending on the position.<br><br>New York Pay Range<br><br>$120,000—$160,000 USD<br><br>The expected salary range below is applicable if the role is performed from [<em>California</em>] and may vary for other locations. Actual salary may vary based on qualifications and experience. Tempus offers a full range of benefits, which may include incentive compensation, restricted stock units, medical and other benefits, depending on the position.<br><br>California Pay Range<br><br>$120,000—$160,000 USD<br><br>We are an equal opportunity employer. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.<br><br>

title: System Engineer
description: <ul><li>Low Level Device Driver - Software Engineer****** ****Must have experience with LabView and/or TestStand used in a product based manufacturing setting******</li><li>Description:* What they do: (technology and product) - This team supports Targeting/ RF/ IRCM (all business units)<br><br></li></ul>Why it’s open:<br><ul><li>Starting to migrate to a Linux OS – do not currently have someone with driver level development<br><br></li></ul>Team Makeup:<br><br>o<br><br>5 engineers – supporting various teams/ programs across the country Day to day:<br><ul><li>Working in an Agile environment with two week sprints, participating in daily standup meetings</li><li>Primarily doing driver level development on Linux/ VxWorks using C/C++ -Starting with new hardware and doing the BSP</li><li>Creating a Linux distribution using Yocto</li><li>Work will be mostly unclassified (not requiring a clearance)</li><li>May require it when they get to integration stage</li><li>Skills:* Kernel, Linux, Rtos, device driver, VxWorks, C++, yocto, Xilinx, FPGA</li><li>Top Skills Details:* Kernel, Linux, Rtos, device driver, Vxworks, C++<br><br></li></ul>About Actalent:<br><br>Actalent connects passion with purpose. Our scalable talent solutions and services capabilities drive value and results and provide the expertise to help our customers achieve more. Every day, our experts around the globe are making an impact. We’re supporting critical initiatives in engineering and sciences that advance how companies serve the world. Actalent promotes consultant care and engagement through experiences that enable continuous development. Our people are the difference. Actalent is an operating company of Allegis Group, the global leader in talent solutions. The company is an equal opportunity employer and will consider all applications without regards to race, sex, age, color, religion, national origin, veteran status, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, genetic information or any characteristic protected by law.

title: Hybrid - .Net Developer with Azure - Chicago IL
description: TEKsystems is looking for a C# developer to help one of our clients in the Lisle area. This is a long term role and a great environment.<br><br> Location: local candidates to Chicagoland only. Team is working in office 3 days a week at this point in time .<br><br>NO ASP .Net required for this role.<br><br> 3-5 Years LEAD Experience Is Required.. <br><br>  The primary required skills are: <br><ul><li> .Net development</li><li> Visual Basic</li><li> Web development, JavaScript</li><li> SQL Server<br><br></li></ul> About TEKsystems <br><br>We're partners in transformation. We help clients activate ideas and solutions to take advantage of a new world of opportunity. We are a team of 80,000 strong, working with over 6,000 clients, including 80% of the Fortune 500, across North America, Europe and Asia. As an industry leader in Full-Stack Technology Services, Talent Services, and real-world application, we work with progressive leaders to drive change. That's the power of true partnership. TEKsystems is an Allegis Group company.<br><br>The company is an equal opportunity employer and will consider all applications without regards to race, sex, age, color, religion, national origin, veteran status, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, genetic information or any characteristic protected by law.

description: <ul><li>Looking for a new Electronics Testing position? *</li><li>I have the one for you!* My client is currently hiring for an experienced Test Engineer to develop manufacturing tests to be performed on every unit that they build to make sure it is free of manufacturing flaws. This client manufactures electronics and telematics offerings for the automotive/transportation industry, so we are in need of someone with a manufacturing test experience. This position will be using LabView, Test Stands, along with C# with the flexibility of interchanging these languages.</li><li>Responsibilities:*</li><li>Quote, Design, and Develop manufacturing test solutions for New Product Introduction</li><li>Develop software (C#, C, and NI TestStand) to control test instruments and Units Under Test in order to meet product test requirements</li><li>Demonstrate the ability to develop hardware and software for production test solutions</li><li>Experience interpreting MySQL database schema and writing database queries</li><li>Provide ongoing support for existing products related to ECOs, yield issues, reliability improvements, and other continuous improvement initiatives</li><li>Written and verbal communication skills to effectively communicate with customers, suppliers, and internal project stakeholders</li><li>Manage project scopes and timelines and coordinate initiatives with Project Managers</li><li>Collaborate with Production Engineers and Supervisors to integrate test systems into the production process</li><li>Analyze test performance data and use production personnel input to drive test improvements opportunities</li><li>Ability to develop and interpret test requirements and identify test equipment required to meet those requirements</li><li>Ability to identify, assess, and resolve hardware and software issues</li><li>Compile and interpret Gage R&amp;R and Cpk studies</li><li>Support Root Cause Analysis of field return issues and implement additional test coverage as needed</li><li>Create documentation describing test design concepts and operator instructions</li><li>Experience related to manufacturing Printed Circuit Board Assemblies</li><li>Participate in peer reviews of test solutions</li><li>Top Skills:*</li><li>Labview</li><li>C#</li><li>Test Stand</li><li>SQL</li><li>Manufacturing Test</li><li>Test Automation</li><li>Test development/design</li><li>Hardware</li><li>Experience developing test for RF or wireless devices</li><li>Employee Perks:*</li><li>Paid Weekly</li><li>Medical, Dental, Vision, 401K plans</li><li>Abenity Discount Program</li><li>Udemy Courses</li><li>Work Life Balance</li><li>PTO</li><li>Paid Holiday's</li><li>Experience Level:* 5+ years experience<br><br></li></ul>About Actalent:<br><br>Actalent connects passion with purpose. Our scalable talent solutions and services capabilities drive value and results and provide the expertise to help our customers achieve more. Every day, our experts around the globe are making an impact. We’re supporting critical initiatives in engineering and sciences that advance how companies serve the world. Actalent promotes consultant care and engagement through experiences that enable continuous development. Our people are the difference. Actalent is an operating company of Allegis Group, the global leader in talent solutions. The company is an equal opportunity employer and will consider all applications without regards to race, sex, age, color, religion, national origin, veteran status, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, genetic information or any characteristic protected by law.

title: Data Migration Engineer
description: DeepSight Technology Inc. is actively searching for a GPU Software Engineer to apply to join our amazing medical imaging team full-time in our St. Louis, MO or Santa Clara, CA office!<p><br></p>We are an innovative medical imaging company that invests in our team and offers real opportunities for career growth. This GPU Software Engineer position works 2-3 days per week at one of our US offices in the St. Louis or San Francisco Bay areas and earns a <strong>competitive salary of $60,000-$166,000 a year, based on skills, experience, and office location.</strong> We provide top-notch benefits and perks, including health, vision, dental, stock options, and a 401(k)-retirement plan.<p><br></p><strong><u>About Deepsight Technology Inc.</u></strong><p><br></p>DeepSight Technology Inc. is a stealth mode startup company that has developed breakthrough technology in ultrasound imaging. This new technology will extend both the range and clarity over current systems by 10x - 100x! We are setting new standards that will dramatically improve the capabilities of ultrasound for many years.<p><br></p>In order to develop and improve this technology, we need dedicated team players on our side. Not only do we offer a great team-oriented environment, but we also offer competitive compensation and generous benefits.<p><br></p>ARE YOU A GOOD FIT?<p><br></p>We are looking for someone who is motivated to do quality work and excited about developing state-of-the art medical technology that will impact the future of medical care. Ask yourself: Are you analytical? Are you ready for a life-changing opportunity? Are you self-motivated and goal-oriented? If so, we want to meet you!<p><br></p>WHAT WE NEED FROM YOU AS A GPU SOFTWARE ENGINEER<p><br></p>As our GPU Software Engineer, you take pride in your role in developing a fast, efficient data flow and algorithms for our advanced ultrasound systems. Being a team player, you enjoy working with our transducer, hardware, and systems teams as you work to optimize our system prototype and product designs. You utilize your robust knowledge and skillset to assist in developing the software architecture and efficient fast algorithms of our next-generation, high-quality medical imaging systems. Additionally, you utilize C/C++ and CUDA to design our imaging pipeline and implement its components. At the end of the day, you enjoy the variety that each day brings, and are proud of the work you do that ultimately leads to future medical imaging advancements. If you can do this and meet the following requirements, apply today!<p><br></p><strong><u>Responsibilities</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Implement complex algorithms from concept or prototypes</li><li>Improve speed and efficiency of image reconstruction algorithms</li><li>Work collaboratively with image reconstruction algorithm researchers</li><li>Maintain detailed design documentation</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Education And Experience Minimum Requirements</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>BS in an engineering or computer science field </li><li>5 or more years of experience in commercial software development</li><li>Experience in concurrent/parallel programming-multithreading, multiprocessing, GPU acceleration (CUDA, CuPy, Numba, OpenCL)</li><li>Passionate about medical devices, with excellent communication and teamwork skills</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Desired Skills And Experience</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Knowledge of digital signal processing , image processing, or image reconstruction</li><li>Proficiency with C++ programming and multi-threaded applications</li><li>Knowledge in medical imaging (Ultrasound, PET, SPECT, CT, MR, etc.) and developing software in the medical industry (FDA regulated)</li><li>Expertise in ultrasound physics, signal and image processing, beamforming, transducer optimization, simulation, algorithm development, or tool development</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><em>Job Posted by ApplicantPro</em></strong>

title: .NET Core Developer with SQL
description: Job Details Job Title: Power BI Location: Des Plaines, IL Duration: 6+ Months (Possibility of extension) Pay Rate: $46 Job Description: Duties : This position is to support the BI reports and visualizations for the existing Global Supply Chain Business System organization through the development of database tools for the organizations we support. The ideal candidate will have the ability to use critical thinking to develop available data into tools that best support the business needs. The candidate for this position should have the following skill sets: Cognos Report Development (ability to write code to build reports directly or through Cognos) SQL Query Development experience These additional skills would be helpful in working with the existing subject matter experts in the development and execution of business tools or processes: Proficient in Power BI Dashboarding and Report Development, including DAX development. Relational Database Development Experience Microsoft Office Tools The primary role will be to learn and develop tools to support the routine business processes and recommend solutions to support the business. This role will be used to produce and post routine reports and then automate the report generation. This role is full time and is expected to be on site initially. Once the skills and capability have been established, then limited remote working options can be considered

title: Infrastructure Engineer
description: SYNERGISTICIT is aware that the Job Market is Challenging because of Tech Layoffs due to which The Job market is flooded with hundreds and thousands of laid off Jobseekers who are competing with existing Jobseekers. For entry level Job seekers to get client interviews and jobs they need to differentiate themselves by ensuring they have exceptional skills and technologies to be noticed by clients.   <br>  <br>    Since 2010 we have helped Jobseekers differentiate themselves by providing the clients with candidates who have the requisite skills and experience to outperform at interviews and clients. Here at SynergisticIT We just don't focus on getting you a Job we make careers.<br> <br> All Positions are open for all visas and US citizens<br> <br> We at Synergisticit understand the problem of the mismatch between employer's requirements and Employee skills and that's why since 2010 we have helped thousands of candidates get jobs at technology clients like apple, google, Paypal, western union, Client, visa, walmart labs etc to name a few.<br> <br> We have an excellent reputation with the clients. Currently, We are looking for entry-level software programmers, Java Full stack developers, Python/Java developers, Data analysts/ Data Scientists, Machine Learning engineers.<br> <br> Who Should Apply Recent Computer science/Engineering /Mathematics/Statistics or Science Graduates looking to make their careers in IT Industry<br> <br> We welcome candidates with all visas and citizens to apply.<br> <br> <strong> We assist in filing for STEM extension and also for H1b and Green card filing to Candidates </strong>   <br> <br>    We also offer Skill enhancement programs for candidates who are either missing skills or are lacking Industry/Client experience with Projects and skills. Candidates having difficulty in finding jobs or cracking interviews or who wants to improve their skill portfolio. If they are qualified with enough skills and have hands on project work at clients then no need for skill enhancement.   <br> <br> <u>   Candidates can benefit from skill enhancement if they fall into the below categories.   </u> <br> <br>    <strong> Candidates who Lack Experience or are freshers with No actual on Job experience with projects with clients<br></strong> <strong> Have had a break in careers<br></strong> <strong> Lack Technical Competency or skills being demanded by clients<br></strong> <strong> Different visa candidates (Like OPT/H4EAD/L2EAD )who want to get employed and settle down in the USA<br></strong> <br> <strong> <u> please check the below links to see success outcomes of our candidates</u> </strong>    <br> <br>  <strong> <br>  <br>    For getting help with interviews please visit    <br>  <br>  <strong>   https://www.synergisticit.com/interview-questions/  </strong> <br>  <br>  <strong>    REQUIRED SKILLS For Java /Software Programmers   <br></strong>  <ul> 	<li>   Bachelors degree or Masters degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Electrical Engineering, Information     Systems, IT  </li> 	<li>   Highly motivated, self-learner, and technically inquisitive  </li> 	<li>   Experience in programming language Java and understanding of the software development life cycle  </li> 	<li>   Project work on the skills  </li> 	<li>   Knowledge of Core Java , javascript , C++ or software programming  </li> 	<li>   Spring boot, Microservices, Docker, Jenkins and REST API's experience  </li> 	<li>   Excellent written and verbal communication skills  </li> </ul>  <br> <strong>    For data Science/Machine learning   <br></strong>     REQUIRED SKILLS   <ul> 	<li>   Bachelors degree or Masters degree description: SAS Programmer Location:<p><br></p>HYBRID W/ ONSITE REQUIREMENT – 3 days onsiteElk Grove Village, IL 60007 We are effectively looking for a SAS programmer who is interested in testing and helping establish a SAS testing environment. title: Client Success Data Analyst
description: <ul><li>Description:* This company manufactures electronics and telematics offerings for the automotive/transportation industry.</li><li>Responsibilites:*</li><li>Quote, Design, and Develop manufacturing test solutions for New Product Introduction</li><li>Develop software (C#, C, and NI TestStand) to control test instruments and Units Under Test in order to meet product test requirements</li><li>Demonstrate the ability to develop hardware and software for production test solutions</li><li>Experience interpreting MySQL database schema and writing database queries</li><li>Provide ongoing support for existing products related to ECOs, yield issues, reliability improvements, and other continuous improvement initiatives</li><li>Written and verbal communication skills to effectively communicate with customers, suppliers, and internal project stakeholders</li><li>Manage project scopes and timelines and coordinate initiatives with Project Managers</li><li>Collaborate with Production Engineers and Supervisors to integrate test systems into the production process</li><li>Analyze test performance data and use production personnel input to drive test improvements opportunities</li><li>Ability to develop and interpret test requirements and identify test equipment required to meet those requirements</li><li>Ability to identify, assess, and resolve hardware and software issues</li><li>Compile and interpret Gage R&amp;R and Cpk studies</li><li>Support Root Cause Analysis of field return issues and implement additional test coverage as needed</li><li>Create documentation describing test design concepts and operator instructions</li><li>Experience related to manufacturing Printed Circuit Board Assemblies</li><li>Participate in peer reviews of test solutions</li><li>Skills:* Labview, C#, Test Stand, SQL, Manufacturing Test, Test Automation, Test development, Test design, Test procedure, Hardware, Debug, Test Fixture, Production, Manufacturing, Lab, Validation, Test plan, Test engineering, Electrical, Test equipment, Write test scripts</li><li>Top Skills Details:* Labview</li><li>Additional Skills &amp; Qualifications:*</li><li>5+ years experience</li><li>Labview</li><li>Test Stand</li><li>C# or other Object oriented languages within test and instrumentation</li><li>Test fixtures/test stands;</li><li>SQL or MySQL PLUS</li><li>Automotive is a plus not required though.</li><li>Experience developing tests for RF or wireless devices (i.e. Cellular, GPS, Bluetooth, WiFi)</li><li>Experience Level:* Intermediate Level<br><br></li></ul>About Actalent:<br><br>Actalent connects passion with purpose. Our scalable talent solutions and services capabilities drive value and results and provide the expertise to help our customers achieve more. Every day, our experts around the globe are making an impact. We’re supporting critical initiatives in engineering and sciences that advance how companies serve the world. Actalent promotes consultant care and engagement through experiences that enable continuous development. Our people are the difference. Actalent is an operating company of Allegis Group, the global leader in talent solutions. The company is an equal opportunity employer and will consider all applications without regards to race, sex, age, color, religion, national origin, veteran status, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, genetic information or any characteristic protected by law.

title: Infrastructure Engineer
description: <ul><li>Be apart of sports and technology company expanding massively |Work on greenfield developments with a collaborative team<br><br><br></li></ul><strong>About Our Client<br><br></strong>The client focuses on Youth Sports and Development. The offer a robust platform that organizes national events, practice and game schedules as well as individual athletes data. Having experienced tremendous growth in recent years they are looking for a Senior Software Engineer to play a key role in continuing to grow their platform.<br><br>They're currently the leading provider of technology solutions for all of the youth sports team in the US, operating web and mobile platforms with over 1M on boarded users. They have a clear career path with a chance to grow within the company to a managerial or leader role. They develop greenfield projects designed to enhance the experience of youth athletes and simplify the process of scheduling and making payments for their parents.<br><br>This is a hybrid opportunity with commute to the office required once a week.<br><br><strong>Job Description<br><br></strong><ul><li>Write clean, scalable code using React Native</li><li>Utilize front-end web technologies to create interactive user experiences</li><li>Develop SQL Database-driven web interfaces</li><li>Create and test prototype when needed</li><li>Develop client displays and user interfaces in Fullstack capacity</li><li>Use, rework and adapt existing web application for mobile apps <br><br></li></ul><em>MPI does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, national origin, age, disability, veteran status, marital status, or based on an individual's status in any group or class protected by applicable federal, state or local law. MPI encourages applications from minorities, women, the disabled, protected veterans and all other qualified applicants.<br><br></em><strong>The Successful Applicant<br><br></strong><ul><li>4 + years of software development experience</li><li>Experience coding in React native</li><li>Experience working on Mobile applications</li><li>Strong attention to detail, looks to input creative solutions to help minimize excess redundancies </li><li>Experience with SQL databases - either relational and/or non-relational experience </li><li>Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science or related field</li><li>Experience working with REST APIs</li><li>Clear documentation <br><br></li></ul><strong>What's On Offer<br><br></strong><ul><li> Salary ranging from $125k-$165k</li><li> On-boarding period to help the transition run smoothly</li><li> 401k with 4% company match. No waiting period for matching</li><li> Strong health/dental/vision packages offered</li><li> Unlimited PTO with flex time</li><li> Collaborative team environment</li><li> Unlimited growth potential with career path laid out</li><li> Performance bonus and equity.<br><br></li></ul><strong>Contact: Connor Whitman<br><br></strong><strong>Quote job ref: JN-052023-6056948</strong>
industry: IT Services and IT Consulting, Software Development, and Computer and Network Security

title: Security Engineer
description: <strong>Are you searching for a rewarding experience helping children and families reach their goals and full potential? If you are passionate about improving the lives of children and adolescents on the autism spectrum, apply now! Key Autism is hiring motivated and passionate professionals, both experienced and entry level to join our growing team! We provide an in-depth ABA training to assist with growth and knowledge of the field and providing impeccable services to our families.</strong><p><br></p><strong>We are looking for part time Behavioral Technicians to work in our center!</strong><p><br></p><strong>Currently hiring for afternoon shifts</strong><p><br></p><strong><u>Must Have Experience</u></strong><p><br></p><strong>Hourly payrate is $20 to $26 based on overall experience</strong><p><br></p><strong><u>Behavior Therapist Job Responsibilities</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Provide one on one (1:1) in-home Applied Behavioral Analysis (ABA) therapy</li><li>Collect behavior and skill acquisition data during sessions</li><li>Conduct discrete trials, implement behavior support, and treatment plans</li><li>Work collaboratively with a BCBA (Board Certified Behavior Analyst) Supervisor to implement basic principles and teaching procedures of ABA therapy</li><li>Be responsive to the needs and requests of clients, their families and supervisors</li><li>Be goal-oriented and maintain professionalism in all aspects of your work</li><li>Arrive on time and be prepared for therapy sessions</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Growth Opportunities In The Field Of ABA</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Flexible Schedules </li><li>Competitive hourly rates, incentive programs, and bonuses</li><li>A Rewarding Career: Helping kids achieve their goals!</li><li>Behavior Therapist New-Hire Skills Training </li><li>Tuition discount with our Partners! </li><li>RBT certification and aspiring BCBA program (Supervision and Mentoring)</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Behavior Technician Requirements</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Education: High School Diploma or Bachelor's Degree (preferred), or RBT</li><li>Experience: Childcare, healthcare, or mental health</li><li>Dependability: Consistency and reliability s crucial for child's success</li><li>Integrity: You will work in the child's home without constant supervision</li><li>Positivity and Patience: It's all about positive reinforcement and repetition</li><li>Communication: Excellent written and verbal communication in English</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Physical Requirements</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Ability to up to 35lbs. </li><li>Required to perform activities that entail fine and gross motor skills, bend, kneel, and squat, sitting on floor or in a chair, or standing for periods of time. </li><li>Ability to respond quickly in short distance (100 feet) in response to the movement and behaviors of children. </li><li>Willingness and ability to work in both indoor and outdoor settings.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>About Us</u></strong><p><br></p>Key Autism provides services to children and adults throughout the states of Massachusetts, Georgia, North Carolina, Florida, Colorado, Illinois, and Texas. Services include programs for children with Autism Spectrum Disorder and other related conditions. We have been serving families since 2014. At Key we work as compassionate partners with individuals, families, case managers and other professionals to provide the level of support needed to improve the lives of the clients we serve.<p><br></p>At Key Autism Services, all the autism treatment services we provide are guided by a common philosophy about the role of the family in a child's development. We strive to equip both the children and their families with necessary skills for strong, satisfying relationships with one another, because we know that learning happens best when it happens in the context of playful, reciprocal interactions with life partners.<p><br></p>We believe family is the foundation for a child's development. Family is the ever-present guiding force in a child's life from the first breath through all the growing-up years. Family doesn't close for the holidays, go on vacation or call it quits at five o'clock. Family remains a persistent presence on a day-in, day-out basis, through all the seasons of the year, through all the years of childhood.<p><br></p>Our team is committed to helping individuals and their families become self-sufficient and live as independently as their abilities allow. We hire compassionate, highly trained and dedicated individuals who show a passion to contribute their skills to make our client healthier and stronger.<p><br></p><strong><em>Check out more opportunities we have to offer! </em></strong>https://www.keyautismservices.com/careers/

title: Entry Level Coder/Programmer/Data Scientist/Analyst
description: <strong>Want to be a part of our team?<br><br></strong>Provides technical support to field engineers, technicians, and product support personnel who are diagnosing, troubleshooting, repairing, and debugging complex electro/mechanical equipment, computer systems, complex software, or networked and/or wireless systems.<br><br>Responds to situations where first-line product support has failed to isolate or fix problems in malfunctioning equipment or software. Reports design, reliability, and maintenance problems or bugs to design engineering/software engineering. May be involved in customer installation and training.<br><br>Provides support to customers/users where the product is highly technical or sophisticated in nature.<br><br><strong>Working at NTT<br><br></strong>The MS Engineer is responsible for providing a service to clients by proactively identifying and resolving technical incidents and problems. Through preemptive service incident and resolution activities, as well as product reviews, operational improvements, operational practices, and quality assurance this role will maintain a high level of service to clients. Their primary objective is to ensure zero missed service level agreement (SLA) conditions .The MS Engineer s responsible for managing tickets of low to high complexity.<br><br><strong>Key Roles and Responsibilities:<br></strong><ul><li>Ensure that assigned infrastructure at the client site is configured, installed, tested, and operational</li><li>Perform necessary checks, apply monitoring tools and respond to alerts</li><li>Identify problems and errors prior to or when it occurs and log all such incidents in a timely manner with the required level of detail</li><li>Assist in analyzing, assigning, and escalating support calls</li><li>Investigate third line support calls assigned and identify the root cause of incidents and problems</li><li>Report and escalate issues to 3rd party vendors if necessary</li><li>Provide onsite technical support to clients and provide field engineering services to clients</li><li>Conduct a monthly random review of incidents and service requests, analyze and recommend improvement in quality</li><li>Provide continuous feedback to clients and affected parties and update all systems and/or portals as prescribed by NTT</li><li>Proactively identify opportunities for work optimization including opportunities for automation of work<br><br></li></ul><strong>Knowledge, Skills, and Attributes:<br></strong><ul><li>Ability to communicate and work across different cultures and social groups</li><li>Ability to plan activities and projects well in advance, and takes into account possible changing circumstances</li><li>Ability to maintain a positive outlook at work</li><li>Ability to work well in a pressurized environment</li><li>Ability to work hard and put in longer hours when it is necessary</li><li>Ability to apply active listening techniques such as paraphrasing the message to confirm understanding, probing for further relevant information, and refraining from interrupting</li><li>Ability to adapt to changing circumstances</li><li>Ability to place clients at the forefront of all interactions, understanding their requirements, and creating a positive client experience throughout the total client journey<br><br></li></ul><strong>Academic Qualifications<br></strong><ul><li>Advanced diploma, degree, or relevant qualification in IT/Computing (or demonstrated equivalent work experience)<br><br></li></ul><strong>Required Experience:<br></strong><ul><li>Demonstrated work experience</li><li>Demonstrated experience required in Engineering function within a medium to large ICT organization</li><li>Demonstrated experience of Managed Services</li><li>Demonstrated working knowledge of ITIL processes</li><li>Demonstrated experience working with vendors and/or 3rd parties<br><br></li></ul><strong>What will make you a good fit for the role?</strong>

title: Site Reliability Engineer
description: <strong>ABOUT US</strong>:<br><br>Braintrust is a user-owned talent network that connects you with great jobs with no fees or membership costs—so you keep 100% of what you earn.<br><br><strong>ABOUT THE HIRING PROCESS:<br><br></strong>When you join Braintrust, you will be invited to a screening process for Braintrust to learn more about your previous work experiences. Once completed, you will have access to the employer for this role and other top companies that seek high-quality talent. Apply to this job to kick off the process.<br><ul><li>JOB TYPE: Freelance, Contract Position (no agencies/C2C - see notes below)</li><li>LOCATION: Remote - United States only (TimeZone: CST | Partial overlap)</li><li>HOURLY RANGE: Our client is looking to pay $90 – $110/hr</li><li>ESTIMATED DURATION: 40h/week - Long term<br><br></li></ul><strong>THE OPPORTUNITY<br><br></strong><strong>Requirements:<br></strong><ul><li>Minimum of 2 years of relevant work experience.</li><li>Proficient in Python programming language.</li><li>Strong understanding of APIs and their implementation.</li><li>Experience with Linux scripting and system administration.</li><li>Familiarity with CI/CD methodologies and tools.</li><li>Extensive knowledge of cloud technologies, particularly AWS (e.g., Lambdas, ECS).</li><li>Hands-on experience with Docker and DevOps practices.</li></ul> <strong><strong>What you’ll be working on<br><br></strong></strong>Our client is seeking a<strong> Junior Systems Enginee</strong>r to join the team and contribute to the development and enhancement of their developer enablement platform.
